loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last year. 

For many days Sobia's husband's rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore Sobia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help her husband continue his business. Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the rickshaw her husband drives for a living

loans.name: Amtul Hafeez

texts.en:
Amtul Hafeez is 34 years old and is the mother of 3 children.  She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She sews the bags along with her husband and daughter at home and the business is operated out of her home. She has 2 sewing machines for sewing handbags, which she operates with her daughter. Her husband deals with customers, taking orders from them and sewing the bags on order.

She wants to buy an additional sewing machine for sewing bags but does not have enough cash on hand. Therefore, Amtul Hafeez has requested a Kiva loan through field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy a new sewing machine and additional raw material, such as rexine, zipper, buckles, etc., for sewing bags. Her desire is to sell her bags directly on the market, so that she can get maximum reward for her efforts. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and raw material for sewing handbags.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is 44 years old and the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife who looks after her family at home. Her husband sells dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household expenses from his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with an even tone that is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income. So, Nusrat requested a loan. In this way she can support her husband's business. Nusrat thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk sale business.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is age 42 and the mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal, fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources of income to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. So, Jameela requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling. Jameela is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 30-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. Her husband has been running a clothing shop in the market. He supports his family through his clothing business. He purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in his shop. He sells a variety of ladies' and gents' clothes in the shop.

 He needs to purchase different types of clothes for reselling, but due to insufficient financial resources he is unable to purchase a new variety of clothes. Therefore, Zahida is applying for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is a 54-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a nurse by profession. Her husband has been running a general store for one year. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Shahida's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, cooking oil, milk and other consumer items for his business. However, due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling. 

Therefore, Shahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some commodities such as sugar, rice, tea and cooking oil for her husband's business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 52-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family at home, as she is a good housewife. Her elder son provides services in painting work to buildings and shops. In this regard her son was in need of some painting-related items, such as paints of different colors, brushes, turpentine, etc. for continuing his work. So Naseem made a contact with BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Brac Pakistan issued her a loan so that her son would be able to purchase paints, brushes, turpentine, etc. Naseem is so very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase paints, brushes, turpentine, etc. for painting work.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan lives in Karachi, Pakistan with his family. He is a very hardworking and 25 years old young man. He is a retailer for his profession. He owns a small retail shop in his community market.  He offers a variety of products to his clients like, sugar, rice, biscuits and milk. 

Presently he wants to purchase milk packs to sell. However due to lack of money he is facing problems. Therefore Adnan has requested for a loan from KIVA'a partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase milk to sell. 

Adnan is thankful to KIVA lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase milk packs to sell.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra is responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for twenty years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his Taxi because the current condition of his Taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Sughra has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Sughra's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Sughra  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Sughra is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To make expanse on her husband's Taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 37 year old and married women. She has 4 children and she is house wife .Her husband  is running a small general store.He is good in dealing with customers and earn profitable income to bear household expenditures. He offers various goods of daily use.

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Rukhsana has applied for Kiva loan from its partner BRAC Pakistan.This loan  will help him to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand of customers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive for her husband and will bring positive changes in his business.

loans.use: to buy Different types of Consumer products and comodities for her husband,s Business

loans.name: Danish

texts.en: Danish is a very hardworking and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Karachi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife and all of his children are students. Since 2002 he has been running a water drilling machine shops, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently he needs to purchase more products for his shop but he finds it difficult due to a lack of finances. Danish has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase water drilling machine to sell. He wishes to provide quality education for his children. He is very much thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase water drilling machine to sell.

loans.name: Shagir

texts.en: Mr. Shagir is a 42-years-old man who lives with his family in Karachi, Pakistan. Shagir has been running his own tailoring store near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his shop including an over lock machine and clothing. But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to increase his income but it will also increase his net savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase an over lock machine and a clothings.

Currently he needs to purchase electric fans and refrigerators for his shop but he finds it difficult due to a lack of finances. Noshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase fans and refrigerators to sell. He wishes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

texts.en:
Mr. Sarwar is a 41-year-old married man and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, living in Karachi, Pakistan. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 1997, Kashif produce metal goods and sell them in the main market. This is the only source of income for his family. 

Currently he is in need of purchasing more metal sheets to produce metal goods like nuts, rods, stoppers etc. However due to financial constrains he finds it difficult. For that reason, he has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He desires to provide quality education to his children. He is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purcahse metal sheets to sell.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 22 years old and a married woman and the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan . Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his Taxi. He has been driving a taxi for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Sadia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan . He wants to buy new tires with some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Sadia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To Maintaine his husband Taxi

loans.name: Nomi

texts.en:
Nomi is 35 year,s old and married women , she lived in Rawalpindi. She having 5 children. Nomi had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Nine years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.

 Nomi has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate an healthier source of income.She dreams of providing better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: Talloring

loans.name: Jawairia

texts.en:

She is needs different kinds of goods e.g Needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil and etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Jawairia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 29-year-old married woman and she lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan . She has been doing business of tailoring for many years to contribute the income for house hold. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet their expenses. That's why she started tailoring business . 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses. Now she requested for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan  to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 
Sobia is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy some products for her business use i.e clothes, threds, nidles and etc.

That,s why Nagina applied the loan form Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to get buy more relevant accessories for his son,s academy to increase his son,s academy. Nagina hope this loan is very useful for his son and is family. Nagina is very thankful to Kiva Partner BRAC Pakistan .

Ruqaya's husband wants to buy different types of merchandises e.g. needles, threads, pieces of clothes etc for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial resources he is not in suitable position to buy these merchandises to fulfill the needs of his business. Yasin wants to expand the size of his business to provide quality ice cream and other eatable items to regular customers; therefore he needs financial assistance to increase the size of his business. He applied for Kiva S.E.P loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan he can enable himself to expand his business, this will be good for him to earn maximum profit and make savings to fulfill his business needs in future. Yasin is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of flavours and other accessories for his ice cream parlor business.

Shahbaz wants to expand his business to fulfill the demands of his customers for this purpose he needs to buy different types of merchandises e.g pieces of wood in bulk cutter blades needles and other relevant tools and accessories. But due to financial constraints he is not in position to buy these merchandises.
Therefore he has requested for Kiva S.E.P loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to expand the size of his business and helpful for him to buy the relevant merchandises for his business.
Shahbaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of woods for his carpentry business purpose.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 34 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her 5 children. Her husband has been working in public sector organization for many years, he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Shahida is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the house hold.

 
She is needs different kinds of goods e.g Needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil and etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some products for her business use i.e clothes, threds, nidles and etc.

loans.name: Arslan

texts.en:
Arslan is 26 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Hyderabad, Pakistan; He has been running his own shop of cosmetics for past four years.
He want to purchase different kinds of cosmetics for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial resources he is not in suitable position to buy above these merchandises to fulfill the business needs. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable him to buy these items so that he can fulfill the demands of his regular customers.
On this financial support Arslan is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics for his business purpose.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 42 years old woman, and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall, he sells different types of eatable items e.g samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha and etc. He is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage house hold.


Parveen's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position he is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.
Therefore Parveen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose.

loans.use: Resturant

loans.name: Soomar

texts.en:
Soomar is 53 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Hyderabad, Pakistan; with his family. By profession he is a milk seller, he has been running his business for pat twelve years.
He want to purchase different types  of business relevant merchandises e.g. shopping bags, counters desk chair and deep freezer but due to insufficient financial resources he is not in such condition to these accessories. Therefore he has applied for kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable him to fulfill the needs of his business.
On this financial support Soomar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase different types  of business relevant merchandises e.g. shopping bags, counters desk chair and deep freezer

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is 41 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Hyderabad, Pakistan; with his family. He has been running a general store in the locality for past five years. He wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and a refrigerator for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable himself to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 
Hussain is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of retail consumer goods for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran is 42 years old active borrower of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of two children and by profession he is a owner of a fan's shop, he has been running his business for eight years. Imran wants to buy distribution ship for business expansion purpose and to buy different qualities of fans for reselling purpose, so that he can fulfill the demands of his daily customers and provide better retail services of fans, but due to financial problems he is not in such position to bear these expanses.
Therefore he has applied for Kiva SEP loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to afford all relevant expanses in the expansion of his business and buy the above relevant items to fulfill his customers needs. On this financial assistance Imran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fans distribution from fans company.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is 37 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Hyderabad, Pakistan; By profession he is a retailer of ice cream shop, he has been doing his own business of ice cream selling for two years.
He want to buy different types of ice creams for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial resources he is not in such condition to buy these merchandises to fulfill the needs of his retail business. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will help him to buy ice creams for reselling purpose so that he can fulfill the needs of his customers.
Adnan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of icecreams for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Mithal

texts.en:
Mithal is 47 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Hyderabad, Pakistan; with his family. By profession he is a milk seller, he has been running his business for pat fifteen years.
He want to purchase different types  of business relevant merchandises e.g. shopping bags, counters desk chair and deep freezer but due to insufficient financial resources he is not in such condition to these accessories. Therefore he has applied for kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable him to fulfill the needs of his business.
On this financial support Mithal is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of accessories and supporting goods for his Milk shop business.

loans.name: Mahinder

texts.en: Mahinder is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two school-aged children. Since he turned 17, after leaving school, he has been working in agriculture. He also works as a field worker at a banana company. With this income he provides for his family. Mahinder is planting only on rented plots and wants to have his own plots. With his business skills, he can save for his own plots. He does business with Seva MFI, because he had no capital to do business with other financial institutions. Mahinder asks Seva MFI for a loan of SRD 10,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a 35-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. 

Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Manzooran, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Manzooran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits such as apples, bananas, oranges, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Radjinderpersad

texts.en: Radjinderpersad is 57 years old and lives with his wife. His children are already married and live separately. Radjinderpersad has been cultivating rice for many years. He is planting only on his own land and when he gets the opportunity to buy even one plot he would like to do it. Since he does business with Seva MFI, he does not need to worry about fertilizer. He buys fertilizers and seed on time. Radjinderpersad approached Seva MFI again for a loan of SRD 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 49 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Karachi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children and by profession she is owner of small manufacturing concern of X-2 Shopping bags, she has been doing her business for past eight years.
She has to buy new X-2 machine for shopping bags producing purpose, but due to insufficient financial resources she is unable to buy it. Therefore she has applied for kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will assist her to buy X-2 shopper machine to fulfill her business needs.
On this financial assistance Rabia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy x2 shopper machine for his small manufecturing concern.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 42-year-old woman living in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of five children.  Her elder son is a rickshaw driver by profession.  He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last seven years.   

His rickshaw has not been working properly for several days, which means he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible, but due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.  Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her elder son cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw, which will help him to continue his business.  Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for auto rickshaw repairs.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan and good business woman in her locality, she deals in fashion materials and mehendi selling accessories, she has been doing her business for past eight years. She also support her husband to manage the house hold.
Naheed has to purchase different types of fashion materials, mehandi tubes and its packing material she also want to purchase different types of colorful chemical for mehandi making purpose to upgrade her business in the market but due to some financial constraints she is unable to buy above these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan this will enable herself to buy these merchandises to fulfill the needs of her business.
On this financial support Naheed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy mehandi  its packing material and other colour chemicals.

loans.name: Rasheed

texts.en:
Rasheed is 44 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of six children, he lives in Karachi, Pakistan; with his family. By profession he is carpenter, he has been running his own business of carpentry for past 25 years.
He wants to buy  pieces of wood and other tools for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to buy these merchandises. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. with the help of this loan he can purchase the relevant items for his business purpose and earn profitable income to meet the daily needs of family and business.
on this financial support Rasheed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ply wood for his carpentering business purpose.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 31 years old, married and a housewife who studied up to grade seven. She lives in the small village of Raipara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband Dinesh and two children (one daughter and one son). Both the children are students and are in grade nine and grade seven.  Her husband Dinesh, age 43, is a farmer. 

Parbati 's husband is engaged in agriculture.  He grows beans, chilies and different kinds of vegetables on his ancestral land.  His wife Parbati also helps him in his work. In this way, he manages to cover some of the home expenses with the profits he makes. But it is hardly sufficient to manage his children's education, after covering the household expenses of the four-member family. So they decided to start potato cultivation on their farmland.

Parbati heard that BJS gives loans to rural women to start a business and has taken a loan from them . She plans to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to start potato cultivation. They have chosen this business because it is a profitable business and they hope to give their customers better service, make more profits and improve the family's quality of life.

She aspires to make a concrete-made house for them to live in. She is grateful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for lending them the loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and fertilizers to cultivate.

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
Begum is a 41-year-old woman who is a housewife and lives with her husband and two daughters in the small village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Her husband is a cycle-van puller.  Both Begum and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names, but they are providing education to their two daughters with great difficulties.  They have their own small house.

Begum's husband is a cycle-van puller.He delivers goods and vegetables to the market shops and earns livelihood for his family.  The villagers also use his van as a means of transport in the village and pay the traveling charges to him. He is the only source of income for the family. He hires and pays rent on a cycle van from a local owner, so he is unable to make sufficient income.

Begum is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase their own cycle-van to generate more income. She has chosen this business because the demand for cycle vans is very high in their area.  Their high volume of work will create a steady income and it will make it possible for her to purchase an auto-rickshaw from the profit of her business.

Begum is taking out the loan to prove that it is not too difficult to overcome financial hurdles if financial assistance is received and utilize in a proper way.
She gives her hearty thanks to the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for business purposes.

loans.name: Rayan

texts.en:
Rayan is 24 years old and lives together with his parents and wife. He works as a field worker for a banana company. Since his marriage, his income has not been enough to provide for his family. In 2013, with support from Seva MFI, Rayan started planting rice on rental plots to increase his income.

Rayan is requesting a 12,000 SRD loan from Seva MFI to plant 20 hectares of rice, as he doesn’t have enough money. He will use his loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. Rayan’s goal is to have his own tractor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Bisnoe

texts.en:
Bisnoe is 58 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He has a truck which he uses to provide transportation services. As his children grew, Bisnoe’s spending rose up. In order to fulfill his duty as father, he started planting rice with the help of Seva MFI. 

Bisnoe is requesting another 10,000 SRD loan form Seva MFI to purchase fertilizer and pesticide. His future goal is to make much profit so he can save for his children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Lipi

texts.en:
Lipi is 29 years old and a married housewife. She has one son who is studying in grade 5. Both Lipi and her husband have received education up to grades 9 and 8 respectively. She lives in a small town of Maynaguri.

By occupation her husband is a mason. He works as a helper under a contractor. But his income is so scanty the he cannot cover the household expenses and the educational expenses of his son. 
 
Now Lipi’s husband wants to start his own mason business. For that he needs equipment like wood, a spade, a sieve, a chisel, etc. Lipi came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can take a loan to purchase the necessary materials for centering houses for her husband’s mason business. Now her husband will start his own mason work and will be able to run the family without any financial hurdles. Lipi hopes her husband will get more work and with the profit from the business she will lead a stable life and give her child a good education.

Lipi is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials for centering houses for her husband’s mason business.

loans.name: Sumati

texts.en:
Sumati is a 25-year-old housewife who lives with her husband, Santosh, who is 50 years old. They have three children. Among them, two children are studying in grade 12 and 8 and one child is too small to go to school. He is only four years old.
 
By profession her husband is a farmer. He grows different kinds of vegetables and sells them in the local market. Now she wishes to cultivate broad beans in her own land to generate more income. They have their own land and experience in the agricultural field. Sumati is confident that she will be able to grow her business so that she took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate broad beans. 

She hopes she can improve her family’s financial status with the profit that would be generated by this new cultivation. She dreams to build a concrete house for her family with the profit she would gain.

Sumati is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for helping her to be self-sufficient.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate broad beans.

loans.name: Pampa

texts.en:
Pampa is a 26-year-old housewife from the small village of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri District. She lives with her husband and two children. She and her husband both received very little education until grade 5 and 8 only. Both of their children are too small to go to school. Both of them are very ambitious and want to give a good life to their children.

They have their own land where her husband cultivates different vegetables and crops in different seasons and supplies those items to the wholesale market. Now she plans to take a loan to invest in potato cultivation by buying necessary supplies like potato seeds, fertilizers, urea and more. 

Enterprising and knowledgeable, Pampa decided to plant potatoes because potatoes are a year round crop and a very popular vegetable. Potatoes are used in most of the Indian dishes. She knows she can earn more profit with this business. Her future plan is to improve her financial condition and to extend her business. She dreams of building a concrete house for her family with the profit she will gain from her business.

She thanks BJS and Kiva equally for their great support.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, urea and other supplies for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Bulbuli

texts.en:
Bulbuli is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. The elder one goes to school and is in grade 6, and the younger one is below the school-going age. Her husband, Gokul, is 31 years old and involved in a small business. Bulbuli received education up to class V (grade 5), and her husband has received education up to class VIII (grade 8). Bulbuli lives in a small mud house in a small town of Maynaguri along with her husband and children.

Bulbuli is associated with a business of selling hay and straw. She sells straw and hay in the local market and in her neighborhood. Straw and hay are used for making roofs of kaccha houses (made of mud and straw) and to feed cattle, so there is a high demand for straw and hay in the rural areas. 

Now Bulbuli wants to extend her business, so with the help of BJS money, they hope to expand their business to sell a huge amount of straw in the market. Bulbuli also dreams to give a good future to her children and to have a pakka house (made of bricks and cement) of her own. 

As there is a great demand for straw, she hopes she will gain a large profit from this business, which will help her to lead her family smoothly. She dreams to enhance her business with the profit generated from her business.

She is greatly thankful to BJS and Kiva equally for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy dry straw, hay, etc. to sell in the market.

loans.name: Nachima

texts.en:
Nachima is a 40-year-old housewife from the rural village of Stationpara in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  She lives with her husband Mosarof, 49 years old, and her only son Bablu in their house. Both husband and wife are uneducated and can only sign their names. Their son is a cycle-van puller.

India is famous for agriculture, so most of the people are engaged in land cultivation in India, especially rural people. Nachima's husband also works on his own land and cultivates different seasonal vegetables.  Nachima take care of her husband and son and manages the household alone. She also helps her husband to grow a quantity of good quality vegetables so that they can sell them to their customers for profit as well as well as for goodwill. Despite the hard labor of this couple, they are hardly able to earn a good profit to maintain their family..

Now this hardworking woman has decided to cultivate potatoes on their farmland to earn more profit.  She is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to improve her cultivation process. The loan will enable her to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers, which will help her to start her cultivation process.  Potato is a kind of vegetable that is used in most of the dishes in India and that's why they hope it will be a lucrative business. They hope to use the profit to upgrade their financial condition and save money to purchase a rickshaw in the future to rent to generate more income.

Nachima is grateful to both lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is from Raipara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and two sons.  One son is in college and the other is unemployed, though he has a higher education.  Both Minati and her husband Bhupoti, 50 years old, are illiterate and can sign only their names.  They live in their own kachha house (made of wood, mud and straw).

The family is engaged in agriculture. They have a plot of land where they grow different vegetables in different seasons. They gather the harvest, sell it in the nearby markets and get money, which is the only source of income. 

Minati has applied for the loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers with an aim to cultivate potaoes.  This will enable her to increase her agricultural turnover so that she will be able to assist her husband financially to run the family.

She also plans to save money to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house.

Minati and her husband are grateful to BJS and Kiva for their help in increasing their agribusiness and making their dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and potato seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is a housewife from a small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She lives with her husband and two children in a kaccha (made of stone & straw) house. Her husband is involved in farming and cultivates many kinds of vegetables to sell in the village market.

Due to their low income, Anjali is unable to manage her family's expenses as well as her children’s educational expenses. Her husband is struggling hard the whole day but fails to generate sufficient income. So Anjali requested from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation of mustard in the same field to increase the family income. She is very ambitious and hopeful that she will succeed in her target for more income. In the future, she dreams of purchasing more farmland with the profit from her business. 

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation of mustard.

loans.name: Bashona

texts.en:
Bashona is a 24-year-old housewife and there are four members in her family including one daughter, one son and her husband. Her husband, Satish, is 31 years old.  Bashona and her husband both have completed education up to grade 5.  Their children are below the school-going age. They have their own house in the small town Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri.

They are from a humble family of scarce economic resources. Bashona’s husband cultivates different crops in their own small piece of land.  He has been working with agriculture for many years and produces beans, onions and other vegetables for the family's consumption and to sell in the local markets. 

The small income of Bashona’s husband is not sufficient to get over the financial hurdles of their family, so she decided to start cultivating potatoes on their land. For this she needs capital, so she applied for the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing potato seeds and fertilizers.  

She hopes the profit that will be generated from their new business will meet the financial needs of their family as well as help her to give her children better education. She hopes to upgrade their financial condition and dreams of purchasing a mini tractor for their agricultural use.

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a 42-year-old housewife. There are three members in her family. Laxmi studied up to grade 8, whereas her husband studied up to grade 9. Their son has completed a bachelor’s degree. They have their own house in the small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Laxmi’s husband cultivates different crops on their own small piece of land. He has been working in the agriculture business for many years. The small income of Laxmi’s husband is not sufficient to get over the financial hurdles of their family, so Laxmi decided to start cultivating garlic on their land. For this, she needs capital, which they do not have, so she applied for the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing garlic seeds and fertilizers.  

She hopes the profit generated from the business will help her to give her child better education. She hopes to upgrade their financial condition by selling garlic in the local market.

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality garlic seeds and fertilizers for cultivating garlic.

loans.name: Mayarani

texts.en:
Mayarani is married and lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter) in the small village Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 40 years old, uneducated and can sign only her name. Her husband Monoronjon, age 55, attended school up to grade eight. Two of their children are getting an education and are in grade seven and grade nine. Their eldest son is unemployed.

Mayarani's husband is a farmer who has been involved in cultivation for many years.  Specifically he cultivates potatoes, which is an important crop and has a high demand in the locality. He sells them to the local wholesalers. He is very enthusiastic about running his farm in a sustainable way, ensuring a good income for the family. His son and wife help him in harvesting and selling the produce at the market. But the income from this business is too scanty to manage the household expenses of this five-member family and, at the same time, to bear the educational expenses of their children.  They need to expand their business but they have a lack of capital.

Mayarani has taken a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and manure so that they can expand the potato cultivation business.  She hopes it will give then additional income to provide all the necessities for the family and help to overcome the financial hurdles that they are facing at present.

Her future plan is to go ahead with this agribusiness for their secured future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and manure for growing potatoes

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa is 37 years old, and her husband is 42 years old. She is the mother of one child. Champa makes incense and sells it in the market, while her husband cultivates crops to sell those in the local market. Champa has a little education, up to grade 8, while her husband possesses a bachelor’s degree in arts.

Both of them work hard the whole day long to generate income for their family. Champa has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to enhance her incense making business so she can earn more. This incense making business is a profitable business in her area, and it also does not involve much labour cost. 

Champa has applied for a loan amount of INR 10,000 so that they can purchase more raw materials and can prepare more incense sticks. She can sell them to the market, as well as door to door to neighbors for more profit. There is a high demand for her incense in her locality. She hopes it will improve the family’s financial condition. 

They are thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for incense making.

loans.name: Sahenara

texts.en:
Sahenara is 38 years old and married with two sons. She is uneducated and can sign her name. Her parents' poor resources were the main hindrance for her education. After her marriage with Sohidul, she is now a housewife; she looks after her sons and husband and does household jobs. One of their sons is a student of grade 10, and the other is unemployed. They live in the remote village, Kholaigram, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Sahanara's husband, aged 42 years, is totally engaged in agricultural works. Being uneducated, he did not have other options. He has a small plot of farmland, on which he grows different vegetables. Their family's main income is from farming. He somehow manages the household expenses. Now, due to the increase in the expenses of his family, it is impossible for him to run the family with this small income. So, he needs to expand his business. They have decided to cultivate potatoes, but they have limited capital.

Sahenara wants to help her husband. She heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes on her husband’s farmland. Through this business, she believes that she will improve their potato farming and can earn additional profit for covering their household expenses. 

She aspires to build a concrete-made house for them to live in. She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). Both of them are students. They are in grade 12 and grade 4.  Jyotsna has a primary education, and her husband, Niranjan, who is a 40-year-old carpenter, is illiterate and can only sign his name. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Jyotsna's husband has a small shop in the local market, where he makes wooden tables, chairs, tools, etc. and sells them to the neighbours. He is the major source of income for the family. Jyotsna is also an energetic and industrious woman. She runs an animal husbandry, which she began five years back to support her family financially. But they need more money to give the family financial sustenance, as the prices of essential commodities are going up day by day.

Jyotsna came to know about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase a cow and start a new business of milk supply and making dairy products like paneer, butter, curd, etc. She plans to sell the products to her neighbours. This will ultimately help in generating more cash.

She dreams to give a better education to her children, assist her husband to run the family in a better way and to build a concrete-made house for them.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for a milk supply business.

loans.name: Kunti

texts.en:
Kunti, 26 years old, is a homemaker. She is married to Sushil, and together they are raising two sons. They live in the small village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. Both the husband and wife are illiterate, but they are providing education to their two sons, who are in grade 8 and grade 5. They have a house.

Kunti's husband is a cultivator. He inherited a plot of land from his parents and now works there with the help of his wife. They grow different vegetables and sell to different dealers in their locality and to the customers who come to buy. His goals, hopes and dreams for the future are to start a potato cultivation business, which will generate more income, as well as provide for family consumption.

So, Kunti has applied for a loan from BJS. She plans to purchase potato seeds and good-quality fertilizers with the loan and to start the cultivation as early as possible. The additional profit that will generate from it will not only help her family with the financial upgrade, but also to go ahead with the business.

She aspires to build a concrete-made house for them.

Kunti is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika is 42 years old and a homemaker. She studied up to grade 5. She is married to Upendra, who is a 52-year-old farmer. He also has a primary education.They are raising two school-going children (sons), who are in grade 9 and grade 7 respectively. They live in the small village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Radhika's husband is engaged in agriculture of different vegetables. He inherited a plot of land from her parents and works there from dawn to dusk. Radhika helps him in cultivation, providing all the maintenance it requires to avoid deterioration of the plants. They sell the produce to the different dealers in the area and to others who come to buy vegetables. They also keep some vegetables for family consumption. 

The income from the business is too small to meet all the family’s expenses smoothly, including their children's educational costs. So they want to cultivate cauliflower, which is a profitable crop.

Now Radhika has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase cauliflower seeds and fertilizers for cultivation on their farmland. Her goals, hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children properly and to see them in good positions.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding the loan to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase cauliflower seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Aklima

texts.en:
Aklima is a rural housewife of 45 years of age. She is from the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband, Yadali, who is 55 years old, is completely engaged in cultivation. Though Aklima has a primary education, her husband is illiterate. They have two school-going children: one son and one daughter. They are in grade 10 and 6. The family lives in their own kachha house
(made of wood, bamboo, straw and mud).

Aklima's husband has been cultivating seasonal crops on their own plot of land. He gives hard labour to grow good-quality crops, which he sells in the local market. He is the only earning member of the family. His main challenge is to give the family a better living condition, which he cannot give with his small income. So, Aklima and her husband have decided to start cultivation of potatoes.

Aklima is a woman with lot of strength and much desire to get ahead and prosper in life. She has taken a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation. She hopes to get excellent revenues for meeting her promises and to continue to enjoy the benefits and opportunities that life presents to continue progressing in her business.

Her future plans are to give her children proper education and prepare them to become professionals.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is 26 years old and is an active, enterprising woman from a small village, Domohoni, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She studied only up to grade 3. Due to her parents' poor financial condition, she could not continue her studies. She is married to Johirul, aged 37 years, and together they are raising two daughters who are students of grade 5 and grade 3 respectively. They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo.)

Saira's husband is engaged in a small business, which gives him a low income and is not sufficient to run a family of four members smoothly, so Saira has decided to help her husband financially. She wants to start a grocery shop, which she can operate easily. For this, she needs some capital.

Saira, therefore, has taken a loan from BJS to purchase grocery items like rice, dal, oil, salt, sugar, biscuits, etc. to start the business. This loan will allow her to buy sufficient items to satisfy her customers’ demand. She also wants to strengthen her grocery store business to generate more income to have a better quality of life.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to start a grocery shop business.

loans.name: Pampa

texts.en:
Pampa is a 30-year-old woman who studied up to grade 7. She is married and a housewife. She is the mother of one daughter who is a student of grade 2. Pampa's husband Arjun, aged 37 years, is the owner of a hair-cutting salon. They live in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Pampa’s husband opened the salon five years ago. His parents could not provide education due to their poor financial resources. Circumstances compelled him to choose this profession to run his family. He has been managing it with a reputation.  But he often faces out-of-stock braided hair extensions and other items. So, his earning is not sufficient and as a result, he often can't meet the essential expenses of his family. Pampa’s goal is to meet customer demand and have sizeable earnings.

Pampa decided to help her husband to run his business smoothly. She is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to buy the products for her husband's salon and meet his goal. The revenue derived from this loan will allow her to support herself and her child, as well as to grow the business in the future.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to expand the business of her husband's hair-cutting salon.

loans.name: Pinki

texts.en:
Pinki is a housewife from a remote village, Khagrabari, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 20 years old and studied up to grade 9. She is married to Debashis, aged 32 years, who did not complete his primary education. They are raising two children (one son and one daughter). One is too young for school, and the other is a student of grade 2.

Pinki's husband is entirely engaged with agribusiness. They have a plot of land where he grows potatoes, beans and other green vegetables. Pinki also helps her husband in his work after managing her household job. They carry the harvest produce to the local markets for selling. This is the only source of income for the family to cover all the expenses. Now they have decided to start cultivation of eggplants on their farmland to generate more income. It is a very profitable project.

Pinki came to know about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and that they give loans to needy women to start businesses. She took a loan and is using the loan to purchase seeds for eggplant, fertilizers and pesticides to start cultivation as early as possible. They hope they will be able to improve their farm and increase its productivity. This will bring in more profit and will improve their living standard.

They are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase eggplant seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Trandra

texts.en:
Trandra is a 42-year-old woman who is married to Kajol. Trandra has a secondary education, and her husband attended school up to grade 7. They are blessed with two daughters, who are students of grade 7 and grade 9. They live in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own concrete-made house.

Trandra's husband is associated with a business of supplying materials, such as bricks, cement, sand, stones, etc. for building construction, to the retail shops in the market.

Trandra wants to develop her husband's business to generate more income to maintain the family's expenses, which are growing day by day. She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase more sand and stones to expand their business. She believes that through endurance and diligence, she can improve the business.

In the future, she wants to open a large builders’ shop in the local market in order to generate more profits to educate their daughters properly and overcome the financial crisis of the family.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and stones to expand her existing business of supplying building materials.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a woman who has one son and lives in the countryside at Maynaguri, in Jalpaiguri district. Her husband, Sanjoy, is associated with cultivation. She is a housewife who has an education up to grade 7. Their only son reads in grade 6.

Her husband's agribusiness is not going well. His income is not sufficient to run the family properly. Saraswati is a lady with many dreams and who is eager to overcome the problems and get ahead in her life along with her family members.  She plans to help her family financially. She decided to start cultivation of tea plants on their own plot of land. She applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS, to purchase tea saplings and fertilizers for cultivation of tea.

Selling tea leaves is a profitable business, and there is a good demand in their locality and in the present market, so she hopes to earn a good profit from her business.

She hopes to upgrade their financial condition and give a better education and a better future to her son with the profit generated from her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase tea saplings and fertilizers to cultivate tea plants.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a rural housewife from the small village of Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 28 years old and read up to grade 7. Her husband, Harishankar, aged 32 years, has an education up to grade 7. They have two children (one son and one daughter), who are students of grade 2 and grade 4 respectively. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and wood). 

Namita's husband is a humble and hardworking man. He is totally engaged in agriculture. Namita also helps her husband. He gives hard toil on his farmland. It is the only way to earn their living. This tradition has been passed on from generation to generation; that is how he learnt the activity. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells in the local markets and to his neighbors to generate income to contribute to the family economy. Now he thinks to expand his agribusiness by cultivating potatoes, which are a profitable crop.

Namita is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchases potato seeds and necessary farm supplies to continue cultivating and caring for her crops and obtain a more productive harvest. With her spirit of getting ahead and the determination to prosper, she wants to continue with the business and make it more and more profitable so she can give her family a better quality of life.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and necessary farm supplies for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Tultul

texts.en:
Tultul is 35 years old, married and living with her husband. She lives in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Tultul has a higher secondary education but her husband studied up to grade seven.  They have only one daughter who is in grade four. Both Tultul and her husband are engaged in the business of making bags.

Tultul stitches different types of bags and her husband sells those bags in the market.  They have chosen this business because it is a profitable business since bags are in great demand in the local market.  In this way they, can somehow manage the household expenses of their family.  It is not sufficient to run the family.

She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) so that they can purchase more materials to make bags to sell in the market. By selling the bags, their earnings are good and they can run their family. She hopes that she will be able to open a bag shop in the market within a year.

Tultul is very much grateful and thankful to BJS and Kiva for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make bags

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is 51 years old. She is a rural housewife from the village of Haspatalpara in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Chittaranjan, who is 53 years old and engaged in a business. They have only one daughter. Unfortunately, she is physically handicapped. Sabitri is very much motivated to provide good care and treatment for her daughter. She always takes care of her. It consumes a lot of time and money.

Sabitri's husband has been doing a business of selling milk for many years. They have only two cows for milk. He sells milk in his locality and counts a good client list.  But he needs more milk to satisfy his customers' demand. Moreover, his income is not good enough to give a decent lifestyle. They also need much money to give proper treatment to their daughter.

So, Sabitri has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS. She plans to purchase one more dairy cow to meet the customers' demand and to be able to sell more milk. She has decided to increase the supply of milk and start a dairy products business (butter, paneer, curd, etc.). It will help her to inflate her sales and profits alongside.

She is thankful to both the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for a dairy products business.

loans.name: Swastika

texts.en:
Swastika is only 21 years old and lives with her husband and their only daughter in the small village of Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri. Both have secondary education. Their daughter is a student of grade 2.

Swastika's husband earns his living as a farmer and grows different vegetables like potatoes, beans, onions and others. He has a small plot of land, which he got from his ancestors. He has been working on his farm for ten years with the help of his wife. They sell the produce to the local market.  

Now the family is facing a financial crisis, as it has become difficult for them to maintain the family expenses with his humble income. That's why they want to do cultivation of some other crop. They have decided to cultivate cauliflower on their land; winter is the best season to cultivate cauliflower. 

Swastika is requesting a loan From BJS (Kiva’s partner). She plans to utilize the loan for buying cauliflower seeds, manure and other necessary things to cultivate cauliflower.

She gives her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase seeds and manure for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Shukali

texts.en:
Shukali is a young rural woman of only 20 years from a small village, Mauyamari, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a very energetic and optimistic woman who does not want to give up. She lives with her husband, Swapan, aged 31 years, and only one son, who is too young to go to school. Both the husband and wife have secondary education. They live in their own house.

Shukali has been engaged for a long time in a business of stitching varieties of clothes and selling them in the market and in her neighborhood. Her husband is associated with a small business, but his income is low. Shukali gives support to her husband financially, so she stitches different types of garments, especially for ladies. Her husband also helps her in her work by selling those garments in the markets. There is a high demand for her clothes in her neighborhood. 

Nowadays it is hardly possible for them to maintain the household expenses with the income, as the prices of everything are growing day by day. She wants to expand her business.

Thus, she has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase materials, such as cloth, thread, needles, etc., that will help her to earn as much profit as she needs.

With the income from her business, she hopes to improve her family's quality of life.  She wishes her business would keep growing so that she can support her family and husband and will overcome the financial hurdles that they are now facing.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Annabala

texts.en:
Annabala is 26 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising two children (one son and one daughter). She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She is married to Sumanta, who is a green grocer by profession. Their children go to school and are students of grade 6 and grade 1 respectively. They are from a remote village in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw-made).

Her husband is associated with agricultural work. He grows green vegetables like chilies, beans and other seasonal vegetables on their own land, and sells the harvested products in the market. 

Annabala is engaged in livestock as an additional source of income for her family.  She started this business five years back, as they were unable to run the family with her husband's small income. 

Every day she gets up at early dawn, gets her children ready for school, does all the household jobs, and then looks after her cattle and works in her animal husbandry. Annabala is a very hardworking lady. She has a great dedication to her work, with which she will be able to improve her family's wellbeing and provide a better future to her daughter.

Now she is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase another cow with an aim to start a business of milk products. She hopes she will earn more profit from this business, as the products (butter, paneer, curd, cheese) are in great demand in the present market. 

Annabala plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the future acquisition of more cattle. She also intends to save money for the future of her children. 

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a dairy products business.

loans.name: Kulchum

texts.en:
Kulchum is a 48-year-old woman who lives with her husband Afijal and two children (one daughter and one son). Afijal (Kulchum’s husband) is a farmer by profession. They live in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, straw and mud) in the small village of Altagram in Dhupguri in the district of  Jalpaiguri.  Kulchum studied up to grade four and her husband is uneducated and can only sign his name. Their daughter goes to school; studying in grade 12, and their son assists his father in agricultural work. 

Kulchum's husband does hard labor from dawn to dusk to grow a variety of vegetables in their field to sell in the local market. In order to give financial support to her family and husband, Kulchum runs an animal husbandry business. Now she has one dairy cow.  She sells the milk of the cow to her neighbors. In spite of their hard labor, their financial condition is not stable.

Kulchum has decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase another cow to extend her dairy business. She will sell more milk and earn more profit. She plans to give her family a decent lifestyle and an uninterrupted education to her daughter with the profit from her business. 

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya is a 55-year-old married rural woman who lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in Maynaguri region in the district of Jalpaiguri.  They are less educated due to poverty, and they could not complete their studies, but they send their children to school for proper education. Their son is in college, and their daughter is in grade five. Her husband Sukumar, aged 69 years, is associated with a small business.

Her husband's income is too scanty to meet all the necessary needs of the family, including their children's educational expenses. So, Sandhya has decided to help her husband financially to run the family. She has decided to start a business of scrap and unwanted old things.

Sandhya has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She wants to use the loan to purchase scrap and unwanted old things, such as old newspapers, old pitch board boxes, broken utensils, plastic, etc., from door to door from different households in her locality; then sell the materials to the wholesalers. In this way, she will earn some profit to help the family.

Sandhya hopes that if she can get the loan, she can purchase more stock, which will generate more profit. Then it will be possible for her to enhance the business, and with the profit, she can do her level best to educate her children properly.

Her full thanks go to the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase scrap and unwanted old things for resale.

loans.name: Guljan

texts.en:
Guljan is a woman of 50 years.  She is married, a housewife and uneducated. She can only sign her name. She is married to Majidul, 55 years old, who is a green grocer by profession. He is uneducated. Together they are raising one daughter who is pursuing her bachelor's degree. They live in their own house in the small village of Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri district.

Guljan's husband grows green vegetables on his land and sells in the local market. His small business is the only source of income and it is too low to give enough financial sustenance to the family. He works hard but due to lack of capital, he is unable to grow more vegetables on his land.  He cannot cover all the needs of the family.

Guljan has decided to help her husband to start a dairy business by taking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.  She will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow and start a milk and milk products (butter, milk, paneer, cheese etc.) business. Guljan chose BJS for this loan because they help small-scale farmers to grow economically.  This loan will help to purchase a dairy cow, which will lead to milk production and to start dairy products business and thus increase their income.

This will ensure that her daughter receives a good education and will improve her family's living standards.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk and milk products business.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is a 40-year-old married lady. Together with her husband, she is raising their two sons.  Parbati is illiterate due to her parents' poor economic condition. She could not go to school but she can sign her name. Her husband, Ramakrishna, is a farmer.  He is 46 years old and he is also uneducated but can sign his name. Their sons go to school, studying in grade eight and grade five, respectively. They live in the village of Kathapara in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (a house made of bamboo, straw and mud).

Parbati’s husband is involved with agricultural work and grows different types of crops to sells in the local market. Her husband is very much dedicated and committed to enhancing his business and to making a handsome amount of profit from it. So he works hard on his farmland from dawn to dusk, but is unable to give sufficient financial help to run the family well.

Parbati and her husband have decided to start a milk supply business, so Parbati has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow.  She will start a milk supply business in her area from door to door. From this activity, she will be able to contribute a small share to her family's household expenditures.

She also desires to give her children a good education. In the future, she wants to purchase more cows and make a cow herd and a cowshed in her house with the income generated from her business.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a very enterprising woman. She is 29 years old and has a primary education. She is married to Netai, aged 31. They have one school-going daughter who is in grade 7. They live in their own house in the small village of Mouamari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Swapna works very hard every day. She could not continue her studies because of scarce economic resources. Her husband, who also studied up to grade 5, is associated with a small business. The income of her husband is hardly enough to cover their basic needs, so Swapna makes clothing (skirts, kurti, dresses and blouses).  She has been doing this work from her house for the last ten years and has experience in this field. She has earned the goodwill of her customers, who are mainly her neighbors. Her daughter also helps her in her spare time, sewing on buttons and assisting in her tailoring work.

Now Swapna is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to expand her business in order to give financial support to her family. She will purchase necessary materials related to her business with the loan. She hopes she will earn additional income from this.

In the future, she wants her own clothing shop with the varieties of clothing she makes. She also wants to give a better education to her daughter and to see her become a professional.

She gives her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials to expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nayantara

texts.en:
Nayantara is 46 years old.  She is a married woman and a housewife. She lives with her husband and only son in their own house in the village of Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri . Both she and her husband Dhononjoy are uneducated and can only sign their names. Their only son runs a grocery shop.

Her husband is totally engaged in agriculture to provide a decent lifestyle for the family. He works hard from dawn to dusk. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells the produce in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family.  Nayantara is also trying hard to help her husband financially. She has been doing a business purchasing and selling hay.  She purchases hay from the wholesalers and sells to the retailers.  Most of the villagers are engaged in the cattle business, so there is a great demand for hay in the locality.  Nayantara's husband's agribusiness is not making much profit, which is why she wants to expand her business for the betterment of the family.

She came to know about BJS and has taken a loan to purchase hay to expand her business. Her main goal is to help her husband and help with the household expenses.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan so that she can reach her goal.

loans.use: To purchase hay to sell

loans.name: Anjuma

texts.en:
Anjuma is a young rural married woman of 21 years old, who is uneducated but knows how to sign her name. Her husband, Afijuddin, is 25 years old and is a farmer by profession.  They live in their own house in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Anjuma's husband is engaged in the agricultural business and has been doing farming for many years. He grows vegetables on his land and sells them in the local market. His farming is the main source of income for the family. Anjuma helps her husband in farming and is also a hardworking and ambitious lady.

Now Anjuma has decided to start a new business of selling milk and milk products to generate more income for her family. She applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a dairy cow. She will sell milk and dairy products like butter, paneer, curd, etc. to her neighbors and in the local market. This income will improve their living standards. 

She gives hearty thanks to Kiva and BJS for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for business purposes.

loans.name: Surjamani

texts.en:
Surjamani is a rural housewife from Raipara village in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 47 years old and uneducated. She can only sign her name. She stays with her husband and three sons. One of them is continuing his bachelor's degree and the other two are masons by profession. Her husband Jogesh is engaged in an agribusiness. They live in their own small mud house.

Surjamani's husband's income, however, is not enough to cover the everyday needs of the family. He works hard in his farmland and grows different vegetables like beans, chilies, cabbages, and cauliflower and sells the agricultural products in the local market. Yet he can hardly meet the family expenses.

In order to earn more profit from this agribusiness, they want to start potato cultivation on their farmland.  Surjamani heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and decided to take a loan to help her husband to buy potato seeds and good quality fertilizers.

They hope this business will provide them with additional profit, which will help them to bear the household expenses of their family and at the same time, help them to provide a better education for their son.

In the future, they aspire to build a concrete house with the profit from her business.

They sincerely appreciate the support of their lenders (BJS and Kiva) for giving them the loan.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and good quality fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 41-year-old married rural woman who lives with her husband and one son in a small village in the Dhupguri region in Jalpaiguri district. She and her husband are uneducated but they can sign their names. Their son goes to school. He is now in grade seven.

Her husband is a hawker who sells cosmetics and different necessary items for daily use like combs, toothbrushes, nail cutters etc. from door to door. There is a great demand for his cosmetics in their locality. But due to a lack of capital, he cannot extend his business. 

Saraswati wants to give support to her husband to extend his business, so she took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more cosmetic items and more necessary daily use items from the wholesale market to enhance her husband’s business.
