In the future, they desire to open a cosmetic shop in the market with the profit from the business. Saraswati and her husband are highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetic and daily use items to sell

loans.name: M. Asghar

texts.en:
M. Asghar owns an auto spare parts shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and lives near his shop. His shop is situated in the vehicle’s spare parts market and it is challenging for him to sell his product among his competitors. This competition highly effects his daily sales. 
To grow his business, income and differentiate from the competitors he decided to offer some additional stylish spare parts, engine oils and some ordinary spare parts to sell. He hopes that this strategy will work positively and the customers will attract towards his new products.
He cannot act upon his strategy without some capital, so he has requested a kiva loan through Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because the BRAC provides the facility to empower the poor. 
M. Asghar is married and he has to look after his young children and old parents as well but he hardly spends time with them due to his business. 
M. Asghar is tension free after receiving this loan because the BRAC showed him a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to the kiva and field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stylish spare parts, engine oils and ordinary spare parts of vehicle to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 62 years old and married with four children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elena has borrowed and repaid twenty-two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from soft-drinks retailing.

Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is responsible mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for the last three years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Musarat's husband needs to make maintenance of his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires some maintenance charges to maintain his taxi car. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to make maintenance of his vehicle. Therefore Musarat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Musarat's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. In this way he can provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Musarat also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of taxi repairing.

loans.name: Josela

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Josela works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Josela is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Josela has been sustaining her business activities through the past 33 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es: Doña Marcela tiene 54 años de edad, se dedica a vender comida a todos los chóferes y vecinos de la zona ya que es una de las sodas más conocidas del lugar y de las pocas que están muy cerca de la Frontera con Panamá por lo que muchas personas transitan por ahí, lo que le permite tener amplia clientela. Actualmente requiere de una cocina ya que la actual no esta funcionando correctamente y es urgente que la cambie por que es una de sus herramientas principales. Desea continuar trabajando con Fundación Mujer ya que ha logrado gran avance en su actividad y aumentar su mobiliario en estos años. Desea continuar con su soda ya que es lo que le permite apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Marcela, 54, sells food to all the drivers and neighbors in the area since hers is one of the most well-known local food stalls and among the few that are close to the border with Panama; so it is a busy place and attracts many customers.

She currently needs a new stove because the one she has does not work well and it is her basic tool.  She wants to continue working with the Women's Foundation since she has been able to progress in her business and buy more equipment over the years.  Her goal is to continue with her business so she can support her children in their education

loans.use: To buy equipment for her food stall.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen es socia del grupo de crédito Arco Iris, grupo que le gusta por la amistad, solidaridad y compañerismo que existe, los créditos le ayudan a crecer en el negocio poco a poco y le ayuda a mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. Vive por la comunidad Tres Marías que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia que es el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio.
La Señora Carmen tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que vive es de familiares.
Doña Carmen se dedica a la crianza de varios animales y también a la agricultura, estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de salir adelante con su familia.
 El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra animales, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmen is part of the Arco Iris [Rainbow] credit group which she likes because of the companionship and bond that exists in it. The loans help her expand in her business little by little and help improve the economic stability of her household in order for her family to get ahead.  She lives in the community Tres Marías which belongs to the Turi parish in Cuenca. This parish is known as the “Mirador,” or Vantage Point. The local people work in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.

Carmen is 36 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship and has a 3 year old child. Her husband works as a construction worker. The house they live in belongs to relatives. 

Carmen works raising animals and also in agriculture, which are the activities that give her the opportunity to provide for her family.   

She used her previous loan to buy animal,s and this new loan will be to buy chickens and pigs. Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura y cultiva papa, hortalizas y vegetales, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Colque Orcco” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Ernesto is a hard-working entrepreneur who provides for his family with much effort.  He works in agriculture and grows potatoes and vegetables.  He is a responsible person and, therefore, was invited to join the communal bank "Colque Orcco".  On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to buy seeds.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura y el engorde ganado, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Colque Orcco” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Daniel is a hardworking enterprising person who makes a great effort to help his family get ahead. He is a farmer and raises livestock. As he is a responsible person, he was invited to participate in the Colque Orcco Community Bank.

Daniel now requires a loan to buy cattle. He is grateful for this valuable loan and promises to make the monthly repayments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, potatoes, biscuits, onions, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice and beans for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, potatoes, biscuits, onions, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice and beans for her business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Adelaida works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Adelaida is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Adelaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a divorced woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruit,tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Quintin Americo

texts.es: Americo es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Colque Orcco” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Americo is a hardworking enterprising person who makes a great effort to help his family get ahead. He is a farmer. As he is a responsible person, he was invited to participate in the Colque Orcco Community Bank.

Americo now requires a loan to buy seeds. He is grateful for this valuable loan and promises to make the monthly repayments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: Buy seeds

loans.name: Elsa Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Colque Orcco” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Tomasa is a hard working person who gets her family ahead with her work. Her economic activity is agriculture. She is a responsible person and that is the reason she was invited to participate in the “Colque Orcco” communal bank. At this time, she needs the loan to buy seeds. She is grateful for and values the loan. She is committed to making the monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Marta Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marta de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de nivel académico, está   casada   el esposo se dedica al trabajo como parqueador en una institución de muy buena calidad en el país; ya tiene 10 años de trabajar ahí. En su matrimonio ha procreado 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela; en su casa viven  tres hermanos de ella,  sus dos hijos y el esposo pero de ella solo depende los dos hijos. 

Marta se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  pero ella anteriormente se dedicaba a cuidar animales como pollos y en ocasione han tenido dos terneras esto las ha tenido en la casa y ahí los cuida los engorda y los vende, así le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar dos terneras  que un vecino le vende que están muy bonitas y baratas que no quiere dejar esa oportunidad de comprarlas eso le ayudara mucho y tendrá ingresos cuando los venda.
 
Los sueños que tiene es que siempre Dios le preste vida para seguir teniendo las novillas y que cuando sean vacas podrá tener ingresos de la venta de la leche y el queso que elaboraría.
texts.en:
Marta is 28 years of age and has a sixth grade education.  She's married and her husband has been working as a parking attendant for 10 years at a high quality institution in the country.  They have two children which go to school.  In addition to her husband and two children, three brothers of hers also live in her house but only the two children depend on her.  
Marta takes care of the domestic chores but previously she has worked taking care of animals like chickens and sometimes she's had two calves in her house which she takes care of, fattens, and then sells.  In this way she can help her husband with the house expenses.  
The loan she's requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy two beautiful calves that a neighbor is selling at a cheap price and she doesn't want to miss the opportunity of buying them.  This will help her a lot and she will generate some income when she sells them.  
Her dream is that God always give her life to keep taking care of calves so that when they become cows she can generate income from the sale of the milk and cheese she will make.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura y el engorde de ganado, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Colque Orcco” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Martin is a hard working and entrepreneurial individual who supports his family through his effort.  He works in agriculture raising cattle. He is a responsible person and as such, was invited to participate in the community bank Colque Orcco.  This time he is requesting a loan to buy cattle.  He appreciates and values ​​the loan and is committed to paying his monthly dues with great responsibility.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married with three children. Two children are in school and one is an adult. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanajuma has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a miniature greengrocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La señora Olga  tiene 22 años, ella se dedica al tejido de ropa para bebes, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Alto Lima , solicita el crédito para la  compra de lana al por mayor y variedad de cintas para adornar la ropa de bebe,  ya que tiene mucha demanda y tiene pedidos que entregar, también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is 22 years old and she makes a living knitting babies clothes. She has her workshop and house in the area of Alta Lima. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy wool wholesale and a variety of ribbons to decorate the baby clothes. Her products are in high demand and she has orders that she needs to finish and deliver. She also has to deliver orders to various markets in the city of La Paz. 

She is happy and grateful for the help received from Kiva and for the opportunity she has to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy wool and other materials

loans.name: Lourdes Sara

texts.es: La Señora Lourdes sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de cosméticos por catálogo,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de cosméticos y joyas,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas ya que es el producto donde tiene más ganancias, se siente agradecida con kiva por otra oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lourdes continues with the same activity, selling cosmetics via catalog. She says that the previous loan went well for her, because she used it to buy cosmetics and jewelry. At this time, she is asking for the loan to buy jewelry, since that is the product that has the most profits. She is grateful to Kiva for this opportunity that is being offered to improve her business and therefore her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy jewelry via catalog

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Colque Orcco” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Josefa is a hardworking entrepreneurial woman who moves her family forward with the effort of her work. Her economic activity is agriculture.  She’s a responsible person which is why she was invited to be part of the “Colque Orcco” community bank.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy seeds. She’s grateful for and values the loan awarded and is committed to making her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married and has five children; four are in school and one is still underage. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati appreciates that her previous Kiva loan has enabled her to improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cashew nuts for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. She looks after her family at home as she is a good house wife. Her elder son provides services doing painting work for buildings and shops as well. 

In this regard her elder son was in need of some painting-related items such as paints of different colors, brushes, distempers etc. so as to improve his work. So Suriya made contact with BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan so that her son would be able to purchase paints of different colors, brushes, distempers etc. Suriya is so thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase paints of different colors, brushes and distempers.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Doña Aida es una señora que ha venido trabajando como docente por años compartiendo sus conocimientos con la nueva generación, ahora imparte clases en su hogar ya que es jubilada al igual que su esposo, sus hijos son independientes. 
Aida requiere de este préstamo para invertirlo en mejoras de infraestructura en su hogar, levantara un muro perimetral de una parte de la vivienda, así la irá mejorando poco a poco para obtener confort y disfrutar tranquilamente de su vejez.
texts.en:
Aida is a woman who has worked as a teacher for years, sharing her knowledge with the new generation. Now she gives lessons from her house as she is retired, like her husband. Their children are independent.

Aida is requesting this loan in order to invest in improving the infrastructure of her house. She will raise a wall around part of the house and slowly improve it to obtain comfort and be able to enjoy her retirement peacefully.

loans.use: to buy cement, block, sand, iron, grit.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 53 years old and married with two children.

Lorena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lorena has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty-five years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Lorena aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 75 years old and widowed with eight children. Aurora works very hard to provide for them.

Aurora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Aurora has been in this business for fourteen years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Aurora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is a married woman who has been blessed with three children, two in school and one underage. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Uba operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 52-year-old married women. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is mother of two children Her son is ruining a workshop in his community and she don't have any another source of income. Her son is very hard-working and he wants to increase his business.

That is why she applied a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy some new mechanical instruments for her son's workshop. She will use the additional income for household expenses and to improve her son's workshop .She is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some mechanical instruments for her son's workshop.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 34-year-old woman, and the mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is meat seller by profession. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household expenses.

Nargis's husband needs to purchase meat in bulk for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in position to purchase meat for his business purpose.

Therefore Nargis has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the meat for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Dinora Noemy

texts.es:
Dinora de 29 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, a pesar de tener solo sexto grado, ella se dedica a vender perfumes y artículos de revistas para apoyar en los gastos del hogar, su esposo es albañil y es quien cubre la mayor parte de  los gastos, Dinora lucha para poder sacar adelante a sus hijosde 3 años y 1 año de edad, a quienes les presta mucha atención, ya que son ellos que la motivan a seguir adelante.


Dinora realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años, ella vende los productos y obtiene de ellos el 25% del precio de cada producto,  ella sale a vender a las casas del mismo cantón, aunque es un poco cansado pero es de ahí de donde obtiene algunos ingresos para apoyar en el hogar.


Dinora utilizara el crédito para comprar  lámina y poder cambiarle el techo a su casa, ya que por la época lluviosa se entra  el agua y  se les moja todos los electrodomésticos que con mucho esfuerzo  ha conseguido obtener. Esto desea hacerlo antes que inicie la época lluviosa, pero por el momento no cuenta con  los recursos para poder comprarlas, por lo que necesita que se le apoye económicamente. 


Dinora quiere poder cambiarle el techo a su casa para que sus hijos, quienes están menores de edad no puedan ser afectados. Así también en un futuro ella sueña con poder tener una casa en buenas condiciones en donde no corran peligro sus hijos, y no vivan en un medio desagradable.
texts.en:
Dinora is a hard working 29 year old woman.  Despite having only a sixth grade education, she sells perfumes and catalog items to support house expenses.  Her husband is a mason and covers most of the expenses.  Dinora works hard to move forward her 1 and 3-year-old sons to whom she pays a lot of attention and are her motivation to keep moving forward.  
Dinora has been selling the products and getting a 25% commission from the price of each product for 5 years.  She sells to the houses in her canton.  Even though it is tiresome that is how she obtains some income to support her home.  
Dinora will use her loan to buy roofing materials (metal sheets) to change the roof of her house because during the rainy season water gets into the house and damages her appliances, which she's obtained after a lot of hard effort.  She would like to do this before the start of the rainy season but she doesn't have the resources to buy the metal sheets and needs the financial support.  
Dinora wants to change the roof in her house so that her children who are very young are not effected.  In the future, she also dreams of having a house in good conditions where her children will be safe and won't live in unpleasant circumstances.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials to change the roof of her house because during the rainy season water gets into the house and damages her appliances.

loans.name: M. Ashraf

texts.en:
M. Ashraf, 47, is a responsible father of one daughter. He has been running his own business for many years. In fact, he owns a small garments company. His business is situated near his house in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He takes contracts from wholesalers and sews jeans, pants, shirts, trousers and jackets as per their orders.
 
One of his brothers and many appointed tailors help him sew the garments. He belongs to a middle standard family. He is unable to provide a better standard of living for his sibling, his parents and his own family because a major portion of his income is distributed among the tailors. 

He has been facing a tough time due to generating a low income. He can't earn income through any other business because he is not skilled in any other profession. For these reasons, he has decided to expand his existing enterprise. 

He no longer wants to sew garments on order from wholesalers because they criticize and find drawbacks with his shipments. Instead, he wants to buy denim to sew jeans and sell them directly to retailers. Therefore, he requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan to buy denim to sew jeans. 

In this way, he will easily be able to cherish his entire family. He seems happy after receiving his loan.

loans.use: To buy denim for sewing garments, which he will sell directly to retailers.

loans.name: M. Tariq

texts.en:
M. Tariq is a 38-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of four daughters and two sons. 

His younger sister has reached the age to marry, but he does not have savings to arrange the dowry. He is growing older day-by-day, and always is tense about the future of his sister. 

M. Tariq has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy rexine, leather, shoe shine polish, buckles, nails and thread for making shoes.  

He is a shoemaker by profession; he has been making shoes from many years and now he is one the finest professional shoemakers in the market. He makes shoes by hand for both genders, and his handmade shoes are very famous in his hometown. He wants to grow his business so that he could increase his savings to get a dowry for his sister. 

Therefore, M. Tariq has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he could realize his holy ambition and have it come true. 

He will use the full amount for the establishment of business so that he could remove his worries regarding his business. 

M. Tariq is very thankful Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rexine, leather, shoes shine polish, buckles, nails and thread for making shoes.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 47 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Elsa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 52-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband owns a printing shop; he is the guardian of the family, and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Her son has been running his own men's parlor for past five years. He also contribute his income to manage the family's household. 

He needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for his beauty saloon, but due to financial constraints he is not capable of buying these items for his business purposes. 

Therefore, Agnes has applied for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her son's business purposes, so that he can provide better services to his customers. 

It will also be helpful for him to earn a maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of the business and the family.

Agnes is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy useful instruments for her son's men's beauty parlor

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Norma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norma has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 34 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, sugar, cooking oil, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future Juliet would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en: Nosheen is a 26-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a son. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Therefore, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Nosheen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nosheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay the expenses of her husband's rickshaw maintenance.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 24 years old, married with two children, one of whom is in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Mary Cris requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Mary Cris would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 38 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.  She says she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Asiya operates a cereal business and retail shop.

Asiya is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs,rice and maize flour and sugar for resale.  She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs,rice and maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 37 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.  She is simple house wife and mother of one child.  Her husband has run a photocopier business for past five years.  He is responsible to feeding his entire family and managing their household.

Shehnaz's husband needs to buy different instruments to maintain their house, but due to insufficient financial resources he is not in position to buy these accessories to fulfill his need. 

Therefore Shehnaz is requesting a Kiva loan to enable her husband to buy tools to maintain his house.  Shehnaz is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for husband to maintain their house.

loans.name: M. Shafiq

texts.en:
M. Shafiq is a 26-years-old young and energetic man.  He lives with his sibling and parents in Lahore, Pakistan.  He has established a new gas station sells LPG to customers with vehicles.

Previously M. Shafiq did not have work to earn an income for his family.  A lot of people drive auto rickshaw and there is demand for fuel.  He started his gas station business with very low amount of capital, but  and M. Shafiq does not have a sufficient amount of money to buy more LPG Cylinders to fulfill the demand. 

M. Shafiq wants to buy more gas cylinders so that he can fulfill the demand, so he can generate income and savings to ensure the future of his family.

M. Shafiq is very pleased with this cooperation and very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy LPG gas cylinders..

loans.name: Atika's Group

texts.en:
Atika is 25 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

From the past many days his rickshaw has not worked properly, and he is unable to generate any income.  Atika wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.  Therefore Atika has requested a loan with another group member from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.  This will help him continue his business. 

Atika is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Abed Alshafe

texts.en:
Abed Alshafe is 28 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife in the family house.  He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store, which he opened 5 years ago.
Abed Alshafe is requesting this youth loan to purchase a refrigerator for his shop, so he can increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to build a separate house for his family. 
Abed Alshafe is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for his shop, so he can increase his stock.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca previously accessed a 22,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rebecca dreams of being more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is 26 years old; he lives with his wife and his child in Gaza.

Ibraheem sells a variety of electronics and household goods.  He has a lot of experience in retail business and has been working as employee in other shops.  But now he wants to start his own business by rented a small place.  However, the place needs a lot of improvement.

Ibraheem is requesting a youth loan to purchase more shelves and to decorate.  He wants to increase his stock and increase his income.

Ibraheem is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success.

loans.use: to purchase more shelves and decorate his shop.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For some time his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, however due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Ruqia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Ruqia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leaves, fertilizers, compost to aid her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 38 years old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is an electrician and he has been running his electric store for past five years.  He is responsible for feeding his family and fulfilling their needs.

Nasreen's husband has to purchase electric merchandises like wires, tube lights, plug shoes, and other devices, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to purchase these items.

Therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan to purchase electrical supplies for her husband. This loan will also help her husband increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase electric merchandises like wires, tube lights, plug shoes, and other devices for her husband.

loans.name: Rorya Grp Group

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his early twenties, is married and has two kids. He has been involved with motorbike transportation for two years now. Joseph works from 6am to midnight and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Joseph will use this loan to pay for his motorcycle maintenance and oil expenses. He dreams of owning another successful business. He will share this loan with his loan group "RORYA GRP" which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for his motorcycle maintenance and oil expenses.

loans.name: M. Shahid

texts.en:
M. Shahid is a 37-year old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of two sons and a daughter.
He has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can buy men's shoes to sell in his shoe shop. He has been making nylon footwear on order and selling from his shop for many years. He has been making and selling ladies fancy and casual footwear in his hometown. Most of his customers want to buy men's shoes as well but due to lack of availability of funds he can not purchase men's shoes. 
Therefore, M. Shahid has requested a Kiva loan so he can buy a variety of men’s shoes for resale. In this way he can easily cope with the demand and not disappoint his customers. 
His shop is situated in the shoe market and there are a lot of other shoe shops there which causes tough competition. His dream is to move his shop to another location with fewer competitors.
By investing this loan, he can easily establish his shop and can enhance his savings so his dream can come true.
M. Shahid thanks Kiva, honorable lenders and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy men's footwear for resale.

loans.name: Juán Bautista

texts.es: Juán Bautista, tiene la edad  de 51 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes foliares, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juán Bautista is 51 years old, married, and he lives with his wife and children, who are his biggest priority. With this loan he wants to buy fertilizers, leaves, fungicides, and to pay workers to help in the coffee crops. Also, he wants to buy some seedlings for reseeding when the raining season begins in the hope of increasing the plant density of the area, as well as making the most of the fertility of the soil and the favourable climate conditions for producing coffee. With these improvements he hopes to obtain a small profit and so improve his family's living conditions. He would also like to invest a little more in crops and also achieve some other goals.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any loans before in state banks but FUNDECOSUR has given him this loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to pay workers to help with the coffee crops.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
This is Mwanasiti. She runs a cosmetics shop. Her previous loan was a big help for her business and she was able to purchase more items for her shop.

Mwanasiti is requesting a loan to buy more stock of body lotion, hair oil, and weaves for her shop. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, hair oil, and weaves for her business

loans.name: Romeo Napoleón

texts.es:
Romeo de 52 años de edad,  por sus escazos recursos económicos  estudio hasta cuarto grado, él era uno de los mayores de los cuatro hermanos, y tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar,  ya que su familia era muy pobre. Está casado, su esposa se dedica a trabajar con él en el campo y solo tienen 2 hijas que tiene 15 y 12 años los cuales dependen de él.y estan estudiando.


Romeo actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz y lo ha hecho desde que era niño ya que su padre le enseñó este trabajo en aquel tiempo no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura, tambien cuando era niño trabajo en las tabacaleras con su padre.  Además, de trabajar en la agricultura, tambien trabaja como empleado una coperativa desempeñando el cargo de motorista los cuales es un dinero extra. Se levanta desde las 5:00 am y tiene que trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de unos 3 kilómetros en bicicleta, hora de salida no tiene pues hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado en ese día regresa a su casa y le ayuda a su esposa en los quehaceres diarios.


El prestamo que esta soliictando, es para  terminar de sacar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que tiene,  ya que él siembra a base de riego y en estos momentos es donde la milpa necesita un poco mas  y él ya no tiene dinero para terminar.
 

Romeo en un futoro sueña con tener una mejor casa de la que ahora tiene, poder darle a sus hijas el estudio que él no tuvo, pues hoy en día quien esté mejor preparado académicamente puede conseguir un buen trabajo, ademas sueña con comprar un terreno mas grande del que ahora tiene y asi pode dejar una buena herencia a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Romeo is 52 years old and, because he had very little money, studied only up to fourth grade. Romeo was the eldest of four siblings and had to help his parents at work, as the family was very poor. Romeo is married; his wife works with him in the field. The couple has two daughters - aged 15 and 12 years old - who are in school and depend on Romeo.

Romeo currently makes a living growing corn, something that he has done since he was a child when his father taught him. The family had no other way - except farming - to survive. As a children, Romeo also worked with his father in the cigarette factories.

As well as working in farming, Romeo is also working as a driver, earning him extra money. Romeo wakes up at 5 am and has to head out to the field where he grows corn. The land is three kilometres away; he arrives there on bicycle. Romeo does not have a fixed time for finishing work - he just leaves when he has done everything that needs to be done. After work he returns home to help his wife with the daily chores.

This loan will be used to take out 14,000 square metres of corn. Romeo sows his crops through irrigation and the corn field needs more water; Romeo does not have enough money to finish the job.

In the future Romeo would like to have a better house. He would also like to give his daughters the education that he never had, as those who are better prepared academically will be able to find a good job. Romeo also dreams of buying a larger plot of land to the one he already has, so that he can leave his children a better inheritance.

loans.use: to finish taking out 14,000 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Kevin Edgar

texts.es: Kevin es un joven que vive con sus padres de quien recibe todo el apoyo moral para salir adelante , estudia Administración Bancaria  por que le gusta y genera buenos ingresos, lleva tres años  le falta dos para terminar su carrera y trabajar como administrador en algún banco, en sus ratos libres practica fútbol , Kevin se siente muy contento de haber obtenido el préstamo que EDAPROSPO le otorga Ya que así puede pagar las mensualidades que son muy altas, Kevin agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el apoyo obtenido, ya que existen pocas personas en mundo que apoyan a estudiantes  a salir adelante.” Gracias a KIVA por que por ustedes  habrán más profesionales”.
texts.en:
Kevin is a young man who lives with his parents, who give him the moral support he needs to get ahead. He is studying Bank Administration, which he likes and will provide a good income. He has been studying for three years and he has two years left to complete his career and work as an administrator in a bank.

In his free time he plays football. Kevin is very happy about receiving the loan EDAPROSPO has provided. In this way he can pay his monthly payments which are very high. Kevin is grateful the KIVA lenders for the support given as few people in the world help students to get ahead. "Thank you KIVA, because of you there will be more professionals".

loans.use: to pay his monthly education fees.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam's previous loan improved her living standards. She is requesting another loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes to sell .Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with five children, three who are in school and two who are adults. For the past two years, she has operated a business selling lesos, women’s patterned wrap cloth. Mariam’s major business challenge is seasonality. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mariam decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mariam is requesting a loan to purchase leso cloth to resell. In the future, she dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes.

loans.use: to purchase leso cloth to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu appreciates her previous loan that she used to improve her living standards. She runs a business and was able to expand and earn a higher income.

Saumu is requesting a loan to buy more stock of salt, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy salt, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to look after her coffee crops-

loans.name: Mamena

texts.en:
Mamena is a 21-year-old married rural woman of Dhupguri. Both she and her husband are illiterate, and they can sign their names only. They have two children. One of them goes to school and the other is too small to go to school. 

By profession her husband is a farmer who cultivates many kinds of crops and vegetables to sell in their local market for income. She assists her husband and looks after her family. 

The small income of Mamena’s husband is not sufficient to get over the financial hurdles of their family, so she decided to start cultivating potatoes in their land. Thus she applied for the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing potato seeds and fertilizers.  

She hopes the profit that will be generated from their new business will meet the financial needs of their family. She hopes to upgrade their financial condition by selling potatoes in the local market. She dreams of building a pakka (concrete) house in future with the profit she will gain. 

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Mukta

texts.en:
Mukta is a woman of 36 years who lives in Dhupguri with her husband and two children. She and her husband both are illiterate but able to sign their names. Her children go to school.

Her husband is a farmer, farming different kinds of vegetable crops, fruits, etc. to sell in the local market. They are from a humble family of scarce economic resources, and that is why Mukta’s husband has been working with agriculture for many years. 

Due to their low income, Mukta is unable to manage her family expenses properly. Her husband is struggling hard all day but fails to earn according to the expectation, so Mukta requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating plums in the same field to increase the family income. 

She is very ambitious and hopeful that she will succeed in her target of fulfilling the villagers' great demand for plums. She hopes to upgrade her financial status with the profit of her business. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating plums on her own farmland.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is a rural woman of Dhupguri who is blessed with two children. She and her husband are raising their two children together. They live in a small kaccha house (made of straw and mud). She was unable to receive education and so she is illiterate and can sign only her name. Both of her children are receiving education.

Her husband is involved in a wood business. Her husband sells wood to people who use firewood for cooking. To sell wood, they need to purchase logs of tree and then cut them into pieces for selling in the market. Purchasing a good firewood log is expensive, so Minu decided to take loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) of INR 15,000 to purchase more stocks of wood and sell them in the market to earn more money. 

She hopes she can upgrade her financial status with the profit earned from her business. She is greatly thankful to Kiva as well BJS for their funding.

loans.use: To purchase more good quality logs for her existing firewood business.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José tiene 64 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Él se dedica a la venta de refrescos desde hace 15 años lo cual ha significado mucho en su vida dado que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Junto a su esposa administran el negocio y es así como llevan el sustento a su hogar. Con mucho entusiasmo se acerco  a FUSAI para solicitar este crédito dado que desea cambiar la madera de su vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal estado y considera que no es seguro ni saludable seguir en esas condiciones.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. José has been making a living selling soft drinks for 15 years and this work has been important as he does not have another source of income. Alongside his wife, José manages this business and brings home an income.

With great enthusiasm, José has come to "FUSAI" in order to apply for a loan. He wants to change the wood on his house as it is in bad condition and he feels it is neither safe nor healthy to continue living in these conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood to fix his home.

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana de 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, en parte por la mentalidad de sus padres y lo otro por la gran necesidad de ingresos que habían en los hogares. Está casada con quien tiene ya 33 años juntos, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen seis hijos, dos que son menores de edad que viven bajo su techo y los demás ya cada quien tiene su esposa, pero dos de ellos viven en el mismo terreno de la casa, solo los menores están estudiando, nadie más vive con ellos, lo cual solo sus hijos dependen de sus ingresos como pareja.

Ella tiene uno negocio de venta de pupusas, desde hace cinco años de realizar esta actividad, su madre le enseño el oficio, por lo que decidió poner en práctica lo que había aprendido, no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique a parte de ser  ama de casa que es casi por deber de madre.  El local donde hace las pupusas lo tiene fuera de su casa,  ya que está a oria de la calle y es un lugar muy céntrico. Nadie más se dedica a la actividad aparte de ella, el horario que tiene es de 5:30 am 10:00 am y de 2:00 pm a 6:00 pm. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar más materia prima, como maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, repollo, salsas, etc.  para tener de reserva para cuando se le termina no andar corriendo a la tienda, el mejoramiento que tendrá será el ya no andar comprando lo necesario por libra, si no que hoy lo hará por mayor. 

Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que les dará una mejor estabilidad para sus hijos. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and was not able to go to school. This was partly because of her parents' mentality, and partly because the family really needed an income for the home. Ana has been married for 33 years; her husband works in farming. The couple has six children: two are still minors and live at home; the others are all now married but two still live on the same land as the family home. Only the youngest two are still in school. Nobody else lives in the home, and only the couple's children depend on their income.

Ana has a business selling "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). She learned this trade from her mother and decided to start her own business. Ana has now been doing this work for five years. She has no other job but is a housewife, as part of her duty as a mother. Ana makes the pupusas outside of her house, on the edge of the street, a very central place. Nobody else in the area offers this service. Ana works from 5.30 am until 10 am, and from 2pm until 6 pm.

This loan from "Credi Campo" will be used to buy more basic supplies such as corn, pork, cheese tortillas, oil, cabbage, sauces and more. This will give her enough reserves so that she does not need to go running to the shop when she runs out. Having this loan will allow Ana to buy in bulk, instead of by the pound.

Ana's dream is to continue to increase sales and earn a higher income. This will give her children more stability. Ana's profits will be used to pay off her debt and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more basic supplies such as corn, pork, cheese tortillas, oil, cabbage, sauces and more.

loans.name: En Busca Del Progreso Group

texts.es:
IVETTE, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera. Ella forma parte del grupo "En busca del progreso" que está formado por siete socios, quienes eligieron el nombre del grupo debido a que ellos de forman conjunta buscan progresar en sus negocios, apoyándose unos a otros.
Ivette se dedica desde hace aproximadamente tres años a la preparación y venta de comida rápida como pollos broaster, sanguches, salchipapas, bebidas, etc. Éste negocio lo realiza en la puerta de su domicilio en un carrito sanguchero ambientado para la preparación de su comida. Gracias a éste negocio ella cubre sus gastos y puede ahorrar para más adelante estudiar una carrera profesional.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de su comida, como papa, pollos, los artículos descartables en los que sirve y bolsas plásticas.
texts.en:
Ivette is 22 years old and is single.  She is part of the "En Busca del Progreso (In Search of Progress)" group.  The group is made up of seven members who chose the name because they are all seeking to succeed in their businesses by supporting one another.  For the past three years, Ivette has worked making and selling fast-food such as fried chicken, sandwiches, hotdogs and french fries, drinks, etc.  She runs this business in her home from a food cart that is designed to prepare foods.  Through this business, she is able to cover her expenses and save to study for a professional career in the future.

The loan that she receives will be used to purchase supplies to prepare food such as potatoes, chickens, disposable containers to serve food, and plastic bags.

loans.use: purchase supplies to sell fast-food.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one in school and one underage. For the past eight years, she has operated a retail shop where she sells household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Fatuma owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour to resell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Omm Namah Sibaya Shg Group

texts.en:
Omm Namah Sibaya Self Help Group has 10 members who are all from the same neighbourhood. The lady standing with her raised hand is Tulasi, the leader of the group. Tulasi is a 27-year-old married woman from a small village of Odisha, India. The couple has two children who are schooling. Tulasi lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. For past five years she has been involved in the activity of growing and selling vegetables. Her husband and her parents help her in this activity. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to customer demand, Tulasi, together with Omm Namah Sibaya Self Help Group, has requested a loan amount of 120,000 INR for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Their goal is to expand their business activity.

All other members of this group are engaged other different kinds of activities like agriculture, cattle farming, etc

loans.use: To pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for cultivating vegetables.

loans.name: Laily

texts.en:
Laily is a 45-year-old married woman. Her husband is 50 years old. Laily is the mother of four children. Three children are studying in different classes and one of them is a mason. She lives in the small town of Dhupguri. 

Laily is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Laily wants to help her husband in his potato cultivation and expansion of their family business. Laily always wanted to be with her husband in every respect so that their family runs smoothly and their children do not get affected by poverty and ignorance. They always wish to give their best to their children. 

According to her, potato cultivation is a profitable business in her locality because there is a great demand for potatoes all over the year. That is why she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes. The field in which she is standing will be used for potato cultivation.

She is thankful Kiva and BJS for helping her financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Olivio

texts.es: Olivio, tiene la edad  de 51 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra de frijol y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Olivio is 51 years old, married and lives with his wife and children which are his highest priority.  With his loan he plans to good quality seeds as well as fertilizer and other products to use in the sowing of beans so that they have good germination.  He will also pay the labor for the application of the products and assistance in his farm once he develops it, thus making sure that he does a good job.  
He intends to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions of the zone for this activity and also put in practice his experience of years in the management of basic grains.  In addition to buying the best products of the best quality for his farm to have a good and healthy development for an adequate harvest and have an important production in the short term, he wants to use the income from the harvest he hopes to obtain for the well being of his family, education, and some other family goals, in addition to maintaining the investment in his crops.  
This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans in state banks but FEDECOSUR has given him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow beans.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married woman with four-school going children. For the past three years, she has operated a food kiosk. Mwaka sells to her neighbors and passersby and her major business challenges are theft and seasonality. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mwaka decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mwaka is requesting a loan to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, biscuits, tea leaves, beans, and wheat flour to sell. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, biscuits, tea leaves, beans, and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Jaynul

texts.en:
Jaynul is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in the Jalpaiguri district of Dhupguri. Her husband is 38 years old and by profession he is a farmer. Jaynul has received no education and can only sign her name. Jaynul is a mother of three children, and all of them receive education.

Jaynul has taken money from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products like ghee, paneer, cheese, etc. in her neighborhood. There is a great demand for dairy and dairy products in their locality, so she hopes she can earn a great profit from this business.

Jaynul is really thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Annapurna Sri Chaitanya Shg Group

texts.en:
Annapurna Sri Chaitanya Self Help Group was formed with ten members in 2011 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Basanti as the leader of their group. The lady standing with her raised hand is Basanti. She is a 45-year-old woman living with her husband and her three children. 

Since seven years ago, Basanti’s husband has been working as a farmer to manage his small family, but his income is not sufficient to manage the family. So Basanti is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the milk business. She has three years experience in this business.

She has requested a loan to buy a cow and fodder so that she can increase her family’s income. Basanti says that by selling milk, she can support her family and she can send her children to a good school. Through that, she can provide a better education to her son.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a cow and fodder and to make a cow shed.

loans.name: Ranjulata

texts.en:
Ranjulata is a 37-year-old widow lady who lives with her father and two sons age 14 years and 10 years. Her sons are attending school. She is the only source of income for her family. 

Ranjulata is engaged in a saree-selling business and she sells different types of sarees from her house. She has been in the business of selling sarees for ten years. 

She is applying for a loan to buy different types and styles of sarees in bulk to provide more choice of products to meet customer demand. This loan will help her improve her sales and enable her to offer a new product line to her customers. 

Her objective is to expand the business and include new products, such as kurta, pants, and shirts to her existing business. She wants to save for her sons' educations with the increased revenues from the increased sales supported by the new products.

loans.use: To buy different types and styles of sarees in bulk.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen cinco hijos ya todos viven fuera de casa, actualmente  vive con su pareja.


Ella posee una tienda en la que vende todo lo necesario para la cocina, ya tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad, la necesidad la llevo a iniciar una fuente de ingreso extra; por lo que decidió instalar la tienda como una fuente de ingreso, no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique, la tienda la tiene en su casa por lo que no tiene que recorrer distancias, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el horario de atención es de 6 am a 8 pm. 


El préstamo será invertido en reparar el corredor de su casa, ya que está en mal estado y cuando llueve penetra el agua a la casa, lo va a mejorar y con esto tendrá más tranquilidad, la necesidad satisfecha será el poder reparar la parte del corredor de su casa. 


Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que se da a conocer cada vez más.  El préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad que tiene de reparar su vivienda, la ganancia de la tienda será invertido en el pago de la cuota, y en ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia is 60 years old, and attended school until sixth grade.  She is married and her husband works in agriculture.  They have five children, none of whom live at home.  She lives with her husband.  She has a store where she sells everything needed for cooking, which she has had for three years.  The need for an extra source of income led her to start this business that she opened in her home as she does not have another job.  This allows her to not have to travel long distances.  No one else is involved in the store, and she tends to the store from 6am to 8pm.  

The loan will be used to repair the hallway in her home because it is in poor shape and when it rains, water leaks into the house.  She plans on fixing the roof so she can have peace of mind.  Her dreams are to be able to continue growing in her sales and with that improve her earnings as she learns more.  The loan will help her satisfy the need to repair her home.  The earnings from her store will be used to pay back the loan and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair the hallway in her house because it is in poor condition and when it rains, water leaks into the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools such as solder, a drill, drill bits, a set of wrenches, molds, figures, presses and others, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman and has four children; one is an adult, and three go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a coconut selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale and pay for transportation costs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale and pay for transportation costs

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
This is Charity. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase more gallons of milk for her business. Besides the milk-selling business, Charity also keeps chickens.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy chicks and chicken feed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed for her business

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards.

Besides the fish selling business, Mariamu operates a fruits and vegetable business. She is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Damary Apolonia

texts.es:
Damary, necesita capital para poder surtir la tienda con productos de primera necesidad, comprara arroz, azúcar, jugos, dulces, boquitas, aceite, frijol, sal, etc., cubrirá las necesidades de la clientela y sus ventas continuaran mejorando.
El efecto de la inversión anterior fue positivo puesto que su negocio creció, sus nuevos ingresos los ha utilizado para cubrir los gastos familiares, en su familia hay un nuevo miembro, todos se encuentran muy saludables.
texts.en: Damary is in need of capital to stock her store with essential goods.  She will purchase rice, sugar, juices, candy, snacks, oil, beans, salt, etc.  This will allow her to meet the needs of her customers and her earnings will continue to improve.  Her previous loan had a positive effect, and her business grew.  She has used her new earnings to cover her household expenses.  Her family has a new member now, and everyone is healthy.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, juice, candy, snacks, oil, beans, salt, etc.

loans.name: Gricelda De Jesus

texts.es:
Griselda, se encuentra en la necesidad de más capital para invertirlo en el negocio de la venta de pupusas, comprara tomates, repollo, vinagre, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, harina, entre otros materiales para continuar trabajando y atendiendo bien a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar el inventario del negocio, aumento la producción, atrajo más clientes, ya con su economía más estable ha mejorado su vivienda y su familia tiene una vida más confortable.
texts.en: Griselda is in need of more capital to invest in her business of selling pupusas (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans).  She will purchase tomatoes, cabbage, vinegar, oil, pork rinds, cheese, flour and other materials to continue working and serving her customers.  The previous loan helped her improve her business's inventory, increase production and attract more customers.  Now with a more stable financial situation, she has improved her home and her family now has a more comfortable life.

loans.use: purchase tomatoes, cabbage, vinegar, oil, pork rinds, cheese, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase paper towel, cookies, soap, detergent, snacks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Ashma

texts.en:
Ashma is a 26-year-old married woman living in the Jalpaiguri district of Dhupguri. Both Ashma and her husband are illiterate, and they can sign their names only. She is a mother of two children. The elder one is now not associated with any type of jobs and the younger one goes to school in grade 6.

She wishes to purchase a cow so that they can earn money by selling milk and milk products in the local bazaar. By occupation her husband is a farmer. The earning from her husband is not enough, so she decided to start a milk-selling business to run her family smoothly. 

She has applied a loan to BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow to start her dairy. Ashma is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to give a good future to her children. She also dreams to build a pakka (concrete) house for her family with her business profit.

Now Ashma is living happily with her family and gives thanks to BJS and Kiva for their great support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Dhaneswar

texts.en:
Dhaneswar is a 32-year-old differently able man who lives with his parents, wife and a 2-year-old son in a small village of Odisha, India. 

He is engaged in a fried rice business (dry rice used in India for snacks with pickles). He purchases rice from the market and then fries it without adding anything. He earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity, and that is insufficient for his monthly household income as he is the only earning person of this family.
