He has a plan to purchase more rice and make fried rice and then sell it to the retailers in the market so that he can make more money. For this he has applied for a loan to purchase rice and packing materials and to pay freight charges. 

He is very happy and grateful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: To purchase rice and packing materials and to pay freight charges.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a new client to the institution and has secured a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings to buy items for sale in the retail shop. The 27-year-old woman is married and blessed with two children. She hails from a rural trading center, Eastern division, Rukungiri municipality.

She operates a retail shop situated in Omukagashe and has been this business for the last five years. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to expand her business.

Her main challenge has been limited capital for business expansion. She appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial support granted to her and is hopeful that her business is going to expand to greater heights, and that she will be able to get more profits.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, sugar, soap, salt and bread, among other items

loans.name: Jena Ruth

texts.en:
This is Jena Ruth, 37, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jumar, a technician, and they have a child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Jena Ruth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Jena Ruth dreams that her business will continue to grow and expand and hopes that her child will have a good future and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to sell although due to lack of money he finds it difficult. 

Sonia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her husband offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. He will purchase an embroidery machine and a variety of embroidery materials. Sonia is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery accessories

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno appreciates her previous kiva loan which was used to improve her living standard of living and  expand her fish selling business. She can earn a higher income.

She is requesting a new loan to purchase re-stock fish to sell. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to re-stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a repeat client of the organization who is securing a loan of UGX 5,000,000. He is married and blessed with five kids, with three attending school. He hails from Rwenkureijo village, Kyamakanda parish, Buyanja sub-county, Rukungiri district.

Gerald operates a retail shop located in the Rwenkureijo trading centre. He has been carrying on this business for seven years but has been faced with a challenge of insufficient capital to purchase more stock for the retail shop. This has compelled him to join Ugafode for financial assistance so he can stock more goods to meet the needs of his clients. Gerald took this loan to expand his business so as to meet his family's financial needs and sustain his business. He is hard working and his dream is to expand his business and operate a wholesale business, and educate his children. He appreciates Ugafode for the financial assistance which has enabled him to sustain his business and meet his family obligations.

loans.use: To buy stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Balimaya est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala  qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels le Bois de chauffe, le Poisson, les Pagnes, les Condiments, le Savon, les Jus,  etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur douzième prêt de groupe. 
Korika est un membre du groupe Balimaya assise au bout et à gauche, vendeuse de pièces de pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  des pièces de pagnes de différentes qualités au grand marché et les ventes à la maison et au marché, à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Balimaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Korika compte réaliser  160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter leurs fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Balimaya is a group of women from Koutiala, who know one another well, and live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives.  They are, on average, 41 years old and have four children.  The women all sell various products, such as firewood, fish, pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), food, soap and juice.

As the members of the group would all like to increase the size of their businesses, they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their twelfth group loan.

Korika (sitting on the far left of the photo) sells pagnes.  She will buy various qualities of pagnes from the main market, and resell them from door-to-door and at the market, to various customers.

Most of the group members expect to make an average profit of 140,000 francs CFA over the course of the loan, but Korika expects to make 160,000 francs CFA.  As well as repaying their loans, the group will use their earnings to provide for their personal expenses and improve their working capital.  They would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso to ensure continuing satisfactory stock levels.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah. He lives with his wife and two young kids. He is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low salary. 

Hazem could not finish his studies earlier, due to the bad economic conditions he had, so now he has returned to his studies and is working toward a  BA degree in social science. Hazem would like to finish his study and find a better job in the future. 

Hazem took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Hazem will be able to do his homework and read articles online.  Hazem appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
This is Mbodze. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to increase her clothing inventory in her business. She has been in this business for years now, and it continues to grow. 


In addition to selling clothes,she operates a shop kiosk.  She would like to apply for a loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar to sell.   She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman who has been blessed with two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Mwanaisha has been operating a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan  to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Hadija has been operating a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Sabaly sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Kadia fait la vente de pagne wax dans ce groupe de femmes Sabaly, Elle est assise au milieu sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  15 pièces de pagne wax à Sikasso d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses pagnes wax, sa revente se fait en détail sur place et  au marché de Ouayerma I à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Sabaly Group are all married women who are, on average, 42 years old and have three children.  Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, a busy district of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This will be the group's thirteenth loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and it will be used to satisfy the demands of their customers.

Kadia (sitting in the middle of the photo) sells wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).  She will use her loan to buy fifteen wax pagnes from Sikasso.  Kadia is well known for the quality of the clothing she sells, she sells her product to individual men and women, locally and at the Ouayerma I market, for cash or on credit.

Kadia expects to make a monthly average profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and interest, and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a farmer who lives in the Nyamira area of South Nyanza with his wife and 2 children.

He has farmed for 6 years and what he loves most is horticulture and poultry farming.  His primary source of income is selling milk, eggs, tea, and a running a retail business.  His biggest challenge is picking tea because of heavy weeds.

Isaac said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their loans are customer friendly and have reduced interest rates.

During the training,he learned about the meaning of group and governance, how to develop a savings culture, causes of default within the group,and wise investing.

This loan will enable him to increase the number of poultry and production of eggs.  He will earn more income and thus his family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Tungdarshang

texts.en:
This young and vibrant woman, Tungdarshang, loves to fly high and explore the world. In the photo, she is featured with her mother. Tungdarshang belongs to one of a minor tribe in Manipur, India. She grew up in a tribal-oriented family. She has six siblings, and she is the fourth child to her parents. She has loving parents who can sacrifice all their comforts and needs just to fulfill their children’s wishes. Her father is the lone breadwinner of the family. 

Sometimes they find it very difficult to manage the family with just the meager monthly income of her father. Though her mother is a homemaker, her undying spirit to nurture and support her children in any career to which they aspire is such an inspiration to the children. “What I am today is all because of my mother. I give all the credit to her,” says Tungdarshang. 

Ever since her childhood, she always dreamed to become an airline hostess. Once she had been selected as a flight attendant at one of the airlines, but due to the poor financial condition, her parents could not meet the desired security deposit for the aviation training, which is mandatory for all the successful candidates. However, this time again, when the cabin crew interview was conducted in Imphal, she was selected. She didn't want to let the opportunity slip away this time. Therefore, she inquired of a few of her friends to give financial assistance because there is no one in the family who could financially support her. Her friends, who are also members of Kiva, recommended WSDS for giving education loans to those who need financial assistance. 

She believes that with the help of this loan, she will be able to smoothly fulfill her dreams to fly high, and prays that such glorious work flourishes forever.

In the future, she wishes to pay back the loan amount once she starts earning, provide financial help to her parents and ensure her other siblings get a good education, and earn her living.

loans.use: to pay for a security deposit for cabin crew training so that she can support her parents financially.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is a business man living in a rural area in Kibazi which is located in Kyamuhunga -Igara county in Ishaka. 

He is married and a father of one child who is not school-aged. He owns and runs a retail shop which gives him an opportunity to know his customer's needs so that he can serve them better. 

In addition to the shop, he also has a coffee plantation and he sells the coffee beans.  This is a way of earning additional income. He started the business in 2004 to earn income  to support his family and better their standard of living. He would like to use 1,500,000 UGX  to buy more stock so that his good clients  can have a variety of items to choose from.  This will help to win their loyalty. 

Lack of capital is his major challenge but he believes it will no longer be a challenge if the loan is given. He will stock more items, make higher sales, and earn more profit which would in turn give him financial stability.

loans.use: to buy retail stock.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a very hard-working woman who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be much more successful. She lives at the Coastal region of Kenya.

Luvuno has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer), a business which she has run for three years. 

She needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason, she requests a loan through Yehu, to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

loans.use: to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Kadia fait la vente des ustensiles en plastique dans ce groupe de femmes Benkadi, Elle est assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  des ustensiles en plastique (assiettes, pots, tasses en plastique)  au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle grâce à la qualité de ses marchandises, sa revente se fait en détail sur place et  au marché  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi Group are all married women who are, on average, 38 years old and have three children.  Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, a busy district of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This will be their second group loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and they will use it to satisfy the needs of their customers.

Kadia (sitting second from the left in the photo) sells plastic utensils.  She will use her loan to buy kitchen utensils (plates, pots and cups) at the main market.  She is well known for the quality of her products, and sells to individual men and women, locally and at the market, for cash or on credit.

Kadia expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and interest, and increase the level of her savings.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Maku

texts.en: Maku's previous loan improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She requested another loan from Yehu, which she will use to buy more pieces of women's wrap clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase women's wrap clothes to sell

loans.name: Cayetano Alberto

texts.es:
Cayetano de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado quien es ama de casa, es la que se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, han procreado 4 hijos; pero solo dos viven con ellos. El señor Cayetano actualmente se desempeña como agricultor en pequeño, también trabaja en un beneficio de café.  

Cayetano se dedica a trabajar la tierra desde la edad de los cinco años,  su padre lo indujo al buen camino, de ser una persona de bien y productiva. En la zona que vive es totalmente agrícola, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz y maicillo, también tiene ganado los cuales cuida, el trabajo lo tiene cerca de la casa por lo que no necesita un medio de transporte para ir a su trabajo, la actividad la realiza en compañía de sus hermanos, el horario de trabajo lo realiza de 5 am a 12 md.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar herramientas para su hijo que es mecánico auto motriz. El mejoramiento del préstamo será que su hijo pueda tener su propio equipo de trabajo, con esto podrá realizar su trabajo individualmente.
 
El poder tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad que tiene su hijo de comprar herramientas.  Con la prestación de servicio que su muchacho realice van air pagando la cuota y ahorrando para futuras inversiones.
texts.en:
Cayetano, 57, studied through the second grade. He is married to his wife, a housewife who is in charge of household chores. They have four children with two still living with them. Cayetano currently works as a small-scale farmer and also works in a coffee plantation. 

Cayetano has worked the land since the age of five. His father led him on this right path to be a good and productive person. The area in which he lives in entirely agricultural. He plants corn, rice, and sorghum. He also has cattle that he cares for. His work is close to home so he does not need a means of transportation to get to work. His work is undertaken in the company of his brothers. They work from 5 am to noon. 

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tools for his son who is an auto mechanic. The loan will allow his son to have his own equipment so that he can do his work independently. 

The first thing in his life is his family and what is necessary for them. He hopes to always work as long as God grants him life and health. This loan will help him meet the needs of his son and buy his tools. With the provision of the service by his son, he will make repayments and save for future investments.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his son, an auto mechanic.

loans.name: Dhabaleswar Shg Group

texts.en:
Manjula is a 42-year-old lady. She is living in Odisha with her parents, husband and her two children who are schooling. Her husband is a farmer. 

For the past two years, Manjula has been engaged in the activity of selling cow’s milk in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. Manjula is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group, Dhabaleswar SHG Self-Help Group (SHG). There are seven members in the group, and all are women. The members of the group are involved in different kinds of activities like agriculture, and some have grocery shops. 

She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 175,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. 

Manjula has a dream to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and repair her cow shed.

loans.name: Tuli

texts.en:
Tuli is a 40-year-old woman from the village of Bagnan in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a mother of two school-going children (one son, one daughter). They are in grade 5 and 10. Her husband, Manna, aged 45 years, is associated with a business. Tuli and her husband both are illiterate and can only sign their names.

Tuli's husband earns very little from his business, which is not sufficient for their family’s needs. Tuli is a housewife and does the household jobs and looks after her children and husband. Her husband is the only source of income for the family.  They need to increase their income. In order to help her husband, Tuli has decided to start a business of dried fish.

So, she has taken a loan from BJS to purchase dried fish from the wholesalers for her product inventory. The people of her locality are very much fond of this fish, so she hopes that her earnings from this business will be good enough and a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. More dried fish to sell will result in better profit.

Tuli hopes that her business will continue and flourish in the coming days. She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old married man who works as a barber for his living. In January 2003, Ali established his current business, and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can to make sure it will take care of his family's increasing needs and customers' requests.
Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy new updated tools for his business development, and to make necessary decoration for his shop to attract new customers.
Ali is willing to keep on developing and expanding his business through diversifying his services in a very well managed way to make sure that he can improve his family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To buy new updated tools for his business development, and to make necessary decoration for his shop to attract new customers

loans.name: Gustavo Alexander

texts.es: Gustavo Alexander, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está en unión libre, vive con su hijo  y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de conservación de suelos para que cuando inicien las lluvias evitar la erosión por el agua de lluvia, y asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo  de una variedad se adapte bien a las condiciones de suelo y clima de la zona, y realizar la resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gustavo Alexander is 24 years old. He is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his child and wife, who are his main priority. 

With his loan, he hopes to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay for labor in jobs conserving the land so that when the rains begin he avoids erosion by the rain. He also hopes for help with the coffee, as well as purchasing some copperwood plants in a variety that adapts well to the ground and climate conditions of the area, and to complete resowing at the beginning of the rains. He will do this with the goal of increasing the density of plants by area, as well as taking advantage of the good fertility of the ground, climate conditions, and others that favor coffee cultivation. 

With these improvements in the crops, he hopes to earn some profits and so improve his family’s living conditions, invest a little more in the crops, and also complete some goals. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to receive help with his coffee crops.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
This is Mwanasha. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She still prepares dumplings. She is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and baking powder for her business.

 She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour ,cooking oil and baking powder for her business.

loans.name: Abed Alqader

texts.en:
Abed Alqader is 23 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it one year ago.

Abed Alqader is applying for this loan to purchase shelves and a refrigerator. This will allow him to increase his stock so that he can increase his customers and his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions of his family.  

His dream is to expand his business. Abed Alqader is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase shelves and a refrigerator to allow him to increase his stock.

loans.name: Mishaki

texts.en:
Mishaki is a farmer in a remote area which is found in the Bugongi town council in the Sheema District. He is a married man and a father of six children aged between 45 and 19 years. 

He is a hard-working man who started working and farming in the year 2004 with much vigor, since he had hopes that his efforts would be rewarded. Farming is his sole source of income, which is the reason why he invests a lot of time and effort into it. He started the business because he needed a source of income, which he would use to look after his family. 

He applied for a loan of one million eight hundred thousand shillings to be able to buy goats, tools, and seeds to use on the farm and plant more so can harvest much more, make higher sales, and earn much more as opposed to what he has been earning. 

His clients are traders in the same area where he operates from and with their support, he hopes to stay in business, especially if the loan is given to him. Competition is the major challenge he faces, and this reduces his sales in a given period, but he is hopeful that he will beat the competition- especially when the business grows.

loans.use: to buy goats, agricultural tools, and farm inputs

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Dramane est né vers 1977, marié et père de 4 enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants  dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur  Dramane après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initié il y a quatre années aux activités d’achat et de vente des bazins blancs, des soudes caustiques, des teintures, des potasses, etc. Il mène son activité à Wayerma I où il dispose sa boutique. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  il y a trois années et il est à son septième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Ce  nouveau prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 33 paquets de soude caustique, 30 pièces de bazin blancs, 10 sacs de potasse et 10 boîtes de teinture de couleurs différentes. Ses marchandises sont achetées à Bamako pour la revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes teinturières de Sikasso.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce présent prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Dramane was born around 1977.  He is married, has four children and lives in a large, traditional family in Wayerma I, a popular district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Dramane has unsuccessfully tried many ways to earn money.  Four years ago he started to buy and sell white damask fabric, caustic soda, dyes, potash, etc.  He runs a small shop in Wayerma I, and is much sought after by his customers for the high quality of his products.

As his customer levels rose, and in order to satisfy their demands, Dramane started working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, three years ago.  This will his seventh loan.  All the previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.  He will use this loan to buy 33 packets of caustic soda, 30 pieces of white damask fabric, 10 sacks of potash and 10 boxes of different coloured dyes.  He buys his supplies in Bamako and sells mostly to women dyers in Sikasso.

Dramane expects to earn a profit of 70,000 francs CFA a month, which he will use to increase his working capital, contribute to the expenses of his family, repay the loan and interest and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various products for sale in his shop.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Meet Amos, a 26 year-old farmer who comes from Nyamira area of South Nyanza, Kenya, with his wife and three children who are school-aged. He has been farming for the past seven years, with his primary income being tea crops, and eggs.  What he loves most about farming is rearing his cattle, while his biggest challenge is tea-picking because of the lack of enough labourers.
Amos chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they work closely with farmers to help improve their livelihoods.  During the training, he learned about group cohesion and proper loan repayment. Through this loan, there will be an increase in income.Thus his family's needs will be met, and also his children's school fees will be met.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is 34 years old. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a business for many years, generating income for his family. All of his efforts  provide comfort to his family members.

Dilshad owns a footwear shop, in which he sells fancy footwear of various designs. He buys fancy footwear from the wholesaler and sells from his own shop. He sells a variety for women and children and wants to offer men’s shoes as well. Due to financially constraints, he is unable to buy men’s footwear at this time.
  
Dilshad requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which he will use to buy men's footwear such as nylon, leather, and joggers shoes to sell from his shoe shop. He wants to keep a maximum variety of shoes, so he can earn maximum profit for his family.

loans.use: to purchase men's footwear such as nylon, leather, and joggers shoes to sell

loans.name: Victorino Asuncion

texts.es: Victorino Asunción mayor de edad casado con tres hijos menores de edad y aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Victorino se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es un microempresario que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como:variedades estilos de ropa, como pantalones, faldas, blusas, short, calzados, chinerias, cosméticos, productos plásticos, entre otros de forma ambulante y por encargo ademas por las mañanas se dedica a la compra venta de mariscos los cuales compra a comerciantes de los mercados luego sale a distribuir por los barrios, colonias comarcas aledañas a su localidad, sus compras son al contado, y sus ventas al contado y al crédito el cual recupera semanal lo invertido, uno de sus sueños es poder realizarle algunas mejoras a su vivienda para brindarle un techo digno a su familia y poder ver profesionales a sus hijos, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo e invertir en sus dos negocios de mercadería en general y en compra de mariscos. Victorino agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Victorino Asunción is a married adult with 3 minor children who are still his responsibility.  He is a native of the municipality of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  Victorino is known for being a hardworking and responsible man who has a strong desire for personal success.  He has a small business selling general merchandise such as a variety of styles of clothing, including pants, skirts, blouses, shorts, and shoes.  He also sells trinkets, cosmetics, plastic products, and other items.  He sells from place to place, and also by taking orders.  In addition to this activity he also buys and sells seafood in the mornings from the traders in the markets which he later goes out to distribute through the neighborhoods and districts surrounding his area.  He makes his purchases in cash, and sells both on a cash and credit basis.  He makes his collections weekly.  

One of Victorino's dreams is to be able to do some improvements to his house, so that he could provide his family with a decent roof.  He also dreams of seeing his children become professionals.  His goal for this loan is to get working capital to invest in his two businesses: the sale of general merchandise and seafood sales.  Victorino really appreciates the support that Kiva lenders are offering to people of limited resources.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his businesses

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a married woman and a mother of three grown up children. She is from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than 2 years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Trinidad is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business, thus augmenting her sales and income. Trinidad is hopeful that she will be able to improve her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for food consumption.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own mobile shop for past four years. 

Sultana's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Sultana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase the relevant items for his business so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and the household.
Sultana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of Mobile accessories for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married and the mother of two children.  For seven years, she has made dolls and toys, a skill she learned in courses.  After she learned her trade, she began selling her products in tourist areas and later at a stand.  As the toys she made became popular, she decided to print cards and work to order.  

With the loan from Maya, she will increase her variety of products.  

Emine is hardworking, determined, practical, enterprising and productive. 

In the future she wants to open a big toy store and workshop.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Emine Hanım, evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Yedi senedir bez bebek ve oyuncak yapıyor.  Bu işi yapabilmek için önce kurslara gitmiş.  Öğrendikten sonra yaptığı oyuncakları önce turistik yerlerde sonra tezgahta satmaya başlamış.  Yaptığı oyuncaklar çok beğeni toplayınca kendine kart bastırarak sipariş üzerine çalışmaya karar vermiş.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini arttıracak.  Emine Hanım çalışkan,azimli,pratik fikirli,girişken ve üretken bir yapıya sahiptir.  Gelecekte büyük bir oyuncak dükkanı ve atölyesi açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to increase her variety of products

loans.name: Lara

texts.en:
Lara is 21 years old. She lives with her family, which consists of seven members. 

Lara is a university student majoring in Class Teaching. She is in her third year. Because of her responsibility towards her family, she is planning to work in her study field after graduation to support her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mazlooma

texts.en:
Mazlooma is a 23 year old woman, and mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession, selling apples, bananas, grapes and etc. He is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Mazlooma's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But, due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose. Therefore, Mazlooma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

Mazlooma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to attend to her coffee crops this season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell at wholesale prices and to start selling beers, also at wholesale price.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 53 years old, married and had two children. Two are studying and are in need of a daily allowance. Her spouse is a farmer. 

To gain income, Carolina sells fruits and vegetables. She had been doing it for over five years, and gets a minimum income of P300 each day. 

She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy more vegetables(cabbages, tomatoes, eggplant)
to sell. 

Someday, she hopes to become an active entreprenuer so she will gain good profits for her children's education and the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables (cabbages, tomatoes, eggplant) to sell

loans.name: Hicran

texts.en:
Hicran is married and the mother of two children.  Her husband is a worker at a large company. Hicran has sold shoes and sandals at a market for 15 years to contribute to the family income. She began this work with little capital and a small stand. She first bought herself a car and then expanded the stand and her variety of products. With this loan, she will buy more types of shoes. Hicran has a hardworking, ambitious and determined nature and wants to open a store to expand her business in the future.  She wants to provide her children with a better future this way. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Hicran , evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi bir kurumda işçi olarak çalışıyor.  Hicran hanım 15 yıldır pazarda ayakkabı ve terlik satarak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Bu işe küçük bir pazar tezgahında küçük bir sermaye ile başlayan Hicran hanım önce kendine bir araç almış daha sonra tezgahını büyüterek ürün çeşidini artırmış.  Aldığı kredi ile ayakkabı çeşidini arttıracak .  Çalışkan,hırslı ve azimli bir yapıya sahip olan Hicran hanım gelecekte dükkan açarak işlerini daha da büyütmek istiyor.  Böylece çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek bırakmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more types of shoes.

loans.name: Ulfridis

texts.es:
Ulfridis de 47 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, que a pesar de solo tener séptimo grado de educación básica, él se ha dedicado a la albañilería, un trabajo bastante pesado pero es de lo cual obtiene sus ingresos para su familia.

Ulfridis aprendió este oficio desde que tenía 12 años, debido a que la necesidad que presentaban sus padres era  grande, por lo  que él dejo sus estudios y comenzó  como ayudante de un amigo quien ya era albañil con experiencia, con el tiempo Ulfridis fue aprendiendo muy bien el trabajo  y hoy en día es un albañil muy conocido por su trabajo.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar algunas herramientas, las cuales son muy importantes para que realice su trabajo. Por el momento sus herramientas están deterioradas, lo que le impide poder seguir trabajando.

Ulfridis quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales, para que en un futuro puedan ser personas de beneficio para la sociedad. Debido a que él no pudo seguir estudiando, por la situación que vivían  sus padres en ese entonces.
texts.en:
Ulfridis, 47, is a hardworking man. Despite only having a basic education up to the seventh grade, he has earned his living in masonry, a heavy duty job but one that brings income for his family.

Ulfridis learned this trade when he was 12 years old. Because his parents' needs were great, he left school and started working as an assistant to a friend who was already a mason. He gained experience over time. Ulfridis was learning to do very good work and today, he is a mason who is known for his work. 

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy some tools which are essential for his work. His current tools are damaged, preventing him from continuing working.

Ulfridis wants his children to be professionals so that in the future they will be valuable to society. It's because he could not continue with his education because of his parents' living situation at the time.

loans.use: to purchase tools that are essential for his business.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 38 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Shamshad is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute, with her husband, to manage the household.
 
Shamshad needs different kinds of goods (e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil and etc.) for her business purpose but, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Shamshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some products for her business (i.e clothes, threads, needles and etc.).

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 33 years old and a married women. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and she is a mother of two children.
Her husband has been running his own welding shop for the last five years, and he is the only one who supports his family. Both children are students.

That's why Rukhsana applied for the loan from Kiva partner BARC Pakistan to buy some more instruments for her husband's welding shop to improve his business. 

She hopes that she will save the income for future.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some insutruments for her husband's welding business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the missing items in the grocery store and to buy salon equipments.

loans.name: Eveling Jannet

texts.es:
Eveling Jannet, es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad desde hace cuatro años, para culminar su carrera le falta poco menos de un año de estudios. Ella se ha dedicado por completo a sus estudios ya que reconoce el enorme sacrificio que hacen sus padres para brindarle lo necesario para poder culminar su carrera profesional. En vista de que en la actualidad es necesario aprender el idioma inglés cualquiera sea la carrera profesional elegida, ella inició sus clases de inglés.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para pagar sus estudios de ingles del nivel avanzado.
texts.en:
Eveling Jannet has been an accounting student for four years. To finish her career, she needs a little less than one more year of school. 

She has dedicated herself to completing her studies because she recognizes the enormous sacrifice her parents made to give her what she needed to finish her professional career. 

Given that it's now necessary to learn English in any chosen professional career, she began English classes.

She is now asking for a loan to pay for her studies of English at an advanced level.

loans.use: to pay for an advanced English class.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 42 years old and she lives in Dilijan city. She lives with her two school-aged children. 

Naira works at the school, and at the same time she sells vegetables at the Dilijan wholesale market. She buys her stall products from the nearby villages. She works very hard to earn to support their living and provide good living conditions for her children. Naira manages all the work alone, and dreams of a better and easier life for her small family.

Naira asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams since she wants to buy a garage as she has no place to store the vegetables for sale. Keeping it at home is not comfortable, and there is a little space for it.

loans.use: to buy a garage for her vegetables.

loans.name: Nimaika

texts.en:
Nimaika is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more gallons of paraffin for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of paraffin for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially. She is requesting for a loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.
She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Maudah

texts.en:
Maudah is an old client of UGAFODE who has secured a loan of 1,500.000 UGX . She is a 47-year-old woman, and she is a widow with 3 children. She is a resident of Buyanja TC, Rukungiri district.

She is a hardworking lady who sells secondhand clothes as her main source of income to meet all her financial needs.

Her dream is to educate her children and expand her business to a greater volume, but her main challenge has been limited capital for buying more stock. Therefore, she decided to join UGAFODE for financial support to boost her business and educate her children.

She appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial support rendered to her and is hopeful that she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 50-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Rukhsana is also providing sewing services, and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She is in need of different kinds of goods, e.g. needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories, and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some products for her business use, i.e cloth, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Tacko's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juin 2008.Il est composé de membres qui habitent la même ville,elles ont comme activité la transformation de produits céréaliers et le commerce de marchandises.

Tacko qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 65 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont une fille.

Son activité est la transformation de produits céréaliers tels que le mil,le maïs et les haricots.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter du mil pour une valeur de 75000,du maïs pour une valeur de 25000f et des haricots pour une valeur de 25000f 

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne,participer à la dépense de nourriture chez elle.
texts.en:
This group has been created in June 2008. Its members live in the same village. They process cereals for sale and also sell various merchandise. Tacko, the one raising her hand on the right in the photo, is our star borrower. She is 65 years, married, and has four children, including one daughter.

Her line of business is processing cereals such as millet, corn and beans. With this loan, she plans to buy millet for 75,000 West African francs, corn for 25,000 francs and beans for 25,000 francs. Her goal is increase her savings and contribute to the cost of food for the household.

loans.use: to buy millet, corn and beans.

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Isabela is in her early 40's and divorced. She has four children, three of whom are in school. Isabela has had two businesses, a genge selling fruits and vegetables and second-hand clothes. She has been in these businesses for five years, and is able to generate a small monthly profit. 

This is her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, which have been paid off successfully, to buy second-hand clothes, and fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, onions, carrots, coconuts and others). Isabela managed to generate extra income which she used to pay school fees and for family welfare. She believes that through Kiva's loan support, her family and business will improve. 

She really appreciates your loan support. 

Isabela will use this loan to restock both her businesses with new goods. She dreams of owning a wholesale food shop. 

Isabela will share this loan with her loan group, "KONDOA", which contains six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her both businesses with new goods.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Margie has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for nine years.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Javlon

texts.ru:
Чавлон житель села Куруш. Чавлон трудолюбивый добрый человек. Ему 34 года. Чавлон заботливый отец и понимающий муж. У него трое детей. Дети Чавлона еще маленькие, учатся в школе. Жена Чавлона Инобад домохозяйка. Она не где не работает, так как Инобат не имеет высшего образования. Инобат больше времени проводит с детьми для их семьи самое главное это дети. Чавлон с женой хотят, чтоб его дети росли воспитанными и образованными. Для этого семья Чавлона трудятся со всеми силами. 
Как и другие жители села Чавлон тоже занимается скотоводством. Ему конечно в этом помогает Инобат. Она сама откармливает скатов, когда Чавлон уходит на поле. Чавлон кроме скотоводство еще занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он по сезону сажает разные виды сельхоз культур. В данное время Чавлон подготавливает землю, обрабатывает ее удобрениями для посадки семян. Для подготовки земли и для посадки семян нужны денежные средства но, к сожалению Чавлону не хватает тех денег, которых он копил всю зиму. С финансовой проблемой Чавлон обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Он очень надеется на поддержку организации и выражает свою благодарность МДО Арванд.
texts.en:
Javlon is a resident of Kurush village. Javlon is a hardworking, kind person. He is 34 years old. Javlon is an attentive father and understanding husband. He has three children. Javlon's children are still very young and attend school. Javlon's wife, Inobat, is a homemaker. She doesn't work anywhere as she does not have a higher education. Inobat spends the majority of her time with her children as the children are the most important part of their family. Javlon and his wife want their children to grow up well-mannered and educated. For his family, Javlon works with all his strength.

Like other residents of his village, Javlon also practices cattle breeding. Of course, Inobat helps him with this. She fattens up the cattle while Javlon is away working in the fields. In addition to cattle breeding, Javlon also practices crop farming. He seasonally sows different types of crops. Currently, Javlon is preparing the land and cultivating it with fertilizers for sowing seeds. In order to prepare the land for sowing seeds, a certain amount of money is required. Unfortunately, the money which Javlon saved up all winter is not enough. Because of his financial difficulties, Javlon turned to Arvand for a loan. He really relies on the organization's assistance and thanks Arvand for their help.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Azatuhi

texts.en:
Azatuhi is a young farmer from the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law, brothers-in-law and sister. The family is engaged in agriculture, and only Azatuhi's husband works as an army officer. 

In the greenhouse which the family owns they cultivate greens, potatoes and tomatoes. 

Income from agriculture is very important for this family’s living, therefore the family works hard to run their farm in a sustainable way. 

Azatuhi has now applied for this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to renovate the greenhouse and purchase seeds for land cultivation. 

This loan will be a huge support for Azatuhi's farm, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Aregnazan

texts.en:
Aregnazan is 54 years old and lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. She is married and has a son and a daughter. Both her children are married. Her son and his family live with Aregnazan and help her with her agricultural activities. Aregnazan’s husband is a constructor, but he also is mainly busy with farming. In the nearby village of Srashen, Aregnazan has a big farm with cows, calves, bulls, sheep, piglets and chickens. She also has a large greenhouse where she cultivates mainly greens and cucumbers. Aregnazan sells a great variety of farm products at the Kapan wholesale market. Farming supports many of the financial needs of her family. 
  
She asks for a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to buy polyethylene plastic sheeting, seedlings, and fertilizer for her greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy polyethylene plastic sheeting, seedlings, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, coffee plant formula, and fungicides so that she can maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 31 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilou has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fredy David

texts.es:
Fredy, tiene 30 años, administra un taller de estructuras metálicas, con el cual genera los ingresos para mantener a su familia, su negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, atiende de 6:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., su familia está integrada por su esposa y dos hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de hierro y una pulidora de metal, entregara con mayor calidad los trabajos solicitados por sus clientes, espera aumentar su popularidad, tener mayores ganancias para cancelar las cuotas del crédito.
Anhela  contar un negocio más rentable para que su familia tenga una mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Fredy is 30 years old. He runs a metal workshop which generates income to support his family. He started the business under his own initiative and works from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm. His family is made up of his wife and their two children aged 2 and 5. 

The loan will be used to buy iron and a metal polisher. He will be able to deliver higher quality work to his customers and expects to increase his popularity and generate higher earnings with which to pay off his loans.

He longs to have a more profitable business so that his family can have better food, clothing, health and education.

loans.use: to buy iron and a metal polisher

loans.name: Margarita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Margarita, a sus 62 años de edad, aún tiene energías para trabajar y conseguir su sustento, desde hace 4 años inició una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con poco capital y la ubicó en la casa donde vive, poco a poco fue aumentando sus inventarios al ser reconocida en el sector, de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para pagar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Trabaja sola todos los días con el ánimo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y tener la posibilidad de adquirir una casa propia en un futuro, además sueña con ampliar su negocio, razón por la que solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, chocolate, lácteos, carnes frías), esto le permitirá ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes para satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de las ventas y sus ingresos para disfrutar una vejez tranquila y sin ninguna preocupación.
texts.en:
Margarita, at 62 years old, still has the energy to work and earn her living. Four years ago, she opened a small grocery store with a little capital; it is located in the house where she lives. Little by little, she has augmented her inventory and now she is well-known in the area. This is how she generates sufficient income to pay for her basic household expenses.

Margarita works alone every day with the intention of improving her living conditions and having the possibility of buying her own house in the future. In addition, she dreams of expanding her business, which is why she requested the help of this loan. 

With the loan, she will buy an assortment of products at wholesale (snacks, cookies, chocolate, dairy products, cold deli meats), which will allow her to offer more variety to her customers to satisfy their different tastes and needs. This will be reflected in an increase in sales and income so that she can enjoy her old age in tranquility, free of worry.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products at wholesale (snacks, cookies, chocolate, dairy products, cold deli meats)

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cecilia de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen dos hijos los cuales viven con ellos, la mayor va a la escuela estudia su noveno grado, nadie más vive con ellos, por lo que solo sus dos hijos depende de sus ingresos. 


Ella tiene una tienda, también tiene una granjita de pollos, los que engorda para luego venderlos, ya tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad, la necesidad la llevo a iniciar una fuente de ingresos extra;  el horario de atención de la tienda es de 6 am a 8 pm. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar arroz, frijoles, detergentes, aceites, para la tienda  y la otra parte para comprar pollos para el engorde.  El mejoramiento será  que podrá incrementar más sus ingresos, por lo que con el préstamo ya no andara  prestando dinero a particulares para seguir su negocio.


Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que se da a conocer con su tienda cada vez más, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad que tiene de invertir con un capital de trabajo, las ganancias de esto serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y en el cuido a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 32 years old and has two children who live with her. Her husband works in agriculture. Her oldest child goes to school and is in Grade 9. No one else lives with them and just the two children are dependent on their income.

Cecelia has a store and also has a small chicken farm where she raises chickens to sell. She started doing this 3 years ago as she needed an extra source of income. The store is open from 6 am until 8 pm.

The loan Cecilia is requesting is to buy rice, beans, detergent and oil for the store and the other part is to buy chickens to fatten. She will be able to increase her revenues and with the loan she will no longer have to go to individuals to borrow money to keep her business going.

Her dream is to always increase her sales and through this have more revenue and her store will become better known. The loan will satisfy her need to invest working capital. The profits from this will be use to pay off the loan and to take care of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil and detergents for her store and another part to buy chickens.

loans.name: Marta Irene

texts.es: Marta tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 13 años y su hijo de 7 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 5 años. De esta forma es como lleva el sustento a su hogar y mantiene la economía de su hogar. Marta desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda dado que se encuentra en mal estado y no es muy seguro para sus hijos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lamina galvanizada y madera para para reparar el techo y las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta is 35 years old. She lives in her own home with her 13 year old daughter and her 7 year old son. She has been selling used clothing for the past 5 years. This is how she supports her household and the family economy.

Marta wants to improve the condition of her house as it is in poor shape and not very safe for her children. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized laminate and wood to repair the walls and roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate and wood to repair the walls and roof of her house.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 13 años de edad y se gana la vida por medio de la venta de antojitos típicos como: pasteles de carne y enchiladas. Ademas, también se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir dentro de su comunidad. Es muy emprendedora y visionaria por lo que muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su integridad. Yesenia desea construir una letrina abonera para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, ladrillo, cemento y lámina. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 42 years old and resides in her own home along with her 13-year-old son. She earns her living by selling traditional street food, such as meat turnovers and enchiladas. Yesenia also spends time producing clothes to sell in her community. She is very enterprising and is a visionary, which is why many people have provided good references with regard to her integrity.

Yesenia wants to build a composting latrine, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of sand, bricks, cement, and metal sheets. Yesenia hopes to receive this loan so that she can provide better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a composting latrine.

loans.name: Rezel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rezel works hard to support her family.

She has an e-loading (mobile prepaid load) business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rezel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more prepaid load to sell to customers for her e-loading (mobile prepaid load) business.

Rezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid load to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As the married mother of seven children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nancy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional fruits to sell.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari is married and has one child. She is from Ashotavan community. For the last three years, Mari has been running a farm. She keeps livestock and cultivates land. Both Mari and her husband are unemployed and their only source of income is farming. They work hard to have a successful and profitable farm.

Mari requested a loan for $3,000, which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel, and forage for the livestock and to hire a workforce for land cultivation. With her husband's help only, Mari is not able to use all the land that she owns so this loan will be a great help for her.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel, and forage for the livestock and to hire a workforce for land cultivation

loans.name: Naime

texts.en:
Naime is divorced and has two children. Naime, still young after graduating, began doing handwork teaching district courses. After she married, she continued doing this work at home. Naime has made toys by batik dying, felt work, point lace, and hand knitting for 20 years and sold them sometimes from her house and sometimes at a stand. With this loan, she will buy materials. The money she makes provides her household income as well as her children's school expenses, including for one who is outside the city. Naime is driven, meticulous at her work and not afraid to face difficulties. These qualities have helped her enormously in life's struggles. She wants to give her children a good life and future and to open a small shop where she can sell her products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Naime Hanım, eşinden ayrılmış iki çocuklu biridir. Naime Hanım, olgunlaşmadan mezun olduktan sonra ilçede kurs hocalığı yaparak el işi yapmaya başlamıştır. Evlendikten sonra bu işlere evinde devam etmiştir. Naime hanım 20 yıldır batik,keçe iğne oyası ve el örgüsü oyuncaklar yaparak bu ürünleri bazen evinde bazen tezgahta satmaktadır. Aldığı bu kredi ile malzeme alacak. Naime hanım sattığı ürünlerle hem evinin geçimini sağlamakta hem de biri şehir dışında olmak üzere 2 çocuğunun eğitim masraflarını karşılamaktadır. Naime hanım hırslı, zorluklar karşısında yılmayan ve işinde titiz birisidir. Bu özellikleri ona bu hayat mücadelesinde çok şey kazandırmıştır. Çocuklarına iyi bir hayat ve gelecek vermek isteyen Naime hanım ileride el işlerini satabileceği küçük bir dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Herodina

texts.en:
Herodina is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Herodina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Herodina has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mariela Del Rocio

texts.es: Mariela vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos, ella tiene 42 años de edad,  se dedica con mucho amor a la ganadería y dice que le va bien en esta actividad que es así como ha podido cubrir los gastos de su familia y sobre todo los de educación de sus hijos, de los cuales uno asiste al colegio y el mayor quiere irse a la universidad pero por falta de recursos económicos no lo ha hecho, su esposo se dedica a trabajar al jornal y también le ayuda con el ganado, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, lo que más desea Mariela es progresar en la ganadería y conseguir el dinero para que su hijo se vaya a la universidad y llegue a ser un profesional y tenga un futuro más digno.
texts.en:
Mariela is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She works with a lot of love raising livestock and says that this activity is going well. She can cover the costs of the family and the educational expenses for her children. One of them is attending Secondary school and the oldest wants to go to university but has not due to a lack of financial resources. Her husband works as day labor and also helps with the cows.

Mariela will use the loan to buy a cow. What she wants more than anything is to progress with her cattle raising and get the money to send her son to university so as to become a professional and have a more dignified future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: María Elicita

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos mayores y tres de 16, 11 y 5  años que son los que aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante y agricultor. 
Doña María realiza el crédito para el negocio familiar, ellos tienen una tienda de víveres en la ciudad de Portoviejo donde alquilan un local en el cual venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, allí día a día ellos se trasladan desde su hogar hasta este local a vender los productos. Su esposo también tiene cultivos de arroz y maíz en toda época del año, esta es la forma como ellos luchan todos los días por darles un mejor bienestar a sus hijos de una manera honrada.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda va a comprar víveres y abonos para los cultivos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Santa Rosa del Blanco” meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto. This area is known for its traditional culture. It is also located a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Sra. María lives in this place. She is 38 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children. Two of her children are grown and the remaining three are ages 16, 11, and 5. The three younger children live with her and attend school. Her husband is a merchant and farmer.

Dona María is taking out a loan for the family business. They have a grocery store in the city of Portoviejo that is in a rented location. They sell all types of basic necessity products. María must travel there every day from her house in order to sell her products. Her husband grows rice and corn throughout the year. They strive to provide the best for their children’s well-being in an honest manner.

This loan will be used to restock her store with more products. She will buy provisions, as well as compost for their crops. María has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and she enjoys having the assistance. Her dreams include having a shop of her own.

loans.use: to buy provisions to sell and compost for her husband's crops.

loans.name: Maria Diosa

texts.en:
As the married mother of eight children, Maria Diosa works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling brooms in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Maria Diosa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her business making and selling brooms.

Maria Diosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her broom making.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 36 years old and married with three children.

Maricris works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, powdered milk and other groceries.

Maricris has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maricris aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, powdered milk and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa, requiere más capital para comprar maíz, yuca, papas, pollo, aceite, leña, condimentos, tomates, le será de mucha ayuda para que su negocio continúe funcionando y satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior su inventario para elaborar antojitos se vio debidamente surtido permitiéndole un aumento en su producción, sus ventas han mejorado, pudo remodelar su vivienda y su economía es un poco más estable, su familia goza de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa needs more capital to purchase corn, yucca, potatoes, chicken, oil, firewood, condiments, and tomatoes. This will be very help for her business to continue to function and to satisfy her clients’ demands.

With the previous loan, her inventory to make snacks was duly stocked allowing an increase in production. Her sales have improved. She could remodel her house and her finance is a bit more stable. Her family enjoys the better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase corn, yucca, potatoes, chicken, oil, firewood, condiments, and tomatoes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 56 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Josephine has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, opta por un nuevo préstamo comprara suplementos para el apetito, vitaminas para el cerebro, cremas para manchas, laxantes entre otros medicamento para surtir el negocio con mercadería que sus clientes solicitan, mejora sus ventas y tendrá un mayor aumento en sus ganancias.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior mejoro el inventario de su negocio en su momento, cuenta con clientes más satisfechos y continúa brindando a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is opting for a new loan. He will be supplements for appetite, vitamins for the brain, creams for dark spots on skin, laxatives, and other medications to stock his business with the merchandise that his customers request. He will improve his sales and he will have a greater increase in his earnings. 

With the help of the previous loan, Manuel improved the inventory of his business at that time. He has more satisfied customers and he continues providing his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to by supplements for appetite, vitamins for the brain, creams for dark spots on skin, laxatives, and more.

loans.name: Afzal Hashmi

texts.en:
Afzal Hashmi is a 55-year-old, married man, living with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a bakery near his hometown. He sells different kinds of cakes, rusks, milk, biscuits, and juices.
