A few days ago, someone stole cash and inventory from his shop’s locker and broke the glass of a glass case. Now, Afzal Hashmi wants to purchase the inventories in large quantity from a nearby bakery and sell it from his bakery. But, he does not have cash in hand to buy sweets. 

He has been receiving a Kiva loan and been purchasing general store’s items. Due to theft and to compensate against the loss, he wants to take another loan. Therefore, Afzal Hashmi has requested a Kiva loan again, so he can buy his desired sweets and a glass case. 

He wants to prepare these sweets at home, so that he could get maximum income. He will make some savings with the profit and he hopes that, in the future, he will prepare all sweets by himself. 

Afzal Hashmi thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bakery items, such as sweets, cakes, rusks, milk, biscuits, and a glass case.

loans.name: Kiymet

texts.en:
Kiymet is married and has two children, ages 10 and 7. For 16 years she sold knitwork, underwear and socks from home. Two years ago she began selling these same products from a small stand in the local market. With this loan, she will be able to expand her customer base with additional products. With her hardworking and productive personality, Kiymet wants to open a store to sell her products and provide a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Kıymet Hanım , evli ve biri 10 diğeri 7 yaşında 2 çocuk annesi. 16 yıl boyunca evde örgü,çamaşır ve çorap satmış. Son iki yıldır pazardaki küçük tezgahında bu satışlara devam ediyor. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile tezgahındaki ürün çeşitliliğini artırarak daha çok müşteri potansiyeline sahip oldu. Çalışkan ve üretken bir kişiliğe sahip olan Kıymet hanım gelecekte bir dükkan açarak ürünlerini burada satmak ve çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 35 years old and a married mother with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Jeannette has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Jeannette has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Jeannette would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es:
Apolinario, está solicitando más capital para efectuar la compra de semilla, herbicidas, plaguicidas y abono, prepara el terreno en el que sembrara granos básicos y así mantener su negocio funcionando.
Entre los buenos resultados que obtuvo del crédito anterior están, contar con los insumos agrícolas necesarios a tiempo para la siembra, cosecha libre de plagas y mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Apolinario is requesting more capital to make the purchase of seeds, herbicide, pesticide and fertilizer to prepare the land to plant basic grains and keep his business functioning. Amongst the positive results of his last loan were: having more agricultural supplies needed at planting time, a harvest free of infestation and more profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicides, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yomaira Daniela

texts.es: Yomaira es moradora de la provincia del Carchi que es un sector productivo y ganadero, Yomaira tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 4 años a la que le gusta estudiar mucho, esta señora se dedica a la ganaderia desde  hace 3 años y su esposo trabaja de chofer, comenta que en la ganaderia le va bien ya que ella cuida con mucha responsabilidad a sus animales, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para sumarla con el ganado que tiene actualmente en terrenos donde arrienda la hierba, a Yomaira le gustaría ir mejorando en esta actividad, tener más ganado y mejorar sus ingresos para comprar una casa para que su hija se sienta más a gusto y siga estudiando con el mismo entusiasmo.
texts.en:
Yomaira is an inhabitant in the province of Carchi which is a productive and cattle breeding sector. Yomaira is 23 years old, married and has a 4-year-old daughter who likes to study a lot. She has been working in cattle breeding for 3 years and her husband works as a driver. She says that the cattle breeding are going well as she takes care of her animals with much responsibility. 

She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of a cow to add to the cattle that she currently has on rented land. Yomaira would like to go on improving her activity, have more cattle and improve her income to purchase a house so that her daughter feels more comfortable and continues studying with the same enthusiasm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Luis Olmedo

texts.es: Luis pertenece a la provincia del Carchi que es netamente ganadera y productiva, por este motivo él se dedica a la crianza de terneros y a trabajar al jornal igualmente que su esposa, Luis tiene 69 años de edad,  vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 18, 17 y 13 años, la chica de 13 años es la única que asiste a la escuela  ya que los mayores no pudieron seguir estudiando debido a la falta de dinero y  actualmente se encuentran trabajar al jornal, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros  para tener un ingreso que cubra los gastos de su hogar, Luis y su familia se encuentran viviendo en una casa que les presta una amiga, y a este señor le gustaría en algún momento tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the Province of Carchi which is an area of mainly livestock raising. For this reason he raises young cows and works as day labor. His wife does the same. Luis is 69 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children, 13, 17 and 18 years old. The 13 year old is the only one who attends school. The two oldest couldn't got to school due to a lack of financial resources and at present they work as day labor.

Luis will use the loan to buy some calves to have revenue to pay the household expenses. Luis and his family are living in the house of a friend and he would like some day to live in a home of their own.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a married woman and the mother of a 15-year-old son. She lives with her family in the town of Loon, Bohol. Margarita is engaged in the fruit vending business, having sold different kinds of fruits for several years now. This is the source of her income.

As of this time, Margarita needs additional capital for the expansion of her fruit vending business. With this, she joined CEVI to gain access to loan services offered by the organization to micro entrepreneurs like her. She is asking for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy more fruits like mangoes, pineapples and other tropical fruits to sell. With this, Margarita will be able to improve the variety of her stock, which will attract more buyers.

In the future, Margarita hopes to make her fruit vending business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like mangoes, pineapples and other tropical fruits to sell

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is 28 years old and married, with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Laarni has been running the general store for ten years and she also earns an income from selling dried fish.

Laarni aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and both of her children are in school.

Maria Luz has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell.

Maria Luz has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans lives in the Nyamira area of South Nyanza, Kenya with his wife and three children, all of school going age. He enjoys farming and more especially cattle raising, and has done it for the past 10 years where his primary income source is milk, eggs and tea.

He said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are customer oriented and the interest rate on their loans is lower than other micro finance institutions. During the training, he learnt how to manage default within the group and co-guarantee mechanisms. This loan will help him acquire rabbits and thus sell them to generate more income. This will cater to his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase rabbits.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 43 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Rosalie has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more inventory to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto mayor de edad, casado con tres hijos todos mayores de edad,originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, Mario es un microempresario propietario y administrador de una comideria ubicado en su casa de habitación, donde ofrece deliciosos desayunos, almuerzo como: gallo pinto,huevos revueltos,enchiladas, tajadas, tacos,enfrijoladas, café con leche, refrescos naturales, juegos, gaseosas entre otros, también se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, cosméticos,zapatos, sus compras son al contado y sus ventas al contado en algunas ocasiones al crédito recuperando semanal lo invertido, cuenta con clientes fijos y eventuales, uno de sus sueños es poder acondicionar bien un local para su negocio de comida, El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en ambos negocios para ofrecer variedades de productos tanto en la comideria como la de mercadería en general. Mario esta muy agradecido con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Mario Alberto, an older man, is married with three children who are all adults. He is a native of the city of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. He is known for being a hardworking and responsible man with a strong desire for self-improvement. 

Mario is a small businessman; he owns and operates a small restaurant located in his house. He offers delicious breakfasts and lunches like rice and beans, scrambled eggs, enchiladas, fried plantains, tacos, corn tortillas in black bean sauce, coffe with milk, natural fruit drinks, juices, sodas, and more. He also works selling general merchandise like various styles of clothing, cosmetics, and shoes. He makes his purchases in cash and his sales are in cash and in some cases on credit, collecting weekly payments. He has regular and occasional customers.

One of Mario's dreams is to be able to nicely outfit a commercial space for his food business. The objective for this loan is to invest in working capital for both businesses so that he can offer a variety of products both in the restaurant and in his general merchandise business. Mario is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders offer to people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy a variety of styles of clothing, cosmetics, shoes, fruits and vegetables, grains, plantains, sweet plantains, oil, charcoal, plastic plates, bags, and more.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, ha sacado el mayor provecho del crédito anterior ya que compro insumos agrícolas que necesitaba para la siembra, su cosecha fue abundante, cubrió la demanda familiar y de sus clientes, sus ganancias le permiten cancelar sus deudas y dar una mejor vida a su familia.
Opta por un  nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas así mismo  pagara mano de obra, con el fin de preparar el terreno para sembrar a tiempo.
texts.en:
Pedro has made the most of this previous loan: he purchased the farming supplies he needed, the harvest was abundant and enough to cover his family's demand and that of his clients, and the earnings allowed him to repay debts and improve the quality of life of his family. 

He is now requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide and pesticide, and to pay for labor so that he can have the field ready for plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide and pesticide, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Shazia Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her four children. Shahida is 38 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of three children and lives in Rawalpindi. Sonia is 27 years old and she is a mother of two children. Her husband is doing work in different private farms for the last 3 to 5 years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shazia and Shahida also provide sewing services and earn income to contribute with their husbands to manage the household. 

Sonia runs her own beauty parlor. She wants to buy some good products for her beauty salon to increase her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 
 
This is a group loan for three different people. Shazia is the leader for this group. She needs different kinds of goods, e.g. needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc., for her business purposes. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

They are all very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothes, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru:
Мутабар несмотря на свои 54 года очень энергичная трудолюбивая женщина, которая не боится трудностей и преград. Она одна вырастила сына. Она имеет  среднее  образование. Как и большинство жителей сельской местности  основным источником дохода у нее является животноводство и переработка молока.  Разводя скот и продавая молоко и молочные продукты своего изготовления Мутабар  содержала семью и помогала своим престарелым родителям, выучила  сына и женила. Теперь у нее есть внуки, которые любят ее. Хотя сын уже самостоятельный и может содержать семью и помогает маме, Мутабар не хочет быть обузой для сына и продолжает вести свое хозяйство. Внуки растут и так как  она не смогла дать сыну высшее образование хочет пополнить этот пробел  и помочь своим внукам в дальнейшем получить необходимое образование и это является ее заветной мечтой. 
Мутабар хочет приобрести скот и  дополнительно корма и все необходимое для того чтобы  получать от своего бизнеса большую пользу но сейчас необходимых средств у нее недостаточно и узнав от знакомых о том, что можно взять кредит в банке она обратилась в "Арванд" за помощью. Полученный кредит  помог бы ей в решении проблемы. Она заранее благодарна в помощи.
texts.en:
Despite her 54 years, Mutabar is a very energetic, hardworking woman who is not afraid of difficulties or obstacles. She raised her son alone. She has a secondary education. Like the majority of countryside residents, her main source of income is livestock breeding and processing milk. By raising cattle and selling milk and milk products of her own making, Mutabar supported her family, helped her elderly parents, and educated and married off her son. Now she has grandchildren who love her. Although her son is self-sufficient and can support his family and help out his mother, Mutabar does not want to be a burden to her son and continues to run her farm. Her grandchildren are growing up and as she could not give her son a higher education, she wants to make up for this deficiency and help her grandchildren receive the necessary education in the future. This is her dearest wish.

Mutabar wants to purchase cattle, additional feed, and all of the necessities for receiving great value from her business. However, she currently does not have enough funds. When she learned from acquaintances that she could take out a loan from a bank, she turned to Arvand for help. The received loan would be able to help her solve her problems. She is thankful in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace más de 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para arreglo de corrales de los mismos.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a 42-year old man who lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, a community that works in agriculture, commerce and livestock and which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, north coast of Perú. 

Together with his wife, he has worked in stockbreeding for over 10 years. They have small animals, such as roosters, hens and chickens, and the business is located in the rear part of their house. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy balanced food for the animals and to repair the pens where they are kept.

loans.use: to buy balanced food to feed his animals.

loans.name: Ayren

texts.en:
Ayren is 32 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ayren is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ayren has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn is 22 years old and married with two children.

Gelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Gelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her crops.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 2 años y 5 años de edad. Gregorio trabaja como albañil desde hace más de 10 años y de esta forma se gana la vida y mantiene la economía del hogar. Gregorio y su familia habitan en condiciones muy humildes y desea mejorar la fachada de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para reparar el techo y las paredes de la vivienda dado que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado. Con el crédito solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en:
Gregorio is a 52-year old man who lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children, aged 2 and 5. Gregorio has worked as a builder for over 10 years, a job that has allowed him to get ahead and support household expenses. 

Gregorio and his family live under very modest conditions and he would like to make improvements to the facade of the house. This is why he is requesting this loan to FUSAI: to repair the ceiling and walls, which are currently in bad condition. He will use the loan to buy galvanized layers and wood.

loans.use: to buy galvanized layers and wood to repair the ceiling and walls of his house.

loans.name: Branyo De La Cruz

texts.es:
Branyo tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público, trasladando a sus pasajeros a las caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo llantas, espejos y una carpa para su vehículo y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Branyo is a 21-year old man who lives with his wife and children in the district of Buenos Aires, a community that works in agriculture, commerce and livestock, and which is located in the province of Morropon, Piura region, north cost of Perú. 

He provides public transportation services and takes passengers to villages close to his district. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy replacement parts for his vehicle, tires, mirrors and a tent, with an aim to offer a better service.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his vehicle, tires and a tent.

loans.name: Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Laurent is the father of three sons and one daughter who are in school. He is a married man and known for being an entrepreneur of different enterprises. He is a house building constructor, but his work itself cannot make him meet his dream. Despite being a constructor, Laurent has three businesses which enable him to generate a better extra income per month. He manages a shop selling clothes, another shop selling phone accessories and a food business selling chips with fried chicken and other meat fried in pieces (mishkaki). Since he is married, his wife is the supervisor of all the businesses and also runs the clothes shop. Every night after he gets back from his job he normally cross checks all the sales of the day. His business starts from 7:30 am to 9:00 pm every working day, but his chips business goes up to midnight. His brother is a constructor also and is the one who inspired him.

This is his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to renovate his chips place with tiles on the ground floor and buy a stock of soft drinks. He dreams that one day he will be able to improve his life and businesses as well. Since he is self employed and his work needs more energy, he decided to crop these businesses so that in his old age he will have more savings and something to stand for.

Laurent will share this loan with his loan group "Mt Udzungwa" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to renovate his chips place with tiles on the ground floor and buy a stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Ihtior

texts.ru:
Ихтиёр молодой энергичный, жизнерадостный парень. Ему 25 лет . Образование у него среднее. Он женат но детей у него пока нет. Ихтиёр хочет создать условия для того чтобы  дети родились и выросли в хороших условиях. Он очень трудолюбив. С детства помогал родителям ухаживать за домашним хозяйством. Знает как выращивать растения, научился хорошо ухаживать за скотом. Но к сожалению возможности получить высшее образование у него не появилось. Но Ихтиёр не переживает по этому поводу и так, как он очень трудолюбив работает как может для того чтобы в будущем дать образование детям. У него молодая жена . Она тоже помогает Ихтиёру в хозяйстве. Эта молодая семья очень оптимистично относится к жизни  и уверены, что  смогут создать для себя и своей зарождающейся семье необходимые условия.  
 У Ихтиёра есть несколько голов  скота. Его жена помогает тем, что доит и перерабатывает молоко. Так как зимние заготовки кормов закончились  Ихтиёр хочет приобрести корма для скота но необходимой суммы у него нет и по совету знакомых он обратился в «Арванд» за кредитом. Он заранее благодарен  оказанной помощи их  молодой семье.
texts.en:
Ihtior is a young, energetic, cheerful guy. He is 25 years old. He has a secondary education. He is married but does not yet have any children. Ihtior wants provide conditions so that his future children will be born into and grow up in good living conditions. He is very hardworking. From childhood, he has helped his parents look after their household. He knows how to grow crops and learned how to look after cattle well. Unfortunately, he did not have the opportunity to get a higher education. But Ihtior did not get upset about it, as he works as hard as he can to give his children an education in the future. He has a young wife. She also helps Ihtior with his farm. This young family is very optimistic about life and is sure that they will be able to acquire all of the necessary conditions for themselves and their growing family.

Ihtior has several heads of cattle. His wife helps by milking the cows and processing their milk. As the winter feed storage has ended, Ihtior wants to buy cattle feed but he does not have the money to do so. On the advice of acquaintances, he requested a loan from "Arvand." He is thankful in advance for the provided assistance to his young family.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the house and create an additional room.

loans.name: Gray Emilia

texts.es: Gray Emilia, mayor de edad casada con tres hijos menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, comercio, turismo, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal, inicia sus negocio desde muy temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, Gray es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de una tienda de mercadería en general ubicado en su casa de habitación donde ofrece variedades estilos de ropa de vestir para Jóvenes, Niños y adultos, pantalones, faldas, blusas, short, camisas, ropa de cama,zapatos, útiles escolares juguetes,gaseosas, también productos de cosméticos como: maquillajes, cremas, shampoo, entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en otro municipio del país donde viaja semanalmente, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos terminar una carrera y siendo unos profesionales, también el de crecer mas en su negocio y de esa manera ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa nueva, cosméticos para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gray Emilia is an adult woman who is married and has three young children. She is originally from one of the towns in Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. This area is known for its beautiful beaches, commerce, and tourism.

Gray Emilia is known as a hardworking and responsible woman who has the drive to succeed on a personal level. She started her business at a very early age so that she could help with the household expenses. Gray Emilia is the owner and manager of a small general merchandise store located in her home. She offers different styles of clothing for young people, children, and adults. These items include trousers, skirts, blouses, shorts, and shirts, as well as bedding, shoes, school supplies, toys, and sodas. She also offers cosmetic products such as make-up, crèmes, shampoo, and other items. Gray Emilia purchases her goods with cash in another town, so she must travel there on a weekly basis. She has both established and occasional customers. Her sales are conducted on a cash basis.

One of her dreams is to see her children finish their degrees and become professionals. She also wants to grow her business even more so that she can provide a better future for her children. The purpose of this loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her business of buying and selling new clothes and cosmetics. In the near future, she wants to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy new clothing, cosmetics, shoes, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Linda Solanch

texts.es: Linda es una joven soltera que vive con sus padres, estudia administración de empresas, en sus ratos libres hace deporte como vóley y natación, su mayor sueño es terminar pronto la carrera para poder administrar su propia empresa ya que su mayor obstáculo era la falta de dinero y gracias a EDAPROSPO y a KIVA ha podido solucionar su mayor dificultad, que era poder pagar las mensualidades de la universidad ahora se siente agradecida al saber que hay entidades que apoyan al estudiante.  Agradezco a Dios y que bendiga a los inversionistas KIVA por su generosidad “Muchas Gracias.”
texts.en: Linda is a young single woman who lives with her parents and pursues business management studies. In her free time, she likes to practice sports, such as volleyball and swimming. Her biggest dream is to finish her degree and to manage her own business. Thanks to Edaprospo and Kiva, she has been able to solve her biggest obstacle and pay her monthly tuition payments. She is grateful to organizations that support students and thanks God for Kiva lenders' generosity. "Thank you very much".

loans.use: to cover tuition monthly payments and the cost of study materials.

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
Pearly discovered her altruistic passion of caring for others at the early age of 12.  Volunteering often for St. Vincent DePaul home in Trinidad and Tobago, she gained the tools and compassion necessary to become successful in the elderly care industry. 

Pearly moved to the United States 27 years ago and founded the now thriving New Outlook Homecare in 2001. Her enterprise provides professional and personal service specializing in eldercare and prides itself on the idea that “When we take care of the elderly, we are in fact taking care of ourselves.”

Pearly currently employs 17 individuals that partner directly with the families of the elderly to insure quality care. However, due to the fact that most families pay at the end of the month and New Outlook’s has a small cash flow, Pearly has trouble taking on new clients. With a reasonable cash reserve, Pearly could easily see her business exponentially expand within a matter of months. 

Pearly needs your help to build a larger cash flow in order to take on new customers. She has a strong business with years of experience and a plethora of families in need. 

Help Pearly continue to mitigate the stresses of age and facilitate her customers to enjoy their golden years by enabling her business to expand.

loans.use: to increase her cash reserve to take on new clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, nails, and a locker door.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 31-year-old woman from Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. She is married with four children. Tsitsi is seen as an extraordinary woman in her village, with a heart for the needy and less privileged. She volunteers at the local community center, actively helping to keep children in school through guidance, counseling, and life skills development. She does this for families who have lost their parents and are headed by children. She feels that everyone deserves a chance in life. In 2012, Tsitsi started a poultry business when she started facing financial difficulties.  

A loan from Kiva will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. It will also assist her in building a much bigger fowl run. Improving her business will help her to increase profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chick feed and broiler chicks.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Dorah from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 1 child.  For five years, Dorah established her clothing material business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business.

Dorah requires a loan in order to purchase more clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Dorah plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
Meet Gbassay,   She is in her early forties and is from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has four children.  For 20 years, Gbassay established her cookery business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to educate her children. She works at the business seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to expand her business.

Gbassay requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Gbassay plans to expand her business to the higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Gilbert's Group

texts.en:
Gilbert is a member of this group in Matete District. He is pictured here in a group of 8 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 68 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Gilbert has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Gilbert is married and has 4 children. He is 42 years old and is known as hardworking. He is active in his community in groups such as the prayer group. Gilbert has been a farmer for 35 years. Gilbert described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  	
						
Gilbert first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Gilbert joined One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed his family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member. Gilbert plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Gilbert’s own life was improved because he was able to feed his family.  	
						
Gilbert and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Josphat's Group

texts.en:
Josephat is among five group leaders of farmers in Kakamega North District, with Josphat selected as the Kiva representative.  Josphat has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  He joined One Acre Fund because he wanted better harvests. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the other 63 individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Josphat is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with five children.  He is 38 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 16 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Josphat is very active in his community and is involved in the savings group. He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer, he will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!

The 2014 Long Rains season will be Josphat’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to get new farming methods.  As an active member in his community, Josphat also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader.  Josphat plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Josphat and the Group members will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 20-year-old business woman living in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide working with students at local schools to help improve their learning skills using cooperative learning study groups. Additionally, she offers psycho-social support to young people in her community. As an entrepreneur, Cynthia rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Cynthia will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase the amount of items she can sell. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will enable her to secure her further education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her stock.

loans.name: Simbisai

texts.en:
In 2012, Simbisai’s husband passed away, leaving her to take care of their three children. Realizing she needed a stable source of income, she started a poultry business in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe where they live. In addition to running the business and caring for her children, Simbisai is also a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school through life skills development because she believes that people have a chance in life when they make informed choices. 

The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her to increase profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: El grupo “CAMINO AL ÉXITO” está conformada por 07 mujeres trabajadoras y empeñosas en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Magnolia tiene 42 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos educando. Ella se dedica a la costura hace 04 años en cual lo viene realizando en su casa. Años atrás brindaba servicios de mantenimiento en centros de salud. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de telas hilos. Ella los fines de semana prepara polladas para obtener un ingreso económico adicional. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Magnolia es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste polo negro manga tres cuartos.
texts.en:
The group "Camino al éxito" has seven female members who work hard to improve the quality of life of their children. Magnolia is a single 42-year old mother of two minor children. She has made a living sewing at home for four years, after having provided maintenance services in health centers in the past. She also cooks chicken dishes on weekends to obtain extra income. 

She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread. The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan. 

Magnolia is the third woman to the left in the picture. She wears a 3/4-sleeve black t-shirt .

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, es soltero, vive con su madre de 46 años y su abuela de 80 años, para tener los recursos económicos para cubrir sus gastos personales y colaborar en los gastos familiares, adquirió un puesto en el mercado municipal de su ciudad, ofrece a los clientes CDS y calzado femenino diversificado, trabaja todos los días.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar variedad  de calzado y CDS de música y películas, dará a sus clientes mejores opciones de compra, espera mantener la satisfacción de los clientes y cancelar puntualmente las cuotas.
Su sueño es contar con una situación económica favorable para comprar su casa e independizarse y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Roberto is single, and lives with his 46-year-old mother and his 80-year-old grandmother. In order to be have the financial means to pay his personal expenses and help with the household expenses, he acquired a stall in the municipal market in his city.  He sells CDs and a range of women's shoes to his customers, and works every day.  He will use the loan to buy a variety of shoes, as well as music and film CDs, in order to offer his customers more options to purchase.  He hopes to keep his customers satisfied and to make his payments punctually.  His dream is to have the financial means to buy a house and become independent, and to continue helping his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes, as well as music and film CDs.

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
Aura, a sus 50 años de edad, es una madre soltera de dos hijos, a quienes ha sacado adelante con empeño y dedicación.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues tiene un restaurante ubicado en una vía principal del barrio donde reside, por lo que existe mucha afluencia de personas en el sector, trabaja de lunes a domingo y durante el fin de semana recibe el apoyo de una empleada, de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio y atraer a nuevos clientes con sus preparaciones, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar materia prima al por mayor (carne, pastas, granos, gaseosas, verduras) y reparar la nevera que tiene en mal estado, esto le permitirá prestar un mejor servicio a sus comensales, logrando aumentar las ventas y hacerle frente a la competencia desleal que existe en la zona. 
Aura tiene como propósito adquirir un local propio en el que pueda tener su negocio y ahorrar dinero para adquirir su propia casa, en la que pueda mejorar las condiciones de vida y disfrutar un mejor bienestar junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aura is a 50-year old single mother who has two children, whom she has supported with hard work and dedication. She has worked as an independent saleswoman for 5 years and owns a restaurant on the main road of her neighborhood. She has a lot of customers, works Monday through Sunday and counts on the help of an employee during the weekends. Thanks to her job she can generate enough resources to cover her basic household expenses. 

With an aim to consolidate her business and attract new customers, she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials in bulk (meat, pasta, grains, sodas, vegetables) and to repair the fridge, which is in bad condition. This would allow her to provide a better service, to increase sales and to face disloyal competition in the area. Aura's objective is to buy her own space for the business and to save money to buy a house. She wants to improve their quality of life and to enjoy a higher level of comfort with her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in bulk (meat, pasta, grains, sodas, vegetables) and to repair the fridge, which is in bad condition.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a member of this group in Lugari District. She is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 48 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Rose has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Rose is married and has 6 children. She is 64 years old and is known as friendly and hardworking. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and savings group, and prayer group. Rose has been a farmer for 33 years. Rose described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  				

Rose first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Rose joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds to earn enough to feed family and send children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Rose plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school and save for the future. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Rose's own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, was able to save money, and feed the family.  			

Rose and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! Sarah is 32 years old and married with 2 children aged 8 years and 4 years.  Both are attending school.  She has a hair salon in the Chipinge branch in the south eastern part of Zimbabwe.  She has been running this business for 18 months and most of her clients are from the local community. 

She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate stock.  Sarah requested this loan of $300 through MicroKing to purchase more stock and to have a wider variety of weaves which will attract more clients.  She says the extra income from this loan will help her to adequately stock her salon.  In the future, she would like to open a bigger hair salon and employ more people.

loans.use: to pay for braids, weaves and hair chemicals

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is a member of this group in Lugari District. She is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 62 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Catherine  has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Catherine  is married and has two children. She is 46 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking and reliable. She is active in his community in groups such as the women's group, prayer group and burial committee. Catherine  has been a farmer for 24 years. Catherine  described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Catherine first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Catherine joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best prices for fertilizer and hybrid seeds to earn enough to feed family and send children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Catherine plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Catherine’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support and was able to feed the family.  							

Catherine and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! Solomon is 40 years old and is married. He has four children ages 16, 12, 8 and 4; three of them are attending school. 

He is into brick moulding and durawall panel production in Chipinge Branch in the southeastern part of Zimbabwe. He has been running this business for 11 years, and serves the local town market. He has no other source of income. He says that the main challenge is a small capital base.

Solomon requested this loan of $750 over a period of 6 months to purchase more raw materials. 

He says the extra income from this loan ensure he will not run out of raw materials.

In the future,he would like to be the biggest supplier of brick blocks and durawall panels.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials for brick moulding and durawall panel production

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is a member of this group in the Lugari District. She is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 54 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Grace has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Grace is married and has three children. She is 32 years old and is known as hardworking. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group. She has been a farmer for 9 years. Grace described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Grace first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Grace joined One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member. Grace plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Grace’s own life was improved because she was able to feed the family.  							

Grace and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Meryem

texts.en:
Meryem is married and has three adult children. Four years ago she learned that Maya gave loans to women who worked or wanted to work from home. She applied and was approved. She took out three loans. She sold knitwork, felt bags and knickknacks she made from home and a stand. She has contributed to the economy of her home and her country for three years.

Meryem is applying for a 1,000 TRY loan, with which she will buy felt, beads and thread to make products to sell. She wants both to make money and make good use of her time. Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Meryem , evli üç çocuk annesi . Çocuklarını yetiştirmiş. 4 yıl önce Maya’ nın evinde is yapan ya da yapmak isteyen kadınlara kredi verdiğini öğrenmiş. Talepte bulunmuş,kredisi onaylanmış. 3 kez kredi kullanmış. Örgü örmüs,keçeden çanta ve süs eşyası yaparak, evden ve tezgahta satış yapmış. Üc yıldır aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlamış. Aldığı kredi ile keçe, boncuk ,ip alarak, üretim yaparak evde ve tezgahta satış yapmak istiyor . Hem para kazanmak hem de zamanını değerlendiriyor.

loans.use: to buy felt, beads and thread

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of five group leader farmers in Lugari District, with Mary selected as the Kiva representative. Mary has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right of the photo in a dark brown flowered dress. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 53 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Mary is a reliable member of the community. She is married with four children. Mary is 57 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 35 years to support her family. In addition to this, Mary is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. She described her harvest last year as poor. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.			

Mary joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Mary joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods to earn more and send children to school. Because she likes being a leader, and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers, Mary has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Mary's life because she has more profits from her harvest and was able to feed the family.  In the future, Mary hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school, repair the home, save for the future, and buy a cow.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Mary and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.			

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Nomsa

texts.en:
Nomsa is a 22-year-old single young woman from the Guruve district of Zimbabwe. She is a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school through life skills development. She believes that children have a chance in life when they are able to make informed decisions. Nomsa is currently operating a poultry business which she established in 2013 and has been successfully operating for eight months. When she finished school, Nomsa realized she needed a stable source of income. She decided poultry would be a lucrative business to establish at that time.

The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will bring increased profits which she will use to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more chick feed and broiler chicks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to enlarge her breakfast restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: 13.03.02 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Ngọc is 34 years old and married with 2 dependent children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Ngọc operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells rice and processed food. Ngọc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and food to cook and resell .

Ngọc is the group leader of the 13.03.02 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her profits, Ngọc hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase rice and food to cook and resell

loans.name: 3.5.1007.15.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mạnh has a retail business selling metals. She is requesting a loan to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell.

Mạnh is 58 years old and she is married with no children. She is the group leader of the Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of four members. Mạnh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2009, Mạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mạnh has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Mạnh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter does carpentry in Oloitoktok town and has been running this business for the last 14 years. He is 64 years old, married and together with his spouse has been blessed with 8 children. 

He will be using this loan to pay school fees for his child who is in high-school. He will use the anticipated profits form his business to save more.

This is Peter's fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has paid his previous loans successfully. In future he hopes to expand his business and purchase more materials.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old from Guindulman, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. They have three children aged 1 to 10.  For four years now, she has been cooking snack food to provide for her family. She sells peanuts and banana cue (deep-fried banana in caramelized sugar) to make an income. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, condensed milk, yeast, banana, cooking oil, margarine, eggs, peanut and lumpia wrapper.  With all these available, she can be more productive and earn a better income. 

 In the future, she hopes to find another business opportunity that will help her grow her income, so she can better help her husband in raising their children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, condensed milk, yeast, banana, cooking oil, margarine, eggs, peanut and lumpia wrapper.

loans.name: 02.04.07 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Lợi is applying for a loan to purchase net for fishing. She operates a business selling nets. Lợi is 46 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 02.04.07 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. Lợi lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lợi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lợi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase net for fishing

loans.name: 05-08-01 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Nhung is 55 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 05.08.01 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

Nhung has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is lack of capital.

In 2009, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food and other stock for resale.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes to repair her house and support for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and other stock for resale.

loans.name: 02170102001Cẩm Vinh - Hoằng Tân Group

texts.en:
Thành operates a farming business. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main hardship that Thành faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Thành is 63 years old. She is married and has one child. She lives in Hoang Hoa District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province.

Thành is the group leader of the 02170102001Cẩm Vinh - Hoằng Tân solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. This is Thành’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to grow rice.

In the future, Thành hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, salt, oil, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Sandra Nohemy

texts.es:
Sandra, es acompañada, tiene un hijo de 18 meses de edad, su negocio consiste en la venta de bisutería y materiales para la misma, lo tiene desde hace tres años, nace a raíz de la necesidad de mejorar las circunstancias familiares, lo aprendió mediante cursos impartidos en su municipio, lo atiende de 8:00 a.m. a 5: 00 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra de hilo, piedras, alambre, pinzas, tijeras, dijes, broches, etc., para ofrecer mejores opciones de compra que abastezcan  las necesidades de sus clientes, espera tener mejores ventas, cancelar su deuda y buenas ganancias.
Su visión es tener un negocio con bases sólidas que le permitan ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un vehículo para transportarse.
texts.en: Sandra lives in a common-law relationship and has an 18-month-old child.  Her business, which she has had for three years,  is selling jewelry and jewelry materials.  She began the business because of a need to improve her family's circumstances, and learned how to do it through courses given by her municipality.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She will use the loan to buy thread, stones, wire, tweezers, scissors, lockets, and brooches, etc., in order to offer more choices that will meet the needs of her customers.  She hopes to have better sales, to pay her debt and to earn a good income.  Her vision is to have a business with a solid foundation that will allow her to save enough to buy a vehicle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy thread, stones, wire, tweezers, scissors, lockets, and brooches, etc.

loans.name: Martun

texts.en:
Martun is twenty-seven years old and lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. He has a vocational education and currently works at the gas station. Martun is married with one daughter and one son. He lives with his parents. Martun’s father also is employed and he works as a driver at a private company. Both Martun and his father work very hard in order to support their family.  Martun’s wife does not work and she takes care of their children.

Martun asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian Drams, as his wife needs to go through a course of treatment for some health problems she has had recently. The doctor has already prescribed drugs for her treatment but the drugs are rather expensive, even though she needs to take them.

loans.use: pay for his wife's health treatment and medical drugs

loans.name: Peace-Shallon Group

texts.en:
These three are members of the Peace-Shallon group. They are traders from Teshie who on average are forty years old. They work with ID-Ghana micro finance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time. They are on their second loan with the institution and fully intend to reimburse it.

Joyce (standing on the left of the photograph) will use her loan to buy Gari, beans and palm oil. She sells daily by moving from door to door, and is quite in demand. She gets her supplies at the market in Accra and sells for cash to clients. 

She hopes to achieve a good average monthly profit which will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses. The group will need GHS 1900 to be able to serve customers better.

loans.use: buy Gari, beans and palm oil.

loans.name: Kumboedza Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Silas, the leader of Kumboedza Group. He is 69 years old and married with two children, ages 28 and 23. Neither is attending school. 

He has a general dealership shop in Chipinge Branch in Zimbabwe. He has been running this business for 15 years, and sells his products to the local community. He has no other source of income. He says that the main challenge to his business is the lack of capital.

Silas requested this loan of $400 through MicroKing to boost his stock.

He says the extra income from this loan will help him have adequate stock, which will increase his sales. In future, he would like to purchase a truck for easy supply of his stock.

loans.use: to pay for stock

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married with three children. She used to teach handwork before retiring. Since retiring, she has occupied herself with point lace, hand knitting and machine knitting with natural stones and sold her products from her house and a stand. She learned about Maya and its loans to women four years ago and took out a loan to buy a sewing machine. She has had three loans from Maya and opened a store a year ago. She sells to local and foreign tourists. When she heard Maya was lending again, she applied. With the loan, she will buy natural stones and jewelry materials to make products and raise her sales. She sells from her shop and a stand, and also makes to order. She gets requests for items from places like Belgium and the US. She wants to raise her children and give them a good future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff (original text below).
Emine ,evli üç çocuk annesi.  Elişi öğretmenliği yapmış.  Emekli olmuş.  Emekli olduktan sonra doğal taşlardan takı iğne oyası ,el örgüsü, makine örgüsü yaparak evden ve tezgahtan satış yapmış.  4 yıl önce  kadınlara kredi veren maya ile tanışmış ve kredi çekmiş .  Aldığı kredi ile 2. Örgü makinesini almış.  Mayadan 3 kez kredi kullanmış.  Bir yıl önce dükkan açmış.  Yerli ve yabancı turistlere hizmet veriyor.  Maya tekrar kredi vermeye başladığını öğrenmis, müracat etmiş.  Aldığı kredi ile doğal taş ve takı malzemeleri alarak, üretim yapıp, satışlarını artırmayı düşünüyor.  Satışlarını dükkandan ve tezgahtan yapıyor.  Özel sipariş alrsa onları da yapabiliyor.  Belçika ,Amerika!dan ürünleri talep görüyor.  Çocuklarını yetiştirip iyi bir gelecek vermek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy natural stones and jewelry materials

loans.name: Shyqerije

texts.en:
Shyqirije is 59 years old, has 3 young children and lives in the southern part of Kosovo, in a minority community. She is very polite and loves her children very much. Her husband is the main source of income as he is a musician performing for various celebrations and events, including weddings. 

Shyqrije wants to improve the living conditions for her family, primarily the conditions of her very old house. The doors, windows and floor are in desperate need of repair and replacement for many years now, but she has never been able to address it due to the lack of income to pay for their daily needs and save money. 

This loan will improve the family living conditions and she knows that without any help from the lenders, she will not be able to see this happen. She is very grateful for the opportunity given by the lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Oscar Rene

texts.es: Son ya 8 años de lo que René se dedica a la ganadería, él tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales la hija mayor va al colegio y 3 asisten a la escuela, René también se dedica a trabajar al jornal  y su esposa le apoya en todo lo que él  realice, el crédito lo va invertir en la compra de dos vaconas para tenerlas en los terrenos de su suegro ya que él no le cobra por la hierba, lo que René aspira es que mediante su negocio podrá contar con el dinero suficiente para darle alimento y educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
René has already been in the livestock business for eight years. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children. His oldest daughter is in high school and the other three are in elementary school. René also works as a day laborer and his wife helps him with everything he does.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of two cows that he will keep on his father-in-law’s land since he won’t be charged for allowing them to graze there. What René hopes to accomplish with his business is to have sufficient income by which he is able to feed and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Edmore, the leader of the Shalom Group from Chipinge. He is 27 years old, and married with two children, ages 7 and 5. One  is attending school.

He operates a butchery and takeaway business in Chipinge Branch in Zimbabwe. He has been running this business for six years, and serves the local market. He has no other source of income. He says that the main challenge to his business is inadequate stock.

Edmore requested this loan of $400 through MicroKing to purchase more beasts for slaughter. 

He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to boost his stock and increase his sales.

In the future, he would like to build his own butchery and purchase a truck for business use.

loans.use: to pay for beasts for slaughter

loans.name: Nagjire

texts.en:
Nagjiri is a married mother of three children between the ages of nine and sixteen. She operates a sewing business and is a hardworking woman. She has gained a lot of customers over the years due to her work ethic and output quality. She has a very quiet character, she is pleasant to be around and always smiles. She likes her job very much. It makes her very happy to be able to earn an income for her family and be able to help provide for them. 

Her husband earns a living applying façades to houses and various other buildings in the community. Now for the first time in her career, she is asking for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. This loan will help her to be able to continue her business and produce better quality work at a faster rate. She hopes to be able to continue her business for many years to come, growing and expanding even more in the future. Her goal is to give her children a better education. She is very grateful for your help.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 48-year-old married woman living with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a butcher shop; he earns sufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy beef from the market and sell it in his butcher shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which reduced his purchasing power for the new inventory for his butcher shop. 

So Sakina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy a bull calf to get beef. Sakina wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams of providing all facilities of life to her children. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf so as to get beef to resell.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz was born in 1960. She is a widow and has a son. Her husband was killed in the Karabakh war. Solmaz is from the occupied territory of Shusha city. Since the occupation, she has been living with her lovely son in the Baku region. Her son recently graduated from the university, and in the near future, wants to get married.

Ten years ago, Solmaz decided to start a personal business to give her son a good education. So she opened a fruit and vegetable store. All of her customers have been satisfied with her services. Now she needs a loan of 2,100 AZN to buy more produce to sell. 

Solmaz says great thanks to the Kiva organization and all lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is a 21 year old single young man from a small village near Nablus city.  He lives with his family in a small house in the village.  Taleb opened a small clothes store for men one  year ago.  It is a very good business and earns a good income.  Taleb would like to improve his business and expand it. 

Taleb took a loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy more products for his store to sell.  By taking this loan, Taleb will be able to increase his sales and also his income.  Taleb appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more products for his store to sell.

loans.name: Mubarak

texts.en:
Mubarak is a 43-year-old married woman. She has two sons. The members of the family are refugees and live in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement. Her husband works as a laborer, but the main source of the family’s income is gardening. Mubarak has been raising fruits (apples, cherries, etc.) and selling them at the local bazaar for 18 years. She has good skills in this area, and her monthly income is 180 AZN.

Gardening is one of the most famous occupations in Azerbaijan. People have been growing and selling fruits and flowers since ancient times. Mubarak loves her job very much. She raises trees carefully and sometimes cooks and sells different kinds of jam and fruit pies. People like to buy Mubarak’s jam and pies because they are very tasty.

Unfortunately, Mubarak’s income isn’t enough to cover life’s demands. She applied for 1,500 AZN in order to supply new  fruits for her grocery and increase her income. She hopes that this will help her to cover the cost of living.

loans.use: to supply new fruits for her grocery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow vegetables and raise chickens.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27 years old married man from Deir el Balah city.  He is the father of two daughters.  He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.  Mohammad would like to improve the family's living conditions and works extra hours in another job.
