Mohammad took a loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw so he can start transporting goods for the local traders.  It is a good business and can provide extra income for his family.  Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw so he can start transporting goods for the local traders.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 30 years old married man from Deir el Balah city. He is the father of two daughters.  He works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income.  Ayman would like to improve the family's living conditions and works extra hours in another job.

Ayman took a Murabaha loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw so he can start transporting goods for the local traders.  It is a good business and can provide extra income for his family.  Ayman appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw so he can start transporting goods for the local traders

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 23 year old single young man from a small village called Attel, near Tulkarm city.  He lives with his family in a small house in the village. Ammar opened a small workshop for car repairs two years ago.  It is a very good business and the only one in his area.  Ammar would like to improve his business and expand it. 

Ammar took a loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy more spare parts and engine oil for his workshop by taking this loan,  Ammar will be able to increase his productivity and serve more clients.  Ammar appears in the photo in his workshop

loans.use: to buy more spare parts and engine oil for his workshop

loans.name: Isabelo

texts.en:
Isabelo is a farmer from Guindulman, Bohol.  He has been in the farming business for more than two years now.  This is the source of his income.
Isabelo is asking for a loan amounting to 4000Php to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for the farm.  With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his harvest and yield.  In the future, Isabelo has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 30-year-old very hardworking gentleman, married and a father of three. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last three years with a monthly income of about KES 30,000. 

He learned about VisionFund from some of his colleagues who are funded by the organisation. Simon has acquired his first loan of KES 87,880 which will facilitate him in purchasing his own motorbike. He is likely to earn more due to the increased flexibility and already-established customer base.

He plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as boost his savings account. He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goal and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a 51 year old man from the town of Guindulman, Bohol.  He is married with 3 children ages 19,16 and 10 years old.  He grows and sells coconuts.  Aside from coconut farming, he also engages in the hog raising business.  Both of his businesses were started quite a number of years ago. He is asking for a loan worth 4000Php to buy fertilizer and seeds to improve his harvest as well as to gain more income.

 In the future, Francisco hopes to expand his business and increase the business profitability in order to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 38 years old, married and a resident of Poblacion Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a security guard. They have no children. Starting with 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2013 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 50,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she and her husband live comfortably with a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Velyn

texts.en:
Velyn is 29 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to to have additional capital for her business that is to buy farm inputs. 

Velyn has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, she hopes to improve her life style.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sabahate

texts.en: Sabahate is forty-three years old and lives only with her young son. Her husband was killed during the war and now she receives social help as compensation for her husband’s death. Her son is performing as a musician for weddings and other events and celebrations in order to earn a living to help provide for them. He is very happy with the income that he earns from his business but it is not enough to pay for the renovations needed in their old and small house. Specifically, she is needing to renovate the bathroom as it is in a condition that is neither healthy nor sanitary. The loan is very necessary to improve their living conditions and she is very happy for this opportunity. She would like to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To renovate the bathroom as it is in a condition that is neither healthy nor sanitary

loans.name: Venansio

texts.en: Venansio is married with three children who are all in school. He deals in small-scale coffee and banana farming where he earns income to take care of his family. He has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 UGX to buy manure and fertilizers to add in his plantations. He wants to use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children. From this, Venansio hopes to improve his production of both coffee and bananas and serve his customers well. His customers are neighbors and other people who own restaurants in the trading centre. Venansio is a very hardworking man. He also hopes to build a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Ghoror* Group

texts.en:
Ghoror is a group consisting of four female members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a loan from AMB for 220,000 YER.

Horyah is a 53 years old, married, and has six children. Her oldest child is 37 years old and the youngest one is 18 years old. She lives with them in their won house. Horyah is the leader of the group. Due to a high illiteracy rates among women in Yemen, Horyah is an uneducated woman. She works as a housewife and she is very active woman. Her husband is an employee and her oldest son is also an employee but their salaries are not enough to cover all the needs of their house. She wants to improve the living standards of the family, but she doesn't have enough money; therefore, Horyah applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchasing home appliances for the house.

Horyah looks forward to opening a saving account in the bank for her children. She wishes that her family lives in a better condition.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for the house

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a new customer aged 35 years. He is married and has 2 children, and resides in a rural area of Omungyenyi, Ntungamo. He deals with tree plantations. He applied for a loan of ugx.5000,000 to top up on a piece of land in his neighborhood, which he will use to expand and plant more trees and also do farming. The problem is that his land is small yet trees need large piece of land. He is confident that if he acquires the land, he will plant many trees which will yield high income for him in the near future since trees are on high demand by people for timber and electricity poles.
He is hard working and forward looking.

loans.use: To acquire a piece of land for farming purposes and tree planting

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 43-year-old farmer from Kanaara cell (neighborhood) in Nyabihoko Kamwenge district. He is married, with four children who are all in school.

George deals in small-scale agriculture, which he supports with an alcohol brewing business where he earns income to feed his family and pay school fees for his children. He has applied for a loan of UGX.1,000,000 to help him buy raw materials to increase production, and he will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children.

George is a very hardworking man. He also hopes to construct a permanent home for his children in the near future if his profits increase.

loans.use: to buy bananas for his brewing business.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Huberto tiene 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, su esposa le apoya en esta labor cocinando para asistir a los jornaleros con el refrigerio, son una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Humberto is 59 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Colasay. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Humberto is a farmer who specializes in growing coffee. His wife helps with the work by cooking and preparing snacks for the day laborers. He and his wife are a united family. Humberto is requesting a loan of 3,500 PEN so that he can buy compost and pay for labor in order to maintain his coffee crop. This will result in a timely production so that he can offer his goods to his customers.

loans.use: to buy compost and pay for labor in order to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Bashir Ahmed

texts.en:
Bashir Ahmed is a fifty-year-old married man. He lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan with his wife and five children. 

He has been in the business of selling milk since childhood. He learned all the techniques for producing milk from his father. This is the only source of income for the family, so he has to devote his full time and energy for his dairy farm. He delivers milk to the market and door-to-door as well. To do this, he loads milk cans onto his bicycle and delivers early in the morning. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. His monthly savings have become too low due to a rapid increase in household expenses: these expenses included utility bills, school fees, school uniforms and expensive books. He wants to have a higher income so that he can cope with the household expenses but he finds it difficult due to financial constraints.

Bashir Ahmed planned to purchase one more buffalo to increase his sales, so that he can generate more income and savings as well. Bashir Ahmed has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy an additional buffalo with a contribution of savings. With the extra income, he hopes to build up a new cowshed and buy a motorbike to deliver milk. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo for producing milk to sell.

loans.name: Debibala

texts.en:
Debibala is 52 year old and married. Her poverty, ignorance & lack of knowledge have not permitted her to receive an education. But she can sign her name. Now Debibala is a mother of three children and all of her children receive an education.

Debibala’s husband is involved in agriculture. He grows different types of crops and sells them in the local market. Debibala also assists her husband in his work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children.

Now Debibala has decided to give financial support to her family, as the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds and it is very difficult to bear all the household as well as the educational expenses of their children. Thus, to generate more income, she has decided to start a milk and milk products supply business. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing a dairy cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the local market and in her neighborhood. 

Debibala & her husband are successfully running their business and have taken hold on the market for selling milk products and vegetables.

Debibala is grateful to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk & milk products.

loans.name: M. Shehbaz

texts.en:
M. Shehbaz is age 36, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hard working and gentle person. He is responsible for his four daughters and old parents as well. 

He is a milkman by profession and sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk since 2000; now he is very expert and experienced in his profession. He is very expert in producing milk from buffaloes; he produces milk from his all buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes, this is the reason he has to work very hard to feed them. Every day he takes his buffaloes to the pasture for grazing and gives them a bath into the stream. He has to stay the whole day with his buffaloes due to fear of theft. He has not much time for his family members. 

He wants to increase the production of milk on daily basis by purchasing an additional buffalo. This way he could increase his milk production and ultimately his income as well. Therefore, M. Shehbaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes that he will be able to buy a buffalo and he will succeed in increasing his monthly income as well. 

He thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo to increase the production of milk.

loans.name: Dora Eleticia

texts.es:
Dora de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen dos hijos que viven en casa, solo la que tiene nueve años estudia su segundo grado, la otra niña pasa en casa con la señora Dora, nadie más vive con ellos.


Ella tiene uno negocio de venta de pupusas, ya tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad, su madre le enseño el oficio, por lo que decidió poner en práctica lo que había aprendido, no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique, el local donde hace las pupusas lo tiene fuera de su casa ya que está a orilla de calle y es un lugar muy céntrico. Le paga a una hermana que le ayuda todos los días, el horario de trabajo es de 2 pm a 9 pm. 


El préstamo será invertido en mejorar el local donde está ubicada la pupuseria, ya que es de nailon y con el crédito comprar polines, y lamina para que este más seguro.  Con esto mejorara el tener un lugar más digno y llamativo para realizar la venta, la necesidad satisfecha será el poder construir su local para realizar más cómodamente la actividad. 


Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que les dará una mejor estabilidad para sus hijos. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en: Dora ia 29 years old and went to school as far as the sixth grade.  She lives in a common-law relationship, and her partner works in agriculture.  They have two children who live with them. Only the nine-year-old girl is in school, in the second grade; the other girl stays at home with Dora.  No one else lives with them.  Dora has a business selling pupusas, and has been doing this for three years.  He mother taught her how to do this, so she decided to put into practice what she had learned.  She does not work at any other activities.  She sells pupusas from outside her house, as it is located by the side of the road in a very central area.  She pays her sister to help her every day, and works from 2 pm to 9 pm.  The loan will be used to improve the stall where she sells her pupusas, which is made of nylon.  She will use the loan to buy posts and sheet metal so that it will be more secure.  With this improvement she hopes to have better and more attractive business premises and be able to work more comfortably.  Her dream is to continue growing her sales and thus increase her income, so that she can provide greater stability to her children.  Her earnings will be invested in making her loan payments and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy posts and sheet metal to improve the stall where she sells pupusas.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John comes from Nyakabingo cell in the Kantozi Kamwenge district. He is married with four children who are all in school. He is a farmer who raises goats on a small scale and runs a bar in Rwamasinde with capital of 500,000 UGX.  He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy a motorcycle to do motorcycle (boda boda) business and leave his wife to run the other businesses at home. John also hopes to buy more goats for resale and construct a well improved shelter for them. 

John wants to raise enough money to educate his children to higher institutions of learning. He is honest and hard working.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.en:
Evaristo is married with two children who are not yet in school.But takes care of his aged parents and one nephew.

Evaristo is a bodaboda driver at a local stage in the village and also does farming on a small scale. He does all this to raise income to look after his family. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to and save for his children's tuition. He hopes to build a permanent house in his village and also buy a plot of land in town to construct a house in the trading center.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Theodora

texts.en: Theodora is married with six children of whom three are in school. She has a piggery and also runs a lady's salon on a major street in Ibanda town council. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to expand her piggery business. Theodora hopes to increase her production by feeding her pigs well to serve her customer's demands very well. If she is given the necessary support, she wants to finish her permanent house in the village and also pay her children’s school fees. Theodora is very honest and hardworking

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Adison

texts.en:
Adison, a rural client, operates a small retail shop in a trading center. He also does subsistence farming to cut the cost of buying food. 

He is new to borrowing, and will use the money to buy more items to restock the retail shop. 

He hopes the financial boost will create an impact on his sales and profit. 

Adison thanks Ugafode and the Kiva lenders for the opportunity to partner with them. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar, soap, and corn flour, among other items to sell

loans.name: Tusitukire Wamu Workers Group

texts.en:
Prossy is a farmer who grows bananas in a rural area in Kyotera. She is forty six years of age and she started farming in 1998 with a hope of getting a clear source of income which she would use to provide the basic needs to her family members. Farming is his major source of income and she also sells milk which gives her additional income. She has applied for a loan through the group to be able to buy fertilizers. She hopes that this will boost the fertility of the soils where her garden is and hence will get enough incomes from the increased yields. 

Her clients are mainly the residents in the same area where she operates from and a few town dwellers. Prossy is a hard working woman who works five days in the banana plantation every week and uses the other two days of the week to look for market for his tea. She is mainly challenged by the weather especially during the dry season since it does not favour the bananas which instead dry up. However, she is hopeful that if she gets the loan and applies the fertilizers, the yields will be higher and he will get relatively big profits from the business and be in position to provide for her family members adequately.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cost effective cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: Maria tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de San Francisco Zapotitlán, departamento de Suchitepéquez, tiene 3 hijas, la primera tiene 10 años de edad estudia cuarto primaria, la  segunda tiene 8 años de edad estudia tercer grado de  primaria y la tercera tiene 6 años de edad todavía no asiste a la  escuela, se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo y lo atiende en su casa, la otra actividad a que se dedica es al engorde de cerdos, tiene tres años de dedicarse a estas actividades, Maria solicita Q. 4,000.00 para la construcción de su cocina ya que  no tiene un lugar acondiciona y adecuada para preparar la alimentación de su familia, los planes de Maria es tener más cerdos para engordar.
texts.en: Maria is 34 years old and lives with her family in the municipality of San Francisco Zapotitlán, in the Suchitepéquez department. She has 3 daughters: the first is 10 years old and in fourth grade in elementary school, the second is 8 years old in the third grade, and the third daughter is 6 years old and has not started school yet. Maria makes a living selling beef and chicken, which she does from home. The other work she does is fattening pigs. She has done these activities for 3 years. Maria requests Q. 4,000 to build a kitchen since she does not have an adequate or suitable place to prepare food for her family. Maria plans to have more pigs to fatten.

loans.use: to build a kitchen

loans.name: Chrispus

texts.en:
Chrispus is tea farmer in a cell in Igara County, in Bushenyi District. He started farming in 2006 with much hope that he would get a lot of money to cater for the needs of his family. He is a hard-working man who works on the farm five days per week and works ten hours per each workday. He uses the other two days of the week to look for markets for the harvested tea. 

Tea farming is his sole source of income and he hopes to boost it by boosting the fertility of the soils which he will do by applying fertilizer, which he hopes to buy using the loan money (UGX 1,500,000 only). His clients are the tea traders in the area he operates in and the factories which give ready market for large quantities of tea since they process the green tea. 

He is a hard-working and honest man, traits he thinks have helped him to get the success he has so far registered. The dry weather affects his harvest negatively and this is the main challenge he has, but he hopes to get over it as the business grows. 

Chrispus has high hopes of becoming financially stable, especially if the loan is given, since he believes that it will boost his tea productivity and, hence, increase the profits received from the business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es una persona de 48 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, el mayor de sus hijos tiene 20 años estudia segundo básico, el segundo tiene 13 años estudia primero básico y el último tiene 9 años y está en segundo primaria, Juana obtiene sus ingresos por la venta de banano que hace en su comunidad desde hace 36 años, sus papas se dedicaban también a esta actividad y de ellos aprendió. Juana solicita un préstamo por un monto de Q. 6000.00 para comprar una cuerda de terreno, pensando el futuro de sus hijos, ya que más adelante piensa construir dos casas para ellos.
texts.en: Juana is 48 years old. She lives with her three children in the town of Nahualá in the department of Sololá. Her eldest son is 20 years old and studies in the second level of basic education. The second is 13 and studies in the first level of basic education, and the youngest is 9 and is in the second level of elementary education. Juana has generated income by selling bananas in her community for 36 years. Her parents did this for a living and she learned it from them. Juana is requesting a loan for $800 to buy a plot of land, thinking of her children's future, as later she is thinking of building two houses for them.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.

Socorro tiene 44 años y tiene 26 años de casada, su esposo se llama Crecensio y tienen 4 hijos que ya son independientes, también tiene 2 hermosos nietos. Ella tiene desde hace más de 25 años, un puesto donde vende dulces, refrescos, papas, etc. es como una miscelánea y ya cuento con permiso para vender mis productos.
Esta solicitando para invertir en su negocio, quiere surtirlo mejor de productos para poder incrementar sus ventas. Entre sus principales logros, Socorro comenta:
"Tengo un terreno y poco a poco lo hemos hido construyendo junto con la ayuda de mi esposo, tenemos un negocio propio y en adelante queremos terminar de construir bien nuestra casa".
texts.en:
Socorro is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

She is 44 years old and has been married for 26 years. Her husband’s name is Crecensio and they have four children who are already independent. They also have two beautiful grandchildren. For more than 25 years, Socorro has been managing a shop where she sells sweets, soft drinks, potato chips, and other items. It’s more of a variety store where she is able to sell her products.

She is requesting to invest in her business so that she can restock with more products and increase her sales. When asked what her main accomplishments are, Soccoro said, “I have a plot of land on which I’ve gradually built with the help of my husband. We have our own business, so moving forward, we want to finish the construction of our fine house.”

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, food, and snacks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair and renovate the toilet so that they can have better hygiene and health standards

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Eman lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Asep is single and lives with six persons in the family home.

Eman began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, he has around $23 – 24 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka runs a small stall where she sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Eka is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Eka began working with Ruma ten months ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last three months, she has around $45 – $46 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Yahya is single and lives with three persons in the family home.
		
Yahya began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, he has had around $23 – $24 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Nanyingae

texts.en:
Nanyingae is 30 years old, married to Mure, and supports a family of four members. A mixed farmer for the last eight years, her monthly income is KES 49000.

Nanyingae is currently requesting her seventh loan from VisionFund Kenya for KES 85000 to prepare her land and buy seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings

loans.name: Priscilla Kisia's Group

texts.en:
Priscilla is a member of this group in Lugari District. She is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 58 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Priscilla has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seeds and fertilizer for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an loan for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Priscilla is married and has four children. She is 52 years old and is known as a friendly, hardworking, reliable farmer. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group.  Priscilla has been a farmer for 22 years. She described her harvest as not very good with One Acre Fund last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  			

Priscilla is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Priscilla joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers by spreading the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Priscilla plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  

Priscilla and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his Thyme farm.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man, from a small village near Tulkarm city. He lives with his family, in a small house in the village. Mohammad's father works as a farmer, planting seasonal fruits and vegetables. Three years ago, Mohammad opened a small store for selling fresh crops grown by his father. It is a good business, and the demand for his produce is high. Mohammad would like to improve his business, by beginning to sell meat.

Mohammad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy meat and a refrigerator for his store. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his store and increase his sales. Mohammad appears in the photo, above.

loans.use: to buy meat and a refrigerator for his store

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is 34 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He has been engaged in live stock business for past fifteen years.
He needs to buy feeder and other merchandises for his live stock business, but due to insufficient financial means he is not in the position to buy these items for his business purpose.
Therefore he has requested for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan he can easily buy above these items for his business purpose, so that he can earn maximum profitable income to manage his business and house hold.
On this financial assistance Saeed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase catle's food stuff.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 24 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Karachi, Pakistan. He has been working as tailor for many years, he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family.  
He needs new sewing machine for sewing pents and shirts, but due to insufficient financial means He is unable to purchase the sewing machine and its accessories. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy new sewing machine and also helpful for him to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Ali is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machine for his business purpose.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано жительница маленького, но дружелюбного района Кубадиён. Ей 48 лет. Рано как и многие жители Таджикистана хочет начать новый бизнес. Она будет заниматься выращиванием крупнорогатых скотов. У нее имеется условия для содержания скотин но ей не хватает определенной суммы денег, чтобы купить достаточное количество скотин. Причина, по которой она выбрала именно этот бизнес, является хороший климат Таджикистана, способствующий здоровому развитию скотин. Рано надеется на поддержку и верит, что сможет начать бизнес, и бизнес будет процветать.
texts.en: Rano is a resident of the small yet welcoming Qubadiyon District. She is 48 years old. Like many residents of Tajikistan, Rano wants to start a new business. She will raise cattle. She has all of the conditions for housing cattle but she does not have 2000 USD to buy a good amount of cattle. The reason why she choose this business is because Tajikistan has a good climate which is beneficial for raising healthy cattle. Rano relies on your support and believes that she will be able to start this business and that this business will flourish.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business of raising cattle.

loans.name: Miroslava

texts.ru:
Мирослава живет в Виноградово со своей семьей. Она работает на автомобильном предприятии в должности монтера 2-го разряда. Работает на этом предприятии уже 4 года. 
Мирослава вместе с семьей живет в своем доме. Сумма в 6300 гривен нужна ей для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в коридоре, а именно провести демонтаж старого пола, сделать монтаж водяного подогрева пола, залить стяжку и наклеить на пол плитку. Мирослава давно хотела сделать ремонт в коридоре, потому что он делался там давно, к тому же мастера по ремонту именно сейчас свободны и готовы работать у нее.
texts.en:
Miroslava lives in Vinogradovo with her family. She works at the enterprise "Automotiv Ukraina" as a second class electrician. She has worked in this company for four years already. 

Miroslava lives with her family in their own house. She needs a loan of 6,300 hryvnia in order to repair her hallway, and also to dismantle the old floor and install a water-heated floor, fill cement and cover the floor with tiles. Miroslava has long wished to repair her hallways, because it was made a long time ago. Besides, a repairman is currently free and ready to work for her.

loans.use: to repair her hallway.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Arsenia is a married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. Arsenia has sold several goods and items to the people in her place.  She is asking for a loan to purchase additional groceries to sell including soft drinks, rice, canned goods, bottled mineral water, as well as shampoo and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stocks, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell including soft drinks, rice, canned goods, bottled mineral water, shampoo and toiletries.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and from Nakuru. She is married to Joseph and they are blessed with five children, ages 25, 23, 20, 18 and 16.

She is a tailor and has been running the business for the last 15 years. To enable her to buy more clothing material, sewing thread and some fasteners, she has applied for her fourth loan of KES 54,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Right now her monthly income is KES 15,000. She intends to use profits realized from her expanded business to educate her children and to repay her loan to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to open a clothing mall.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material, sewing thread and some fasteners to use in making clothes for her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma lost her husband 13 years ago to a sudden illness. She has two daughters and two sons. She worked for many years at organizations as a nurse. For the last seven years, she has run a small-scale health clinic that she established with a small amount of capital. She is liked in her community because she offers good service. With the loan from Maya, she will purchase medical supplies. She is raising her children and doing all she can for them to make a living. She has helped three of her children to get married and set up a household. She wants to contribute to her fourth child’s education. She wants to contribute to the family finances and to Turkey’s economy.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Fatma , eşini 13 yıl önce kalp krizinden kaybetmiş.  2 kız 2 erkek çocuk annesi.  Hemşire olarak uzun yıllar kuruluşlarda çalışmış.  Yedi yıldır küçük sermaye ile kurduğu saglık kabinini işletiyor.  Çevrede iyi hizmet verdiğinden dolayı seviliyor.  Aldığı bu kredi ile tıbbı malzeme alacak.  Çocuklarinı yetiştiriyor.  İş sahibi olmaları için elinden geleni yapıyor.  Üçünün evlenmelerine yuva kurmalarına destek vermiş.  4. Çocuğuna ise okumasına katkı sağlamak istiyor.  Kendisi de aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to purchase medical supplies

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es: José tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 16 años de edad. José tiene un pequeño negocio de cocos  a la orilla de la calle de la localidad el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos y es el que le permite mantener la economía del hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar las paredes de su vivienda. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: José is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 16 year-old son. José has a small roadside coconut business in town that is his principal source of income and allows him to maintain the household economy. With the purpose of improving his housing conditions, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheeting and wood to repair the walls of his home. He hopes he can count on this funding to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to repair the walls of his home.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 33 years old from Nyahururu. He is married to Milka and they are blessed with three children ages 10, 6 and 2 years old.

He sells cereals as well as school uniforms, a business he has been running for the last 10 years. To enable him to buy more supplies of school uniforms and cereals to sell to his customers, he has applied for his second loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Currently Cyrus' monthly income is KES 10,000 and he intends to use the profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children and to repay his loan.

In the near future, Cyrus hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy more school uniforms and cereals to sell to his customers

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last few years. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order.  So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Milica

texts.en:
Milica is 25 years old and a mother of a 3-year-old little girl. Together with her daughter and husband, they live in one of the minority communities where Milica is a stay-at-home mother. Her husband works as a medical technician in a hospital. 

They also work together on the land that they own and plant wheat for them to eat and to sell. They are very happy with their agricultural business and are requesting a loan in order to purchase machine tools for the tractor that they use on the land. 

Milica is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase machine tools for the tractor

loans.name: Arqam

texts.en:
Arqam is 25 years old and an energetic and honest man who lives with his parents in the area of Lahore. He is a wholesaler of rice; he buys the rice from harvesters at a low price and sells in Lahore city to the retailers. He buys rice of various kinds such as basmati and super kernel from the field. He has been doing the same practice for many years and has many reputable retailers who like to buy rice from him in large quantities. He has built up a positive relationship among the retailers and they help him promote his business as well. 
With the increase in new customers, he wants to buy rice in large quantities so he can easily cope with the higher demand. In this way, he would be able to increase his monthly income and savings as well. Arqam is grateful for this honorable support and thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk for reselling to the retailers.

loans.name: Abdel Haleem

texts.en:
Abdel Haleem is a 21-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father is an employee in the public sector where he earn a low income. Abdel is a student in a local university where he studies Business Adminstration. ِHe would like to finish his studies and find a job. 

Abdel took a Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to do his homework and read articles online. 

Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood.

loans.name: Brigido

texts.es:
Brigido es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Brigido tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace más de 20 años, su esposa lo apoya en el negocio y también sus hijos. El comenta que es muy conocido en la zona y tambien se dedica a la crianza de animales en un rancho que tiene, donde le gusta cuidar a los puerquitos, borreguitos y tambien quiere comprar un becerrito.
Esta pidiendo el préstamo para invertir en su tienda de abarrotes, comenta que no se sentiria saturado y que puede pagarlo ya que sus gastos no son muy altos y sus  hijos a pesar de que ya no viven con el, lo siguen apoyando con el gasto, luz y agua.
Para Brigido su principal logro es haber sacado adelante a sus hijos y mantener a su familia unida. Ahora quiere segur trabajando, ofrecer mejor servicio y tener mas animalitos en su rancho. .
texts.en:
Brigido is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story. 

Brigido has had a grocery store for more than 20 years. His wife supports him in the business, as do his children. He says that he is well known in the area and he is also engaged in raising animals on a small farm he has, where he likes to take care of the piglets and lambs and also want to buy a calf. 

He is asking for the loan in order to invest in his grocery store. He says that he would not feel overburdened and can afford it because his costs are not very high and although his children no longer live with him, they still support him with the expenditure, electricity and water. 

For Brigido his main achievement is to have brought up his children and kept his family together. Now he wants to continue working, provide better service and have more small animals on his ranch. .

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz desde hace 10 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 45 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Querocotillo, a community with a varied climate.  The people in the town work in agriculture, business and livestock.  It is located in the province of Cutervo which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú.  

Ernesto works in agriculture, particularly the cultivation of corn. He has been working in this field for 10 years and his wife helps him in this labor.  He is asking for a loan of 1600 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to buy fertilizer and in this way have a better yield to offer to his clients, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for growing corn.

loans.name: Reşadiye

texts.en:
Reşadiye is married and has two children. She makes jewelry, gift items, and plaster ornaments and figurines, which she sells from home and at markets and fairs. She started out small, selling her products from her house. At the beginning she had very little capital. As demand increased, she began selling at markets. She contributes to the family finances. 

Reşadiye requested a loan from Maya, which she will use to buy materials so she can make products and sell them to earn money. She wants to provide a good future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Pompeyo

texts.es:
Pompeyo es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Pompeyo tiene 61 años, esta casado y tiene una hija. Anteriormente trabaja en una empresa de calderas como fogonero, después se independizo y ahora se dedica al comercio en particular a la venta de ropa y calzado, el cual es un negocio familiar. El se describe como una persona pro activa, accesible, disciplinada, responsable y comprometida con su negocio y que trata de mejorar cada día como persona y laboralmente.

Pompeyo esta solicitando el préstamo para apoyar a su familia y principalmente a su hija, lo usará para la compra de mercancía para invertir nuevos productos al negocio, generar más ventas con nuevos productos y tener la posibilidad de superar las ventas actuales y ganar más.
El dice que se beneficiaría al tener más producto y modelos más actuales de ropa y calzado.  Pompeyo dice que sus objetivos son mejorar su desempeño, crecer y adquirir nuevos conocimientos y experiencia laboral en su trabajo. El dice: " en cuanto a mi negocio quiero expandirlo mas y poder comprar mas mercancías como también obtener mas ventas y mercado".
texts.en:
Pompeyo is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is his story:
Pompeyo is 61 years old, is married, and has a daughter.  He previously worked in a boiler business as a stoker.  Later he became self-employed, and he now has a family business selling clothing and shoes.  He describes himself as a proactive, approachable, disciplined, responsible and committed person in his business, and tries every day to improve himself both as a person and as a worker.  Pompeyo is requesting a loan in order to support his family, especially his daughter.  He will use the loan to buy merchandise to provide new products for his business and generate more sales, so that he can earn more.  He says that he will benefit from having more products and models of clothing and shoes.  Pompeyo says that his objectives are to improve his performance, to grow, and to acquire new knowledge and experience in his work.  He says: "With regard to my business I want to expand more and to be able to buy more merchandise so as to obtain more sales and business".

loans.use: to invest in shoes in order to have more inventory and greater variety.

loans.name: Filloreta

texts.en:
Filloreta lives in a minority community in Kosovo with her husband and their three children. She is a housewife and stay-at-home mother. She has been actively seeking employment without success. She would like to assist her family who lives in very poor living conditions. 

Her husband financially maintains their family working as a cleaner in the city. Their living conditions are terrible, and many areas of the house are in desperate need of urgent repair. 

They will use the salary of her husband to pay the loan on time. Filloreta is very happy for this support and wants to thank all of the lenders. She is hoping in the near future to find a job as a cleaner and to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Zejnep

texts.en:
Zejnep is married and lives in a minority community with her husband and their five children. Two children attend school. She works as a cleaner with a very low salary, while her husband collects plastic bottles. They are very poor and work hard to maintain their family in the best way that they can. 

Through their hard work, they have been able to make some repairs and renovate their home in order to improve their living conditions, but they have not been able to complete the facade of the outside of their house. 

Now, Zejnep is asking for a loan in order to complete the facade to further improve their living conditions. She is very grateful for the loan and the help of all of the lenders.

loans.use: to complete the facade of the home.

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es:
Rosa Imelda tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores patos y cerdos, desde que se caso para apoyar con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para el mejoramiento de su infraestructura donde se encuentran sus animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones a sus animales y por ende un mejor desarrollo de producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Imelda is 58 years old and lives together with her husband and children in the district of Nueva Arica, a community that is dedicated to agriculture, business and livestock.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú.

Rosa Imelda works raising livestock and selling small animals like ducks and pigs.  She has been working in this area since she was married in order to help with household expenses.  She is asking for a loan of 3500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to improve the infrastructure of the place where she keeps her animals.  This investment will help her to keep her animals in better conditions and thus will offer a better final product for her customers.

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her corrals in order to better maintain her animals.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi is 39 years old, and she lives with her large family in the village Dsegh, in Lori region. She is a mother of three children; her elder son is passing his military service in the army, and her other two sons are still school-aged. This peasant family’s livelihood depends on their farming income, in which all of them are engaged and help each other very much. Armenuhi simultaneously works as a milker.  She is the only one employed in her family. Her husband is completely occupied with farming and agriculture.  The farm has five cows, two calves, 20 chickens and a plot of land; on the half of it she cultivates vegetables and fruit trees, and the other part is used as a hayfield.  Armenuhi manages just about everything around her farm; she milks her cows and from that milk makes butter, cheese, curds, and sour cream. She also gathers from her land greens, tomatoes, peppers, carrots, cucumbers and apples of various sorts. All of these, she sells to villagers and to retailers right from her house. Her husband’s duty is to keep the cattle always fed. So he gathers hay from their hayfield for their farm cattle, and provides them with enough hay each day. With great hope, and she plans to make her farm bigger.  Armenuhi asks for a loan to purchase two bulls, which will surely make her family a greater profit.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls, which will surely make her family a greater profit.

loans.name: Juana Devora

texts.es:
Juana Devora tiene 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, en el mercado de su distrito comercializa fruta plátanos, naranjas y pescado, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de frutas y pescados para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Juana Devor is 62 years old, and lives with her spouse and children in the Buenos Aires district, which is a community where people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.  It is located in the province of Morropon, which is part of the Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.  Juana works raising cattle, and sells fruit, such as bananas and oranges, as well as fish, in the local market.  She is an enterprising mother who is requesting a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles to buy a variety of fruit and fish to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit and fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Faton

texts.en:
Fatonis is a 47-year-old married man with  3 children between the ages of 2 to 9 years old. His wife stays at home to care for the children. He has earned a living  working in construction for the last 20 years. Many years later, he has been able to move out of their old and rundown home and move into a new house. 

The only thing left to do is purchase new windows and doors. He requests a loan to help him to have better living conditions for his family.

Fatonis is happy to have the opportunity to live in a comfortable environment. He is very grateful for all of the lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase new windows and doors.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es joven soltero de 27 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un joven trabajador que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Pedro comenta que se dedica a la albañilería desde hace diez años. La actividad que realiza la eligió porque le gusta y además de ello obtiene buenos ingresos económicos que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia. Comenta que también se dedica al cultivo de melocotones y lo realiza a unos metros de su vivienda.
El ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la compra de una cuerda de terreno. El préstamo lo pagara con el trabajo que tiene.
El sueño de Pedro es poder construir su casa, para que en un futuro pueda brindarle una vida de calidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a young, single, 27 year-old man who currently lives with his parents and siblings in the government region of Sololá.  He is a hard-working young man who struggles for the good of his family.  Pedro comments that he has been working as a brick layer for the past 10 years.  He chose this activity because he likes it and also because he can obtain a good income and help with family expenses.  He states that he also works cultivating peaches and he does this a few meters from his home.  

Currently he is requesting a loan of 10,000 Quetzales (Guatemalan currency) in order to purchase a plot of land.  The loan will be repaid via his work.  Pedro's dream is to be able to build his own home, so that in the future he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools for his tractor.

loans.name: Jegbeh

texts.en:
Jegbeh is a 42-year-old  married woman from Waterloo,  the western rural area in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She has 7 children.  

In 2004, Jegbeh established her retail business to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is inflation and a proper business location.

Jegbeh requires a loan to purchase assorted drinks and expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Jegbeh plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase assorted drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Doña Jesús, tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside junto con ellos en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Tiene 10 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa, vende camisas, faldas, blusas, calcetas, pantalones y otros. Sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. Ha mantenido estable su negocio mediante la inversión de varios préstamos, actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para surtir mas el negocio con ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y niños como ser pantalones, blusas, camisas vestidos etc. Su plan es crecer en clientes y aumentar los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Jesus is 47 years old and is a single mother.  She has two children, and lives with them in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  For 10 years she has had her own business selling clothing.  She sells shirts, skirts, blouses, stockings, pants and other things.  She works as a mobile vendor and also takes orders.  She has kept her business stable with a number of loans.  She is now requesting another loan of 12,000 lempiras in order to supply her business with new clothing for women, men and children, such as pants, blouses, shirts, dresses, etc.  Her plan is to grow the number of customers she has, and to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to supply her business with new clothing for women, men and children, such as pants, blouses, shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Ally is a single man in his early 30s.  He has three children, two go to school and the third child is still young.  He has sold second-hand clothes for two years and works from 9 am to 6 pm daily.  He  is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Ally's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the stock of his second-hand clothing inventory.  He has repaid  all of his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school and household expenses.  He is doing fine with the loan.  He will use this loan to buy good quality second-hand clothes to meet customers' demand.  He dreams of improving his life style and having a big business.

Ally will share this loan with his loan group "MAVUNO" which has five members who will hold each other accountable to pay back the loan,

loans.use: to buy good quality second-hand clothes  to  meet customers' demand.

loans.name: Ivana

texts.en:
Ivana lives in a minority community with her husband and their two young daughters. She is employed in a municipality and also runs a private business with her husband who is a master tradesman for electrical generators. 

In the beginning, he started to fix small generators and since then has managed to expand their business into selling them. Her husband is very talented and popular in his area; he runs a good business and has a good reputation for his repair work. 

Ivana requests a loan to purchase spare parts for the electrical generator engines. This loan will help them to be able to increase their business and meet the demands of customers.  They will be enable them to improve the income that they earn. With the additional income, they hope to provide a better life and education for their children. 

She wants to thank all of the lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the electrical generator engines.

loans.name: Chamwino Group

texts.en:
Noela is in her late thirties and has  two children who are in school. She makes her family living operating a general store to sell rice, sugar, soft drinks, maize flour, baking flour and other items. She works from 06:30 am to 10:00 pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is Noela's fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She successfully repaid the previous loan which  she used to restock her shop with new products. She needs to increase her inventory. With the earned income, she was able to cover school fees and household expenses. Noela will use this loan to increase her inventory. She dreams that one day she will be able to manage another successful shop. 

Noela will share this loan with her loan group "CHAMWINO" which has 4 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable  to repay  the loan.

loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. En busca de obtener su propio ingreso para su hogar, decidió hace 7 años dedicarse al comercio, vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, como ser camisetas, pantalones, blusas, también otra mercadería como platos, vasos, juego de cucharas, panas plásticas etc. Ella vende mediante pedidos. El préstamo que solicita es por 8,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar más ropa como pantalones, blusas, camisas, artículos para el hogar para vender. Su sueño es hacer crecer el negocio y darles calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosario is 34 years old, and is a single mother.  She lives with her two children in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  In search of a way to earn income for her household, she decided 7 years ago to start a business.  She sells clothing for women, men and children, such as T-shirts, pants, blouses, and other merchandise such as plates, vases, sets of spoons, plastic items, etc.  She sells by taking orders.  She is requesting a loan of 8,000 lempiras, with which she will buy more clothing such as pants, blouses, shirts, and also household articles to sell.  Her dream is to grow her business and to provide a good quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothing such as pants, blouses, shirts, and also household articles to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase rice, snacks, beans, oil, salt, soap, detergent, spices, drinks and other products.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is widowed with 1 child. She is 60 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines. Monica sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Monica has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Monica hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Flurije

texts.en: Flurije is a married mother of five children. She is a very hardworking woman who has led a difficult life. Her husband is blind and unable to support his family, leaving the responsibility of the family life and the finances to Flurije. As if things were not difficult enough, she also cares for her husband’s elderly mother who is ill and lives with them. As a way to be able to balance all of the needs and responsibilities, Flurije keeps a cow and plants vegetables. She sells the milk, milk products, and vegetables in her neighborhood and uses them to provide food and nutrition for her family. She has been able to provide for everyone this way and pay for an education for her children. Now she is in need of a loan in order to purchase a male calf that she will be able to raise and sell in December when he is older and prices are higher. She hopes that the loan will improve their living conditions for her family. Despite all of her hardships and difficulties, she continues to work hard and remain optimistic. Flurije hopes in the future to be able to give her children a better education and opportunities in life. She is grateful for the support and opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a male calf

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es hombre soltero de 37 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a sus cinco hijos y su pareja en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un hombre trabajador. Comenta que se dedica al trabajo de albañilería a unos metros de su vivienda. Esta actividad lo ha ayudado mucho porque su padre se dedicaba a lo mismo, y es así como fue aprendiendo esta labor. Ahora cuenta con quince años de experiencia en esta área, que ha sido bastante productiva en cuanto a la generación de ingresos. Como también comenta que se dedica al cultivo de maíz.
Ahora él ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 8,500.00 para la compra de una cuerda de terreno. El préstamo lo pagara con el trabajo que cuenta.
Unos de los sueños de don Pedro es darle una vida de calidad a su familia a través de la labor que realiza.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 37 year old single man.  He currently lives with his five children and his spouse in Sololá.  He is a hardworking man.  He works as a mason close to his home.  This job has helped him very much.  His father worked in the same trade, which is how he learned it.  He now has 15 years of experience in this field, which has been very productive in terms of generating an income.  He also works growing corn.  

He has now decided to seek a loan of Q 8,500 to purchase a plot of land.  He will repay the loan through the work he does.  One of Pedro's dreams is to provide his family with a good quality of life through his work.

loans.use: purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: M. Shakeel

texts.en:
M. Shakeel has applied for a loan to purchase concrete, cement and bricks to  increase his monthly sales.
 
M. Shakeel is 38 years old and from the beautiful city of Pakistan. He has a partner and two children. He is a friendly, hard working, and honorable person. 

He owns a construction supply shop to sell cement, bricks, sand, concrete. He also provides sheltering services.
 
Recently, he purchased a lot of bricks and spent a lot of money. He has spent his savings for household expenses as well. He does not have sufficient cash to buy inventory items. He wants to buy supplies such as concrete, cement, and sand but he does not have sufficient cash in hand.

M. Shakeel requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy remaining supplies. M. Shakeel thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy concrete, cement, and sand to sell.

loans.name: Selnys

texts.en: Selnys used the "door to door" marketing in his community to help him. He sold out  his last stocks so fast, and acquired more customers, which pushed him to increase his stock. Now he is coming back to us for a fourth loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Herman Alonso

texts.es:
Herman es un hombre trabajador de 42 años de edad, que lleva varios años dedicándose a atender su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició como alternativa para ganarse la vida y generar recursos para su sustento. El establecimiento está ubicado en la casa donde reside, allí cuenta con la ventaja de no poseer competencia cercana, lo que beneficia sus ventas e ingresos.
El crédito solicitado está destinado para la compra de surtido al por mayor (galletería, mecato, dulces, café, panela, granos y otros) y una vitrina para exhibición, esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del negocio y tendrá más variedad  de artículos para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de su clientela.
Herman manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando arduamente para llegar a cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio y en un futuro tener la capacidad económica para adquirir una vivienda propia, en la que pueda mejorar sus condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Herman is a hardworking 42 year old man.  For many years, he has dedicated himself to running his own business, a grocery store that he opened as a different way of earning a living and generating an income to provide for himself.  The store is located in his home.  There, he benefits from not having any competition nearby, which helps his sales and income.  

The loan that he is seeking will be used to purchase an assortment of products in bulk (cookies, snacks, candy, coffee, unrefined whole cane sugar, grains and others) and a display case.  This will allow him to improve his store's image.  He will also have a greater variety of products to satisfy the tastes and needs of his customers.  Herman states that his greatest challenge is continuing to fight hard to reach his dream of expanding his business and in the future having the financial ability to have his own home, where he can improve his living conditions and wellbeing.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of products and a display case, in order to improve his store's business

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose has been a client for a long time.  He is married and has 8 children; 5 children attend school. 

He has been a cattle trader  for 12 years.  It is his major source of income. He operated his business using his capital but later found out that he cannot compete in the market.  Therefore, he decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance and to boost his business.  He plans to buy baby cows to graze and then sell them a few months later. 

Ambrose thanks Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled him to educate his children and sustain his business. He hope that this loan will enable him to expand his business and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 56 years old and lives in Teshie Town, one of the old communities in Accra-Ghana that is well known. 

She is unmarried and has grown children who live on their own. She stopped her formal education at grade five. 

For the past eight years, she has run a shop to sell tissue paper, sardines, rice, canned tomatoes and biscuits. She started this business with a little money from her  savings and managed to establish this business. She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. She requests a loan to buy more tissue paper, sardines, rice, canned tomatoes, and biscuits.

loans.use: to buy tissue paper, sardines, rice, canned  tomatoes, and biscuits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is only 23 years old, married, a housewife and a mother of a 2-year-old son.  She only completed primary education due to the poor financial resources of her parents. She is married to Chandan, aged 26 years, a tailor by profession. He also studied up to grade 5. They live in their own small kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Sumitra's husband has been engaged in this tailoring activity for 15 years. He sews new garments. He does the work very honestly. He has goodwill in his area, and his neighbors depend on his tailoring service. He is an expert in making pants, shirts and ladies’ clothes.  

Now he wants to expand his business in order to earn more to make ends meet. The household expenses are rapidly increasing nowadays, with the growing prices of essential commodities.

Sumitra has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She has decided to purchase more cloth, thread and other necessary materials for expanding their existing tailoring business. She hopes it will help them to generate more income for the wellbeing of their family. 

In the future, she dreams to buy another sewing machine with the profit from their business.

She is very happy and thankful to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread and other materials for expanding their existing tailoring business.

loans.name: Jessica Violeta

texts.es:
Jessica Violeta tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada ceviche, desde hace 5 años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos variedad de pescados y utensilios descartables para repartir la preparación de su ceviche.
texts.en:
Jessica Violeta, 33, lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayalti. The main industries in this community are agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She has made a living selling prepared food and ceviche for five years. She has a considerable clientele. She has applied for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian new soles to buy supplies: a variety of fish and disposable utensils to distribute her prepared ceviche.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and disposable utensils.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a new client to the organization, who is securing a loan of UGX 1,500,000. The 53-year-old man is married and blessed with five children. He comes from a village in Kyafoora parish, Rugarama sub-county, Rukungiri district.

Caleb is a hard-working man. He runs a cattle-fattening business and works in agriculture as his main sources of income, operated in Obushenyi village. He has been in this business for many years and it has helped him to get money for meeting his family's needs and also paying his children’s school fees.

However, he has been faced with a challenge of limited capital to add to his business. He approached UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (UGAFODE) for financial support to buy baby bulls, which are now selling cheaply. He hopes he will be able to sell them in the near future and get income.

Caleb appreciates Kiva ad UGAFODE for the financial support rendered to his home.

loans.use: to buy baby bulls.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta, es casada, vive sola con su esposo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y atiende una venta de productos de primera necesidad, lo aprendió por la necesidad de apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, ya posee 15 años desempeñando dichas actividades, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., lo hace con la cooperación de su esposo.
Invertirá en la compra de concentrado para ganado, jabón, aceite, pan, arroz, bebidas boquitas, etc., le ayudara a surtir el inventario y a imponerse ante la competencia ofreciendo mejores precios, aumentara la clientela, sus ventas serán mayores y sus nuevos ingresos le permitirán cancelar las cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
Aspira a que su negocio sea más rentable para que junto a su esposo puedan tener una vida más confortable.
texts.en: Modesta is married and lives with her husband. She works raising cattle and has a store selling basic staples. She learned this in order to help with household expenses. She has been working in these activities for 15 years. Her schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. She has the help of her husband. She will invest it in buying concentrated cattle, soap, oil, bread, rice, beverages, snack foods, etc. This will help her stock up her inventory and be better than the competition by offering better prices which will increase her clientele. Her sales will be bigger and her new income will allow her to make her loan payments in a timely fashion. She wants that her business is more profitable so that together with her husband they can have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy concentrated cattle feed, soap, oil, bread, beverages, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Surjamani

texts.en:
Surjamani is from the remote village of Bagnan in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter).  One is a student of grade 4, and the other is too young to go to school. Surjamani is 36 years old and a housewife. Her husband, Sonamon, aged 45 years, is associated with agribusiness. Both are illiterate and only can sign their names.

Her husband has ten years of experience in agriculture, since it is the principal occupation of the villagers in her community for generating income, and since there are not many sources of employment other than agriculture. The land he works is his own. He grows different vegetables and sells them in the local markets. As the only source of income for the family, he wants to increase his income to cope with the growing needs of his family, so he has decided to cultivate garlic on his farmland.

Surjamani applied for a loan from BJS to purchase garlic seeds and manure to start cultivation. She hopes for a good profit from this new business, as the crop is in good demand in the present market.  

Her plans for the future are to continue expanding garlic cultivation. She dreams that her children can get better education.
