He has five acres of ancestral land where he grows different kinds of vegetables such as potatoes, onions, and other seasonal vegetables.  Their clients are the people who live in the locality.  Monu and her husband work hard on their farmland from dawn to dusk to grow good quality vegetables.  Yet, they are unable to get a good profit to maintain the family in a good manner.  So, they have decided to expand their business by cultivating a crop that is in great demand in the local market.

Monu has taken a loan from BJS, Kiva's partner, to purchase garlic seeds and fertilizers for cultivation. They think this loan will help her to start the business in a better way. It is an important, profitable activity that will bring in money for her family. Her goals are to be able to grow more garlic to continue increasing her crops, as it will generate an excellent income.

Her priorities are the education of her child and strengthening the family's property.

She gives her thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase garlic seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
This nice and unbelievably charming woman’s name is Anahit; this name in Armenian mythology was also the name of the God of Beauty, Love and Family.  Anahit lives in the village Parakar in the Armavir region. She is 42 years old and is a mother of two beautiful daughters and a son (school-aged). Anahit has higher education and she is a leading specialist of Armenian Language and Literature. Now she works at one of the leading schools of Yerevan as a teacher of Armenian language and Literature. Besides teaching in school, she teaches the Armenian language privately in her house with pupils. Her husband is a cargo carrier, and he works very hard, without holidays, in order to support (with his wife) their not-so-small family. Both of Anahit’s daughters are students and they study at the paid divisions. For this family, it is very hard, beside everyday costs, also to pay for their education.

Anahit asks for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams, to pay for her daughters’ tuition fees for the second semester. This will be Anahit’s second deal with Kiva. The first loan’s aim was also the payment of tuition fees and now she greatly hopes for support for the second time from Kiva and Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters' tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Deysi Aydee

texts.es:
Deysi, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados que obtiene, en esta oportunidad utilizara el capital para comprar melones, papayas, pepinos, ejotes, jocotes, granadillas, pipianes, etc. Para ofrecer mercadería fresca y de calidad a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior surtió la venta con frutas y verduras necesarias para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, sus ingresos son mejores, ha cancelado sus deudas, vive en mejores circunstancias junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Deysi has decided on a new loan because of the good results that she obtained. Now she will use the capital to buy melons, papayas, cucumbers, green beans, jocotes (a plumlike tree fruit also known as mombin), passion fruit, squash, and so forth, in order to offer fresh merchandise of good quality to her customers.

With the previous loan, she stocked her sales stand with the necessary fruits and vegetables to meet the demands of her customers, her income was better, she paid her debts, and she lives in better circumstances, along with her family.

loans.use: to buy melons, papayas, cucumbers, green beans, jocote (mombin), passion fruits, squash, etc.

loans.name: José Williams

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de cuales ambos están yendo a la escuela, él como como la mayoría de los hombres que viven en la zona rural se dedica a la agricultura porque cuando era un niño no logró prepararse académicamente ya que sus padres no tenían como apoyarlo, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz, ahora también tiene una vaca que cuida para sacarle provecho de la leche, y esos son los medios de los cuales él obtiene los mayores ingresos para su familia.

El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la siembra de una hectárea de maíz, pues si cultiva mas este año sacará mayores ganancias y así podrá tener mayores ingresos para su familia y  para ello necesita el crédito para poder sacar la cosecha.

Él sueña con poder cultivar una hectárea mas,  lo cual le ayudaría en sus ingresos ya que por el momento no puede satisfacer por completo las necesidades básicas de su familia, y cuando pasa la época agrícola su familia queda con pocos granos básicos y por eso está viendo otras alternativas para lograr cubrir dichas necesidades.
texts.en:
Jose, 37, has 2 children who both attend school.  Like most of the men who live in this rural area, Jose works in agriculture, because when he was a child he did not get an education as his parents could not afford it.  Jose has a partner who devotes herself to the household tasks.

Jose has always cultivated corn.  Now he also has a cow that he tends to in order to benefit from the milk.  These are his best means of obtaining income for his family.

Jose is requesting a loan to invest in cultivating a hectare of corn.  If he cultivates more corn this year, he will obtain better earnings and thereby have more income for his family.  To do this, he needs this loan so that he can have a bigger harvest.

He dreams of being able to cultivate another hectare.  This would help his income, because at this time he is not able to completely satisfy the basic needs of his family.  When the growing season passes, his family is left with few staple grains, and so he is looking at alternative ways to cover the needs of his family.

loans.use: to plant a hectare of corn

loans.name: Mamata Shg Group

texts.en:
These members belong to the Mamata Self-Help Group. One of them is Durmila, age 33. In the picture, the lady standing third from the right in a red saree is Durmila. 

Durmila has a spouse and three children. She alternates her daily activities with a business of selling rice, grams, spices, wafers, hair oil and other household consumables. She runs a small shop where she sells all these things to support her family. She has been in this business for a good amount of time, and she does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business. She also sells vegetables in her shop. 

She requests the loan to buy sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables for her business. She thanks those who share her dream by this means and commits to making her payments as scheduled. 

The businesses of the other group members are a butcher shop, dairy farm, and a tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables to sell.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been doing a business of making artificial flowers for many years. She offers various handmade artificial flowers in different colors which are used in decorating homes and rooms. At this time, she has become famous in providing good-quality, colorful flowers in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to buy additional materials such as fabric, tissue papers, green tape, floral tape, and packs of glues and wires. In this way she would be able to get an increase in her earnings through her large sales.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as fabric, tissue papers, green tape, floral tape, and packs of glues and wires

loans.name: Andrés Estiven

texts.es:
Andrés es un joven activo, emprendedor y con un espíritu de superación que lo ha impulsado a buscar alternativas para ganarse la vida.
A sus 22 años de edad, ya es graduado de técnica en gastronomía y, desde hace 18 meses montó un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, el cual tuvo muy buena acogida en el sector y, de manera adicional inició otro negocio de venta de comida y cervezas, donde pone en práctica sus conocimientos en gastronomía, allí trabaja en compañía de un empleado directo de lunes a domingo de 7 am a 3 pm y luego se dedica a atender la legumbrería.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para realizar unas adecuaciones al local de comidas, pues lo ampliará para tener más espacio disponible y atender a un mayor número de comensales, lo que le permitirá aumentar los ingresos.
Andrés manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad a ambos negocios y generar más oportunidades de empleo, además sueña con abrir una fundación para capacitar en el campo de la gastronomía a aquellas personas de bajos recursos que quieran aprender y crear empresa; además quiere tener la capacidad económica para comprarle una casa a su madre y disfrutar junto a ella una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrés is an active, entrepreneurial young man whose spirit of self improvement has motivated him to look for alternative ways to earn a living.  

At 22 years of age, he has graduated from technical school where he studied gastronomy. Eighteen months ago he started a business selling fruits and vegetables which was very well received in his neighborhood. He then started another business selling food and beer where he puts his knowledge of cooking into practice.  He works with one employee from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. Monday to Sunday, and after 3 he works at the fruit and vegetable stand. 

He is asking for the loan so he can make some alterations to his restaurant.  He would like to expand it to have space to accommodate more guests which will allow him to increase his income.  Andres says that his greatest desire is to keep both businesses running and provide more employment opportunities. He also dreams of opening a foundation in the countryside to train people of limited resources who want to learn about gastronomy and start their own businesses. Additionally, he would like to earn enough money to buy a house for his mother and enjoy a better quality of life together with her.

loans.use: to improve his restaurant, in order to increase his income and one day buy a home for his mother

loans.name: Mahammad Shg Group

texts.en: Mahammad Self Help Group is an exemplary group. They all are engaged in different activities to earn their livelihoods. Some of them are engaged in agricultural activities, some are running a grocery shop, some sell vegetables, and some have a wood business. One person who deserves to be highlighted is Alia, a 23-year-old married woman with one son, who is engaged in cultivating vegetables and selling them in the market. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Alia. Through her job, she works to support her family, to improve her business and to continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. She is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other vegetables and fruits to continue to increase her sales. The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: To  purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc

loans.name: Sibani Shg Group

texts.en:
Kastruri is a 41-year-old lady living with her husband and two children. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Kastruri. 

She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has a few cows and buffalos. She sells five litres of milk per day and earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. Her monthly income is very small for a family of four persons. 

She wants to purchase two Jersey cows for her farm, as demand for cow's milk is high in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it big. 

Kastruri, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 180,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing two cows and renovating the shed. 

In the future, she wants to increase her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for her children's future. 

All the members of this group are engaged in dairy businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and repair her cattle shed.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a married woman. She has been doing business selling milk for many years. She has five calves and two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

She has two daughters and three sons; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. 

It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she has been happily running her business through their support. Now she requests a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves that she already has. She hopes to increase in her production capacity which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for calves.

loans.name: Pedro Dimas

texts.es:
Pedro, necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar insecticidas, herbicidas, abono, plaguicidas y semilla, los cueles le servirán para seguir cultivando y teniendo granos básicos de calidad tanto para consumo familiar  como para venderlo.
Entre los buenos resultados que tuvo al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio, su cosecha fue mucho más abundante, sus clientes están satisfechos, ha cancelado su deuda, su familia tiene el mismo número de miembros y todos están saludables.
texts.en: Pedro needs a new loan to buy insecticides, weed-killers, fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, which will help him continue farming and producing quality basic grains both for his family's consumption as well as to sell. Among the positive results he had after investing his previous loan, his harvest was a lot more plentiful, his customers were satisfied, he has repaid his debt, and he still has the same number of family members who are all healthy.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, weed-killers, fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in the village of Shaqe with her husband and 13-year-old daughter. Lusine works at a local village school. She also helps her family run a farm, where they raise big livestock (cows, sheep, pigs, piglets, chickens, turkeys and 10 colonies of bees) and cultivate wheat, barley and potato. 

Lusine needs some financial means to organize the cultivation process. She wants to purchase seeds and fuel for land cultivation. She would greatly like to enlarge her agribusiness and hopes for the support of lenders. This requested loan of 1,500 USD will be a huge support for Lusine and her family and they wait for your support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, vive con su esposa, un hijo y dos nietos, trabaja de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, al realizar esta actividad obtiene los recursos económicos que necesita para salir adelante con su familia, por su experiencia en el negocio no representa dificultades para administrarlo.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar una vaca parida, fortalecerá el negocio, con los derivados de la aleche mejorará la alimentación de su familia y podrá comercializarlos. Espera mejor su situación financiera y cancelar con buen record crediticio la deuda adquirida.
El sueño del Sr.: Juan es construir un establo y una iglesia en su propiedad, para mejorar la situación en la que tiene a sus animales y aportar al desarrollo de su localidad.
texts.en:
Juan raises cattle and pigs. He lives with his wife, one son, and two grandchildren. 

He works from six in the morning until two in the afternoon; and carrying out this activity, he obtains the economic resources that he needs to maintain his family.  Because of his experience in this business, it is not difficult for him to manage.

He will use the loan to purchase a milk cow and strengthen his business with the dairy products, which he will be able to sell, as well as improve his family's diet. He hopes to improve his financial situation and pay off his debt, maintaining a good credit record.

Juan’s dream is to build a barn and a church on his property, in order to improve the conditions in which he keeps his animals, and contribute to the development of his locality.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel de 28 años de edad, dejó de estudiar debido a que su padre murió cuando él estaba pequeño, además era el hermano mayor y se vio en la obligación de trabajar para ayudar en el hogar, logró estudiar hasta 8º grado, ahora él está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios  tiene un hijo el cual está yendo a la escuela.

Miguel se ha dedicado toda su vida al cultivo de maíz, lo cual le ha proporcionado el sustento diario, él cultiva tres hectáreas de maíz y también frijol las cuales fueron heredadas por su padre cuando falleció, el lugar le queda a una distancia de 8 kilómetros  de su casa y tiene que caminar todos los días.
Él invertirá este crédito para comprar una yunta de bueyes que necesita para poder ir todos los días a sus terrenos donde cultiva el maíz y frijol además esto mejorará su calidad de vida y también hará viajes acarreando agua en una carreta que la halaran dichos bueyes, esto hará que tenga otro ingreso adicional y también podrá acarrear desde el terreno donde cultiva hasta su casa los costales de granos y se ahorrará gastos de transporte.

Su sueño es que su hijo pueda estudiar sin ningún problema y que se pueda graduar de la escuela, darle ese apoyo que su padre le dio cuando él era un niño pero que por circunstancias de la vida no pudo continuar, sabe que puede lograr sus propósitos con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 28 years old. He stopped going to school because his father died when he was young. In addition, he was the older brother, and he was obliged to work to help the household. He managed to go to school through the 8th grade. Now he is married, and his partner does the household tasks. He has a son who is going to school.

All his life, Miguel has raised corn, which has provided his daily sustenance. He cultivates three hectares of corn and also beans, which were left to him by his father when he died. His land is at a distance of 8 kilometers from his house, and he has to walk every day. 

He will invest this loan in buying a team of oxen, which he needs to be able to go every day to his land where he raises corn and beans. In addition, this will improve his quality of life, and he will also make trips hauling water in a cart that these bulls will pull. This will give him another income, and he will also be able to haul the sacks of grain to his house from the land where he grows it, and he will save on transportation costs.

His dream is for his son to go to school with no problems and to graduate from school, and to give him this support that his father gave him when he was a boy but due to life circumstances was not able to continue. He knows that he can accomplish his plans with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 52-year-old married woman. She has dealt in business, selling cloth in her locality, for the past three years. She buys cloth of different fabrics, in various colors and designs, from the market at wholesale rates and then sells it to the people of her community. She has a diverse customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and expand her inventory.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Jaya

texts.en:
Jaya is 44 years old and a married woman from the small village of Sahebpara in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Her husband Ajay is 49 years old and a farmer by profession.  Both are illiterate. They just know how to sign their names.  Jaya is a housewife and her husband grows vegetables on their small land. They have only one son. He has been deprived of receiving a nominal education due to their poverty.  So he now works as a car driver.

The income from their agribusiness is too little to give enough financial sustenance to the family. Her husband tries his best to grow more vegetables in order to earn more profit. Jaya has come forward to help her husband.  They have decided to start the cultivation of paddy.  She has taken a loan to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers to grow more paddy rice in her field. For a better quality rice, better fertilizers and better pesticides are required. So with this loan, they will cultivate a greater quality of paddy rice and sell it in the market to earn more.  Jaya hopes she will run the family smoothly with the profit from her business.  She dreams that she will be a good entrepreneur in the future by cultivating rice in her own field.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing paddy.

loans.name: Henry Paul

texts.es: Henry es un joven de 18 años de edad él vive con su abuelita y con un tío, se aparto de su madre debido a que este joven tiene 3 hermanos y a su madre no le alcanzaba el dinero para mantenerlos a todos, Henry termino el colegio pero  aspira reunir dinero para pagar los gastos que implican asistir a la universidad, este joven comenta que emprendió hace 6 meses la actividad de criar pollos y que le va bien, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y balanceado para dar un adecuado cuidado a sus animales, Henry espera entrar a la universidad  el próximo año.
texts.en: Henry is a young man of 18. He lives with his grandmother and an uncle. He left his mother's house because he has three siblings, and his mother couldn't make the money go far enough to support everyone. Henry finished school, but he hopes to get money together to pay the expenses that are involved in attending the university. This young man comments that six months ago he learned to raise chickens, and it is going well for him. He is going to invest the loan in purchasing chickens and balanced feed to give them adequate care. Henry hopes to enter the university next year.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Fulmala

texts.en:
Fulmala, who is 44 years old, is married and a mother of two sons who are students.  She is illiterate and could not even go to school because of her parents' poor financial condition.  She can only sign her name. Her sons are in grade 10 and grade 8, respectively.  They live in the small village of Sahapara in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Fulmala’s husband Probhat, 50 years old, is involved in agriculture.  The financial condition of the family fully depends on his agribusiness. He grows vegetables and sells them to neighbors, relatives and others. But his income is too scanty to meet all the necessary expenses of the family.  In order to increase their household income, they have decided to cultivate chilies on their farm. This crop is in good demand in their area.

Fulmala has taken a loan from BJS to purchase chili seeds as well as fertilizers to start cultivation. She is very much hopeful that the business will be a lucrative one.

Her plans and goals for the future include expanding their agribusiness for the family's wellbeing and providing a better education for their children to build a stronger career for them. As a mother, she wants to continue supporting her children as much as possible.

She gives her hearty thanks to her lenders BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating chilies.

loans.name: Dinabala

texts.en:
Dinabala is a 24-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and two school-going children in the small village of Subhashnagar in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud). Her children are in grades six and seven.  Her husband is a laborer on daily wages. Dinabala and her husband studied up to grade seven.

Dinabala's husband works under a building contractor.  He has no fixed income. He is the only earning member in the family, but he is unable to make sufficient income. They are facing an acute financial problem and he is unable to give a decent lifestyle to the family or bear the educational costs of his children.

Dinabala has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cycle-van. To generate more income, her husband will deliver goods and vegetables to market shops and will earn a livelihood for the family.  He can also rent the cycle van to others for additional income. Their high volume of work will create a steady income and it will make it possible to increase her profit and overcome the financial hurdles of the family.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van

loans.name: Feride

texts.en:
The borrower Feride is a married mother of six children - five girls and one boy. She is a very hardworking woman who loves to work and contribute to the family but she never succeeded in becoming employed and finding a job.  

Since Feride didn’t have an opportunity to work, she has always helped her husband in his private auto mechanic business. He is very popular and well known in the area for the different services he completes and paint jobs he does on vehicles. They are often busy and Feride often cleans his workshop assisting in other areas as needed. His business has been successful enough that he has been able to support his family on the income and provide for their daily needs. 

Feride is now asking for a loan in order to purchase materials for her husband’s shop. In the future, they are hoping that they will continue to grow and expand and be able to afford to save money for a better future. They are grateful for all Kiva Lenders and their support.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband’s shop

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 54 years old and she lives in Vanadzor City in the Lori region. She is not married and lives with her retired mother. Anahit graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of Armenian Language and Literature. She has 30 years of pedagogical experience and until now, she has worked at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. She also has pupils whom she prepares for the entrance examination. As she says, since she has no family and no children, her pupils have become very important to her. She loves and cares for their education like they were her own children; she is happy for their successes and helps them to overcome their difficulties in the educational process.

Anahit wants to organize her teaching process properly and be aware of new teaching techniques. That is why she is asking for a loan that she will use to buy professional literature about teaching methodology and technology, and their uses in the teaching process.

loans.use: to buy professional literature about teaching methodology and technology

loans.name: Laxmirani

texts.en:
Laxmirani is 38 years old and lives in the remote village of Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband Ramananda, 45 years old, and one son.  She completed her education up to grade seven at the village school. Her husband studied up to grade eight. Their only son could not get an elementary education due to their poor economic condition. So now he is engaged in his father's business.

Laxmirani's husband is a farmer by profession. He cultivates different crops in his field. Laxmirani is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, who provides loans to rural women. She plans to buy a dairy cow.  She will sell milk to earn more and give financial support to her family through this business. 

Her dream is to have more dairy cattle to enhance her business and secure their future. She is thankful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for funding their loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start selling milk

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is married and a rural woman of 36 years.  She is from the small village of Anandanagar in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives in her own house with her husband Kamal, 41 years old, and two children (one son and one daughter) who are students in grade 10.  Her husband is involved in a small business.

Baby is a housewife. Her husband runs a small shop selling stationary items, which does not run well.  He can't purchase the necessary items that the  customers demand because of a lack of capital. They have, therefore, decided to do some additional business to cover the basic needs of the family.
Baby is a very enterprising and hardworking woman, who wants to get ahead in life.  She has decided to start a firewood business.  She plans to collect firewood from her own village and the neighboring villages. She will sell the firewood to the people in her locality where firewood is widely used as fuel.  She hopes this business will help her to earn additional income.

Baby has taken a loan from BJS to purchase firewood to start her business. Her dreams are to upgrade their poor financial condition, well educate their children and enhance her business.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 31-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Mariatu runs a retail business, selling palm oil for resale. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business ten hours per day, six days per week. Mariatu says that the business is doing well because out of the profit, she is able to take care of her home.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business selling milk to the people of her community. Over time, Razia has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts on a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Razia's husband is employed in a textile mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra money to contribute to the family income.  

Razia is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to purchase one more cow. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Gzim

texts.en:
Gzim is 42 years old. He and his wife have eight children and live in the Ashakli minority community in Kosovo. In order to make a living and provide for his family, his main source of income comes from selling used shoes and clothing for all types of men, women and children in a local market. He is able to purchase these used items at a low price and then sell them at a profit in the market. 

Gzim is very satisfied with the income he generates from this business and is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothing to sell. He hopes that with the increase of merchandise he purchases with the loan, he will be able to increase his profit even more. It is often difficult to be able to provide for such a large family. He knows that without the loan he would not be able to purchase additional items, making it hard for him to improve his standard of living. He would like to thank all of the lenders and appreciates the help.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of fertilizers, plant food etc., to fertilize her crops and maintain healthy coffee plants.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 44 years old and married.  She lives in the small village of Anandanagar in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband is 51 years old.  Anita and her husband Suresh both have a primary education.  They have only one son. Anita could not provide an education for her son due to poverty. He works as a mason under a building contractor to earn bread for his family.

Her husband is involved in a clothing business.  He purchases clothes from wholesalers and sells to his clients. Unfortunately, Anita’s husband and son cannot give enough financial sustenance to the family with their small income.

Anita stitches different types of bags and sells them in the local markets.  Her husband helps her to do this work.  She has chosen this business because it is profitable and the bags are in good demand in the market.  Anita has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) so that she can purchase more materials to make bags to sell in the market.  By selling the bags, the earnings are good and they are running their family.  She hopes that in the future, with the profit from the business, she will be able to open a bag shop in the market. She aspires to enhance her business so that she can secure her son's future.

She is very much grateful and thankful to BJS and Kiva for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make bags
